and be designated the ordinances leavenworth kansas and may be so cited such also be cited as the leavenworth     state law reference revision and codification of ordinances ksa 123014123016 definitions and rules of construction a in the construction of this of all ordinances and resolutions passed by the city commission the rules set out in this chapter shall be observed and the definitions prescribed in this chapter shall apply unless such construction would be inconsistent with the manifest intent of the city commission b the provisions of this be liberally construed to affect the purposes expressed therein or implied from the expressions thereof in case of doubt or ambiguity in the meaning of such provisions the general shall yield to the particular reference for interpretation and construction shall tend to further the accomplishment of the elimination of the particular mischiefs for which the provisions were enacted words shall be construed according to the context and the approved usage of the language but technical words and phrases and such others as may have acquired a peculiar and appropriate meaning in law shall be construed according to such meaning city the term the city or this city means the city of leavenworth in the county of leavenworth and state of kansas city commission the term city commission means the city commission of the city of leavenworth kansas city officers departments etc whenever reference is made to an officer department commission or other agency such reference shall be construed as if followed by the words of the city of leavenworth kansas term  or this  means this the term county or this county means the county of leavenworth kansas delegation of authority whenever a provision appears requiring or authorizing the head of a department or officer of the city to do some act or perform some duty it shall be construed to authorize such department head or officer to designate delegate and authorize subordinates to do the required act or perform the required duty unless the terms of the provision designate otherwise fee schedule the term fee schedule means the official consolidated list of city rates fees and changes on file in the office of the city clerk gender a word importing the masculine gender only shall extend and be applied to females and to firms partnerships associations and corporations as well as to males joint authority words purporting to give authority to three or more officers or other persons shall be construed as giving such authority to a majority of such officers or other persons unless it is otherwise declared kar the abbreviation kar means the kansas administrative regulations as amended ksa the abbreviation ksa means the kansas statutes annotated as amended land  real estate  real property the term land and the phrases real estate and real property mean and include lands tenements and hereditaments and all rights thereto and interest therein equitable as well as legal month the term month means a calendar month number any word importing the singular number shall include the plural and any word importing the plural number shall include the singular oath the term oath means and includes an affirmation in all cases in which by law an affirmation may be substituted for an oath and in such cases the terms swear and sworn shall be equivalent to the terms affirm and affirmed or and the term or may be read and and the term and may be read or if the sense requires it term ordinance means a legislative act of the city commission of a general and permanent nature parkings the term parkings means the area between the roadway and rightofway line person the term person shall extend and be applied to corporations firms partnerships and bodies politic and corporate as well as to individuals the term person includes unincorporated clubs sororities fraternities associations and organizations of whatever name and nature where criminal prosecution may lie the officers of any corporation shall jointly and severally be subject to prosecution as being included within the term person personal property the term personal property means and includes money goods chattels evidences of debt and things in action preceding  following the terms preceding and following mean next before and next after respectively property the term property means and includes personal property and real property resolution the term resolution means a legislative act of the city commission of a special or temporary character roadway the term roadway means that portion of a street improved designed or ordinarily used for vehicular traffic shall may the term shall is mandatory and the term may is permissive sidewalk the term sidewalk means any portion of the street between the curb or the lateral line of the roadway and the adjacent property line intended for the use of pedestrians signature or subscription the term signature or subscription means and includes a mark when a person cannot write state the term the state or this state means the state of kansas street or highway the term street or highway means and includes any highway alley street avenue or public place or square bridge viaduct underpass overpass tunnel and causeway in the city dedicated or devoted to public use tense words used in the past or present tense include the future as well as the past and present written or in writing the term written or in writing means and includes any representation of words letters or figures whether by printing or otherwise except in those cases where the written signature or mark of any person is required year the term year means a calendar year  120 124149   state law reference rules of statutory construction ksa 77201 catchlines of sections the catchlines of the several sections of this in boldface type are intended as mere catchwords to indicate the contents of the section and unless otherwise specifically provided they shall not be deemed or taken to be titles of such sections nor as any part of the section nor unless expressly so provided shall they be so deemed when any of such sections including the catchlines are amended or reenacted    history notes the history notes appearing in parentheses after sections in this not intended to have any legal effect but are merely intended to indicate the source of matter contained in the section    amendments or additions to a all ordinances passed subsequent to the passage of this amend repeal or in any way affect this be numbered in accordance with the numbering system of this printed for inclusion therein when subsequent ordinances repeal any section such repealed section may be excluded from this the omission thereof from reprinted pages whenever any ordinance expresses the intent of the city commission that it be made a part of this such ordinance is thereafter included in a supplement to this such inclusion shall have the same force and effect as if the ordinance had been included at the time of the original adoption of this the city commission b no section or sections of an ordinance shall be amended unless the amending ordinance contains the entire section or sections as amended and the section or sections amended shall be repealed c amendments to any of the provisions of this be made by amending such provisions by specific reference to the section number of this the following language that section _____ of the ordinances city kansas is hereby amended to read as follows the section as amended shall then be set out in full d if a new section not then existing in this to be added the following language shall be used that the ordinances leavenworth kansas is hereby amended by adding a section to be numbered _____ which such section reads as follows the new section shall then be set out in full    state law reference amendments to looseleaf codes ksa 123015  amendment of ordinance ksa 123004 supplementation of a by contract or by city personnel supplements to this be prepared and printed whenever authorized or directed by the city commission a supplement to this include all substantive permanent and general parts of ordinances passed by the city commission or adopted by initiative and referendum during the period covered by the supplement and all changes made thereby in this pages of a supplement shall be so numbered that they will fit properly into this will where necessary replace pages which have become obsolete or partially obsolete and the new pages shall be so prepared that when they have been inserted this be current date of the adoption of the latest ordinance included in the supplement b in preparing a supplement to this all portions of this have been repealed shall be excluded from this the omission thereof from reprinted pages c when preparing a supplement to this the codifier meaning the person authorized to prepare the supplement may make formal nonsubstantive changes in ordinances and parts of ordinances included in the supplement insofar as it is necessary to do so to embody them into a unified code for example the codifier may 1 organize the ordinance material into appropriate subdivisions  2 provide appropriate catchlines headings and titles for sections and other subdivisions of this in the supplement and make changes in such catchlines headings and titles  3 assign appropriate numbers to sections and other subdivisions to be inserted in this where necessary to accommodate new material change existing section or other subdivision numbers  4 change the words this ordinance or words of the same meaning to this chapter this article this division etc as the case may be or to sections _____ to _____ inserting section numbers to indicate the sections of this embody the substantive sections of the ordinance incorporated into this   and 5 make other nonsubstantive changes necessary to preserve the original meaning of ordinance sections inserted into this   but in no case shall the codifier make any change in the meaning or effect of ordinance material included in the supplement or already embodied in this    severability of parts of is hereby declared to be the intention of the city commission that the sections paragraphs sentences clauses and phrases of this severable and if any phrase clause sentence paragraph or section of this be held invalid or unconstitutional by the valid judgment or decree of any court of competent jurisdiction such holding shall not affect any of the remaining phrases clauses sentences paragraphs and sections of this since the same would have been enacted by the city commission without the incorporation in this any such invalid or unconstitutional phrase clause sentence paragraph or section    miscellaneous ordinances not affected by in this the ordinance adopting this be deemed to affect the validity of any of the following 1 any charter ordinance  2 any ordinance pertaining to the acquisition of property or interests in property by gift purchase devise bequest appropriation or condemnation  3 any ordinance opening dedicating widening vacating or narrowing streets avenues alleys and boulevards  4 any ordinance establishing and changing grades of streets avenues alleys and boulevards  5 any ordinance naming or changing the names of streets avenues and boulevards  6 any ordinance authorizing or directing public improvements to be made  7 any ordinance creating districts for public improvements of whatsoever kind or nature  8 any ordinance levying general taxes  9 any ordinance levying special assessments or taxes  10 any ordinance granting any rights privileges easements or franchises therein mentioned to any person  11 any ordinance authorizing the issuance of bonds and other instruments of indebtedness by the city  12 any ordinance authorizing contracts  13 any ordinance establishing the limits of the city or pertaining to annexation or exclusion of territory  14 any ordinance relating to compensation of officials officers and employees of the city  15 any zoning ordinance  provided that the enumeration of exceptions set out in this section shall not be held or deemed to be exclusive it being the purpose and intention to exempt from repeal any and all ordinances not of a general nature and general ordinances specifically excepted by this section    not affect prior offenses rights etc nothing in this the ordinance adopting this affect any offense or act committed or done or any penalty or forfeiture incurred or any contract or right established or accruing before the effective date of this    general penalty for violation of   continuing violations whenever in this in any ordinance of the city an act is prohibited or is made or declared to be unlawful or an offense or a misdemeanor or whenever in such ordinance the doing of any act is required or the failure to do any act is declared to be unlawful and no specific penalty is provided therefor the violation of any such provision of this any such ordinance shall be punished by a fine not exceeding $50000 or by imprisonment for a period not exceeding six months or by both such fine and imprisonment as may be just for any one offense recoverable with costs of suit together with judgment of imprisonment until the fine and costs are paid or satisfied each day any violation of this of any ordinance shall continue shall constitute a separate offense    state law reference penalty provisions for incorporating ordinances ksa 123011  jurisdiction of municipal courts ksa 124104 applicability of state law relative to misdemeanors the provisions of the laws of the state relating to misdemeanors with reference to defense and construction of terms insofar as such provisions relate to and are applicable shall apply to this    state law reference kansas criminal ksa 215101 et seq administration article i  in general secs 21218  reserved article ii  city commission footnotes  1  state law reference authority for commissionmanager plan ksa 12184b3 121039 division 1  generally composition  election  term of office a form of government the city continues to operate under the commissionmanager form of government pursuant to ksa 12184b and pursuant to all existing ordinances and charter ordinances relating to its form of government the city commission shall consist of five commissioners who are residents and qualified electors of the city to be elected to terms set forth herein b elections of commissioners general elections shall be held on the tuesday following the first monday in november of each oddnumbered year all elections for the city shall be nonpartisan c terms of office the terms of each commissioner position with terms that would have expired in january 2020 shall expire the first tuesday in december 2019 when the commissioners elected in general election take office the terms of each commission position with terms that would have expired in january 2022 shall expire the first tuesday in december 2021 when the commissioners elected in the november 2021 general election take office at each regular city election there shall be elected two commissioners for a fouryear term and one commissioner for a twoyear term the candidates receiving the largest and second largest number of votes shall be elected for fouryear terms and the candidate receiving the third largest number of votes shall be elected for a twoyear term commencing the first tuesday in december following certification of the election d candidacy for city commission in accordance with ksa 25205 and amendments thereto any person may become a candidate for city office elected at large by having had filed on their behalf a nomination petition or a declaration of candidacy accompanied by any fee required by law not later than  noon on june 1 prior to such primary election or if such date falls on saturday sunday or a holiday then before  noon on the next following day that is not a saturday sunday or holiday if filing by nomination petition such petition must be signed by 50 qualified electors of the city or not less than one percent of the ballots cast and counted at the last general city election whichever is less e city manager the city commission shall appoint a city manager to be responsible for the administration and affairs of the city the city manager shall serve at the pleasure of the city commission the city manager shall see that all laws and ordinances are enforced the city manager shall appoint and remove all heads of departments and all subordinate officers and employees of the city all appointments shall be made upon merit and fitness alone  1 6252019 state law reference form of government continued ksa 12184a powers generally all powers exercised by cities of the first class or which shall be conferred upon such cities shall be exercised by the city commission insofar as they do not conflict with the provisions of the statues relating to the commissionermanager form of government    no title distinctions between commissioners  compensation regulations relating to the commissioners of the city shall include the following 1 no distinction shall be made in the title or duties among the commissioners except as the board shall organize itself for business 2 the commissioners shall be entitled to receive and be reimbursed for any reasonable expenses incurred as a result of trips or efforts made on behalf of the city 3 each commissioner shall receive a $5000 per month technology allowance to be used on technology costs of their choosing to include but not limited to the cost of internet and phone 4 each commissioner shall receive a salary of $600000 per year payable in monthly installments provided that the commissioner chosen as chairperson annually who shall have the title of mayor shall be paid $720000 during the year of office payable in monthly installments      12122017 state law reference authority of city commission to establish powers and duties of city commission and city manager ksa 12184b mayor and mayor pro tem the city commission shall choose its chairperson annually and the chairperson shall have the title of mayor during the year of office to the end that the city shall have an official head on formal occasions the city commission shall also choose a vicechairperson annually and the vicechairperson shall have the title of mayor pro tem during the year of office to the end that the city shall have an official head on all formal occasions in the absence of the duly elected mayor    determination of offices and fixing of salaries the city commission shall provide for such offices as shall be necessary to carry out the provisions of the state statutes relating to the commissionmanager plan of government and determine salaries for such offices    members not to interfere with conduct of departments no members of the city commission shall directly interfere with the conduct of any department except at the express direction of the city commission    secs 225251  reserved division 2  procedure meetings a regular meetings the regular meetings of the city commission shall ordinarily be held in the commission chambers of the city hall building on the second and fourth tuesdays of each month at  pm b special meetings special meetings will be held only for a special purpose special meetings may be called by the mayor or the city manager specifying the object and purpose of such meeting which request shall be read at a meeting and entered into the minutes c work sessions and study sessions no agenda is required for a work or study session and no binding action may be taken during the work or study session d adjournment regular or special meetings of the city commission may be adjourned for the completion of its business at such subsequent time and place as the city commission shall determine in its motion to adjourn e cancellation or modification the city commission may cancel or modify any ordinarily established meetings by motion and approval by a majority of a quorum at any regularly scheduled or special meeting notwithstanding the foregoing the mayor and in the absence of the mayor the mayor pro tem after consulting with the city manager shall be authorized to cancel a meeting and make a temporary change in a meeting date when such actions are reasonably necessary due to reasons of health safety or welfare or the known inability to obtain a quorum appropriate notice of such cancellation or change in meeting date shall be provided to the public and commission members f public comment if public comment is allowed during the meeting the citizen desiring to comment on matters of a general nature not specific to an agenda item shall provide his name and address for the purpose of putting both in the minutes of the meeting any public comment taken on specific agenda items shall require the citizen to state his name and address for the minutes the mayor may limit the time of each citizen based upon the number of people wishing to speak and the amount of time available for the public comment portion of the meeting a   agenda a distribution prior to each regular and special meeting the city will distribute an agenda to each city commission member and it will be made available to the public at that time b setting agenda the city manager shall be in charge of setting the agenda c agenda items the mayor or city staff member may have an item placed on the agenda an item shall be added to the agenda by a city commission member provided they have a consensus of the city commission members of the public may not place an item on the agenda but may have a city commission member sponsor such an item d additions to agenda items may be added to or removed from the agenda at a regular meeting by motion approved by a majority of those city commission members present and voting no items may be added to the agenda of a special meeting e order of business at the hour appointed for the meeting the mayor shall call the meeting to order upon having a quorum present the city commission shall proceed to business which shall be conducted in the order set by the city commission f consent agenda by majority vote of the city commission any item may be removed from the consent agenda and considered separately g order of business suspended or amended by a majority vote of the city commission the order of business may be amended to add or delete sections as appropriate or may be suspended in its entirety to consider other matters executive sessions may be held at any time in the order of business b   motions a second all motions require a second before such motion may be considered b debate all motions are debatable unless otherwise noted in the section governing that motion c motions only one main motion may be pending on the floor at any one time it must be withdrawn or advanced to a vote before another motion is introduced d substitute motion substitute motions are prohibited motions must be withdrawn or advanced before another motion is introduced e motion to amend a motion to amend is in order when the proposal is to change add or delete words from the main motion if the motion is to amend a document before voting on its adoption it is advisable to reduce the change to writing but it is not required if all members of the city commission understand the amendment a vote on an amendment is not a final vote on the underlying motion to pass the underlying motion requires a vote f motion to pass an ordinance all ordinances of the city shall be considered at a public meeting of the city commission except as otherwise herein provided or when state law provides a different procedure for an ordinance for a specific purpose upon second consideration the mayor shall call the roll of yeas and nays which shall be entered in the minutes by the city clerk no ordinance shall contain more than one subject which shall be clearly expressed in its title and no section of an ordinance shall be amended unless the amending ordinance contains the entire section as amended and the section amended shall be repealed consideration of ordinances cannot be passed on the date of introduction with exception of emergencies the city commission shall determine and declare an emergency by a majority vote g motion to refer if the city commission deems it appropriate it may refer an ordinance resolution contract or other matter back to staff committee board or other appropriate location for further review and consideration such motion may or may not contain a time certain for the item to be returned to the city commission h motion to reconsider  prohibited motions to reconsider are prohibited any city commission member may make a new motion on a matter previously considered by the city i motion to call the previous question this motion is not debatable and if passed by a majority of the city commission calls for an immediate vote on the motion this motion requires a vote j motion to go into executive session upon formal motion made seconded and carried the city commission may recess but not adjourn open meetings for closed or executive meetings such motion shall be in compliance with ksa 754319a any motion to recess for a closed or executive meeting shall include a statement describing the subjects to be discussed during the closed or executive meeting the justification for closing the meeting and the time and place at which the open meeting shall resume the complete motion shall be recorded in the minutes of the meeting and shall be maintained as a part of the permanent records of the city discussion during the closed or executive meeting shall be limited to those subjects stated in the motion k motion to adjourn to a later date and time if the city commission is unable to complete its agenda during the time allotted for the meeting the meeting may be adjourned to a time and date certain to continue the regular or special meeting the motion shall state the time place and date for the meeting to reconvene if the motion is adopted the meeting is adjourned to the specified time place and date l motion to adjourn at the conclusion of the agenda a motion to adjourn is in order and requires a majority vote c 234     1182016 voting a form and vote all votes shall be by voice vote or in the alternative the mayor may request that a vote be by show of hands no vote shall be by secret ballot b division the mayor or any member may request a formal division of vote at the discretion of the mayor division may be by either a poll of each member of a show of hands c duty to vote members of the city commission have a duty to vote unless such member declares a conflict of interest or other conflict that appears to make voting on an issue improper any member who declares a conflict of interest must state for the purpose of its inclusion in the minutes the reason for the conflict of interest and step down from the dais this action does not result in a vote being recorded for the member declaring a conflict of interest d votes  nonordinance matters unless otherwise specifically required by law the adoption or rejection of resolutions and other motions shall be by a majority of those present any member who abstains from voting for any reason other than set in subsection c of this section shall be counted as having voted against the motion e recording upon final passage of a matter the vote shall be recorded in the minutes f recording  ordinary ordinance  commission city the adoption of an ordinary ordinance requires affirmative votes of the commission g recording  charter ordinance  commission city the adoption of a charter ordinance requires affirmative votes of the commission eg this is a twothirds vote four members of a five member commission h recording  commission city the mayor has a vote on all matters the mayor does not have a second vote to break a tie appointments in commission cities are by motion second and a vote d   procedural issues not covered to be decided by majority vote for those matters not covered by this division or other rules promulgated hereunder the procedure shall be as decided by a majority vote of the city commission e   amendments these rules may be amended after adoption by a subsequent ordinance amending specific rules as identified in the ordinance such ordinance amends the adopting ordinance the rules may not be suspended by the city commission during any meeting e   printing publication of legal notices and advertisements  affidavit of publication a the official city newspaper and of any other newspaper that shall print or publish for the city any legal notice or advertisement that is required by law or ordinance to be printed or published for a specified time to file in the office of the city clerk an affidavit of the printer foreman or principal clerk of such paper or other person knowing the same stating the number of times that such notice or advertisement has been printed in such newspaper giving the dates thereof and attaching to such affidavit a copy of the notice or advertisement it shall be the duty of the city clerk to file such affidavit and safely keep such affidavit among the records in the city clerks office such affidavit shall be prima facie evidence of the publication and printing of such notice or advertisement in the manner and for the times stated in such affidavit b no person shall receive pay for the publishing or printing of any legal notice or advertisement nor shall any bill for the printing or publishing of such legal notice or advertisement be audited or allowed until the affidavit provided for in this section has been filed in the city clerks office c any person who shall by direction or order of the city commission print or publish any notice order citation summons ordinance resolution advertisement or other proceedings of the city commission required by law to be printed or published in any newspaper shall receive full compensation therefor not to exceed the amount of compensation fixed by state law for such publications  2263   state law reference publication of ordinances ksa 123007  rates for newspaper notices ksa 28137 751018 secs 259289  reserved article iii  officers and employees division 1  generally organizational structure of city  annual review a the affairs of the city shall be administered by the officers and employees of the designated administrative divisions as may be annually established by the city manager the city commission shall annually review the administrative organization of the city concurrent with its adoption of the city budget and approve or disapprove such organizational structure b the city commission shall annually review the administrative organization of the city concurrent with the adoption of the city budget as prepared by the city manager upon approval of the budget the city manager shall provide to all departments of the city an outline of the approved administrative organization of the city  255   personnel policies and procedures all personnel policies and procedures will be governed by the city of leavenworth personnel manual on file in the office of the city clerk and the city human resources office    10232018 appointments a all officers and employees shall be appointed by the city manager except as otherwise provided by state law or other city ordinances all appointments shall be based solely on merit and fitness appointed officers shall include but shall not be limited to the city clerk city attorney city treasurer municipal judge police chief and city engineer b the city manager is authorized to act as and to perform the duties of any office for which such manager is qualified  and may appoint one person to perform the duties of more than one office or employee provided that the duties of such office are not incompatible and such combined duties are not prohibited by law or other ordinances    state law reference authority of city manager to appoint and remove subordinate officers and employees ksa 121040 classified service the classified service of the city shall include all positions in the city service except for the following 1 elected officials  2 the city manager city attorney municipal judge and public defender  3 persons serving the city as independent contractors  4 persons retained by the city as consultants  5 temporary employees  or 6 time boards and commissions      10242017 officers oath all officers of the city whether elected or appointed either under the laws of the state or ordinances of the city shall before entering upon the duties of their respective offices take and subscribe an oath or affirmation as follows i do solemnly swear or affirm as the case may be that i will support the constitution of the united states and the constitution of the state of kansas and faithfully discharge the duties of ___________here enter name of office so help me god    state law reference form of oath ksa 54106  when oath of municipal employees is required ksa 754308 appeal of adverse administrative rulings except to the extent a right of appeal is otherwise set forth in this in which case any appeal shall be undertaken in accordance with the procedures set forth therein any administrative ruling order or decision made by any officer or employee of the city including but not limited to denial or revocation of permits and licenses which adversely affect any person may be appealed by such person to the city commission in writing within ten days following the adverse ruling order or decision a hearing shall be scheduled by the city commission within ten days following the written appeal the decision of the city commission on such appeal shall be final and conclusive    bonds a when required  amount the city manager and such officers as the city commission may require shall each before entering upon the duties of their respective offices give a good and sufficient surety company bond to the city approved by the city commission in the amount specified in this section or as shall be required by the city commission conditioned upon the officers faithful performance and faithful discharge of the officers respective duties the bond for each commissioner shall be $1000000 the bond for the city treasurer shall be $5000000 the bond for the city manager shall be $5000000 the bond for all other employees of the city will be covered by a faithful performance blanket position bond in the amount of $500000 b to be executed by surety company all bonds provided for in this division shall be signed and executed by some responsible surety company lawfully doing business in the state  no bond signed and executed by any individual as surety will be accepted or approved c approval all bonds provided for in this division shall be submitted to and approved by the city attorney and such bonds shall also be approved by the city commission the mayor shall endorse the approval of all official bonds by the board the bonds of the mayor and commissioners shall be approved by the judge of the county district court and shall also be approved by the city attorney and city commission d cost to be borne by city on all bonds of officers employees and appointees of the city for the faithful discharge of their duties which are or may be required either by the laws of the state or the ordinances of the city the premium or cost of such bonds shall be borne by the city 68   state law reference official corporate surety bonds ksa 78111  treasurers bond ksa 13526a secs 2972120  reserved division 2  city manager footnotes  2  state law reference city manager plan ksa 121039 appointment  term the administration of the citys business shall be in the hands of the city manager who shall be appointed by the city commission and shall hold office at the pleasure of the city commission    state law reference appointment of city manager ksa 121040 qualifications the city manager shall be chosen solely on the basis of administrative ability    duties and functions a the city manager shall be responsible for the administration of all the affairs of the city  shall see that all laws and ordinances are enforced  and shall appoint and remove all heads of departments and all subordinate officers and employees of the city b the city manager shall be responsible for the discipline of all appointive officers and may without notice cause the affairs of any department or the conduct of any officer or employee to be examined  shall prepare and submit the annual budget to the city commission and keep the city commission fully advised as to the financial conditions and needs of the city  shall make recommendations to the city commission on all matters concerning the welfare of the city and shall have a seat but no vote in all of the public meetings of the city commission    state law reference powers of city manager ksa 121040 preparation of wage and employee classification schedule  payrolls the city manager shall prepare a wage schedule and employee classification which shall be presented to the city commission the city manager shall at the time of preparing the annual budget incorporate the established wage schedule into the budget so as to provide compensation for the employees of each department for the budget year the city manager shall every other week or once each month cause to be prepared payrolls in accordance with the current budget and the established wage schedule    274     1282015   5102016 secs 21252148  reserved article iv  boards commissions committees and similar bodies division 1  generally policy for declaring vacancy on advisory boards  appointment of successor a upon any member of an advisory board subject to appointment by the city commission failing to attend three regular meetings within any one calendar year the chairperson of the board shall notify the mayor by delivering to the city clerk in writing the title of the board the name of the individual and the dates of the meetings missed the city clerk shall cause the matter to be placed on the agenda for consideration of the city commission at the next regular meeting following the sevenday notice period as hereinafter provided b the city clerk shall upon receipt of the written notice from the chairperson of the board under this section notify the individual of the date and time of the meeting at which such matter shall be considered by the city commission c at the time of consideration of a vacancy under this section the mayor by and with the consent of the city commission may declare a vacancy existing and proceed to appoint a successor for the remaining term of the vacant position by majority vote the city commission may continue the consideration of the vacancy or the appointment of a successor    cable television advisory committee the city commission shall act as the cable television advisory committee the mission of the cable television advisory committee shall be to act in accordance with the guidelines outlined in the city governmental access channel capacity guidelines for utilization action required of the cable television advisory committee shall be conducted by the city commission during the regular city commission meetings 180   282011 secs 21512168  reserved division 2  airport advisory board boards purpose the city has created an airport advisory board to make reports and recommendations to the city commission relating to the efficient and effective operation of the airfield as follows 1 to make recommendations to the city commission regarding airport facility maintenance 2 to make recommendations regarding airport operations 3 to make recommendations regarding capital improvement need including but not limited to facilities such as the apron fuel facilities hangers office space and maintenance facilities 4 to make recommendations pertaining to signage 5 to review the current fixedbase operator contract and services being provided and make recommendations pertaining to the current and future contracts 6 to explore the possibility of federal aviation administration funding assistance for airport improvement    12212004 composition  appointment the airport advisory board shall consist of one member who shall be recommended by the installation commander at fort leavenworth and appointed by the mayor by and with the consent of the commissioner who shall serve as a nonvoting liaison from the fort and seven members who shall be appointed by the mayor by and with the consent of the commission who shall be voting members the city manager and public works director shall be support staff to the board the assistant city manager shall attend all board meetings and shall keep and publish minutes of the board meetings    12212004 terms of service in appointing the seven voting members of the airport advisory board the mayor shall designate three to serve twoyear terms and four to serve threeyear terms terms of all subsequent appointees shall be for three years    12212004 compensation the members of the airport advisory board shall serve without pay    12212004 removal of members each member of the airport advisory board shall be removable for cause by the recorded vote of a majority of the voting members of the city commission after a public hearing any member of the board failing to attend four successive regular meetings without cause acceptable and approved by the remaining board members shall be thereby automatically removed from the board and the vacancy shall be appointed by the mayor for the balance of the term    12212004 organization the mayor shall appoint the initial chairperson of the board who shall serve in that capacity for a period of one year thereafter the committee shall annually elect one of its members to act as chairperson the board may adopt the rule and bylaws of its meetings    12212004 meeting frequency the board shall meet as needed at a time and place which is mutually agreeable to the members    12212004 secs 21762203  reserved division 3  sister city advisory board established  membership  terms  compensation a the city has created and established a board of the city to be known as the sister city advisory board hereafter board the to attend four successive regular meetings without cause acceptable and approved by the remaining committee members shall be thereby automatically removed from the committee and the vacancy shall be reappointed by the mayor 45   12212004 organization the mayor shall appoint the initial chairperson of the deer management advisory committee who shall serve in this capacity for a period of one year division shall be used insofar as possible to relieve the ad valorem tax levies of the city    sale or transfer if in order to maintain sufficient moneys on demand in any fund from which investments and on behalf of the city any such transfers or sales shall be reported in writing to the city commission at its next regular meeting    custody and safekeeping securities purchased pursuant to this redemption transfer or withdrawal shall be permitted only upon the written instruction of at least two city officers securities not held in the custody of a bank or trust company shall be personally deposited by such officers in a safety deposit box in the name of the city in a bank or trust company access to which shall be permitted only in the personal presence and under the signature of at municipal equipment reserve fund footnotes  5  state law reference municipal equipment reserve fund ksa 121117 established in accordance with the provisions of ksa 121117 the city has established a municipal equipment reserve fund to finance the acquisition of equipment    equipment described for the purposes of this division equipment shall include machinery vehicles and any other equipment or personal property including but not limited to computer hardware and software which the city is authorized to purchase for municipal purposes    purpose and intent it is the policy objective of the city that such equipment reserve fund shall be used as a financing mechanism to secure the planned and orderly acquisition and replacement of equipment necessary for the efficient and effective operation of the city it is the intent of the city commission to annually approve the budgeting of current revenues sufficient to finance the acquisition of new equipment needed in the following year and finance needed future replacements and acquisitions by setting aside a reserve account    equipment acquisition program the city manager shall annually submit at the same time the proposed annual budget is submitted a proposed equipment acquisition program for each of the following three years the proposed budget shall include an amount sufficient to finance proposed equipment acquisitions for the following year plus an amount to be reserved as set forth in the annually revised and extended equipment acquisition program    budget reporting requirements moneys credited to the equipment reserve fund from annually budgeted transfers shall not thereafter be subject to the provisions of ksa 792925792937 inclusive and amendments thereto  however in preparing the budgets of the city the amounts credited to and the amount on hand in such equipment reserve fund and the amount expended therefrom shall be shown thereon for the information of the taxpayers of the city    investment of moneys in fund moneys in the equipment reserve fund may be invested in accordance with provisions of ksa 10131 and amendments thereto with interest thereon credited to such fund    transfer of moneys not needed for fund purposes if the city commission determines that money which has been credited to the equipment reserve fund or any part thereof is not needed for the purposes for which so budgeted or transferred the city commission may transfer by adoption of a resolution such amount not needed to the fund from which it came and such transfer and expenditure thereof shall be subject to the budget requirement provisions of ksa 792925792937 inclusive and amendments thereto    secs 24062423  reserved division 4  capital improvements fund footnotes  6  state law reference capital moneys shall be credited to the capital improvements fund except as may be budgeted annually or transferred by the annual budget from other funds in making the budget the amounts credited to and the amount on hand in such special fund and the amount expended therefrom shall be shown thereon for the information of the taxpayers of the city although such funds are not subject to the provisions of ksa 792925792937 inclusive and amendments thereto    investment of moneys in fund moneys in the capital improvements fund may be invested in accordance with the provisions of ksa 10131 and amendments thereto with interest thereon credited to such fund    capital improvements program the city manager shall annually submit at the same time the proposed annual budget is submitted a proposed capital improvements program for each of the following three years the proposed program shall include an amount sufficient to finance proposed capital improvements for the following year    transfer of moneys not needed for fund purposes if the city commission determines that money which has been transferred to the capital improvements fund or any part thereof is not needed for the purposes for which so transferred the city commission by adoption of a resolution may transfer such amounts not needed to the general or other fund from which it was derived and such transfer and expenditure thereof shall be subject to the budget requirement provisions of ksa 792925792937 inclusive and amendments thereto    requirement regarding tax levy for use of fund any general property tax specifically levied for
