commission has been provided b right of and request for hearing if the enforcement officer determines that a license is subject to suspension or revocation he shall notify the license holder in writing stating the reason the license is subject to suspension or revocation and advising that the license shall be temporarily suspended at the end of 30 days following service of the notice unless a request for a hearing is filed with the city clerk by the license holder within ten days c hearings  final decision hearings under this section shall be conducted by the city commission at a time and place designated by the commission after hearing the commission shall make findings and sustain modify or rescind the suspension or revocation a written report of the final decision shall be furnished to the license holder by the city clerk h j   8142012 reinspection  request for reinstatement of suspended license any person whose license has been suspended may at any time make written application for a reinspection for the purpose of reinstatement of the license within ten days following receipt of a written request for reinspection including a statement signed by the applicant that in his opinion the conditions causing suspension of the license have been corrected the enforcement officer shall make a reinspection if the applicant has corrected all violations and is in full compliance with this article the license shall be reinstated i   8142012 variance where upon written application of the responsible person to the city commission finds that by reason of exceptional circumstances strict conformity with any provisions of the standards of this article would cause undue hardship or would be unreasonable impractical or not feasible under the circumstances the city commission may refer a variance request to the state department of agriculture for review remedial action will then be taken upon such conditions and within such time limitation as the department may prescribe for prevention control or abatement of any problem affecting the public health in harmony with the intent of local state and federal law    8142012 plan review of future construction when a lodging establishment is constructed or extensively remodeled or when an existing structure is converted for use as a lodging establishment properly prepared plans and specifications for such construction remodeling or alteration showing layout arrangement and construction materials of work areas and the location size and type of fixed equipment and facilities shall be submitted to the city for approval before such work is begun no such construction or remodeling shall commence until after the approval of the city shall have been given    8142012 circumvention no person shall cause or permit the installation or use of any device of any means which without resulting in correction of a public health problem conceals a violation of the standards    8142012 penalty any person who shall violate this article shall be subject to a fine of $50000 and may be enjoined from continuing such violations each day upon which such a violation occurs shall constitute a separate violation    8142012 secs 1223412259  reserved article vii  massage therapy footnotes  3  state law reference kansas healing arts act ksa 652801 et seq division 1  generally definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning accredited school means any school or institute of learning which is accredited by the state board of education or equivalent and approved by any state massagespecific license organization for schools located in states that do not accredit or approve massage therapy programs the city will consult national massage organizations such as the national certification board of therapeutic massage and bodywork and the american massage therapy association to determine if the school should be deemed accredited for purposes of this article business premises means those premises where a private or public commercial enterprise is conducted employee means any person other than massage therapists who renders any service to a licensee under this article who receives compensation from the licensee or patron establishment applicant means each individual owner if applying as an individual or a group of individuals and to each stockholdermember who owns or holds ten percent or more of the equitable interests in any corporation limited liability company partnership or other entity that applies in the name of such entity establishment representative means an employee manager independent contractor agent unpaid volunteer or anyone who works at or on behalf of a massage therapy establishment healing arts practitioner means a person licensed under ksa 652801 et seq to practice the healing arts including but not limited to the medicine and surgery osteopathic medicine and surgery or chiropractic homeoffice massage business means a massage business operated from a noncommercial location and used solely for scheduling appointments billing or other administrative purposes for an inclients office massage practice or an inclients homehotel massage business no massage therapy shall take place on the premises of the homeoffice massage business inclients homehotel massage means massage therapy conducted at a massage clients home or residence or in the guest rooms of hotels or bed and breakfast establishments as provided in this article inclients office massage means massage that is conducted on the business premises of a massage therapists massage therapy client and is limited to massage therapy applied only above the massage therapy clients waist the patron must be fully clothed massage therapist means any person who for any consideration whatsoever engages in the practice of massage as herein defined massage therapy establishment or massage establishment or establishment means any establishment where any person firm partnership association corporation trust or other type of entity or organization primarily engages in offering massage therapy services the term massage therapy establishment or massage establishment or establishment may operate from a business premises or corporate location or in the establishment licensees home subject to the requirements of this article and the development regulations of the city massage therapy or massage means any method of pressure on or friction against or stroking kneading rubbing tapping pounding vibrating or stimulation of the external soft parts of the body with the hands or with the aid of any mechanical or electrical apparatus or appliance with or without such supplementary aids as rubbing alcohol liniments antiseptics oils powders creams lotions ointments or other similar preparations commonly used in the practice the term massage therapy or massage does not include the touching in any fashion of human genitalia patron or client means any person who utilizes or receives the services of any establishment subject to the provisions of this article and under such circumstances that it is reasonably expected that he will pay money or give any other consideration therefor    12112018 reference to police chief city clerk city health officer any reference in this article to the police chief city clerk or city health officer shall include those persons designees and any individuals designated by the city manager    12112018 license required  fees except as otherwise provided in the article no person firm partnership association corporation trust or other type of entity or organization or individual shall operate a massage establishment or perform massage therapy without having first obtained the required licensespermits from the city clerk the fee for such licensespermits shall be prescribed in the city fee schedule and are not prorated refundable or transferable any application made fees paid and licenses obtained under the provision of this article shall be in addition to and not in lieu of any other fees permits or licenses required to be paid or obtained under any other ordinance of the city such license shall be valid from january 1 to december 31 of each calendar year    12112018 identification cards all massage therapy establishment owners establishment representatives and massage therapists issued a license pursuant to the provisions of this article shall at all times when working in an establishment or providing any massage service regulated by the article have in their possession a valid identification card issued by the city to include the massage therapists license number physical description and photograph such identification cards shall be laminated to prevent alteration all persons granted licenses under this article shall at all times keep their licenses available for inspection upon request of any person who by law may inspect same all licensees shall when conducting massage therapy off their business premises wear on their clothing in a conspicuous location their identification card    12112018 restriction of business to premises a all massage therapy provided for under this article shall be conducted on the business premises of a licensed massage therapy establishment provided that inclients office massage and inclients homehotel massage may be conducted under the following conditions 1 if done at the direction of a licensed healing arts practitioner  2 if done at the written request of a person who shall have provided the name and address of the requesting person and the date and time of the service when inclients office massage or inclients homehotel massage is offered whether by telephone in person or in writing the person offering such service must state clearly that he is a licensed massage therapist or that the service will be performed by a licensed massage therapist and that prior to any service being provided the person requesting the service will be required to sign a form requesting the service all such written requests shall be kept by the licensed massage therapy establishment or the licensed massage therapist as the case may be for a period of one year and shall be produced for inspection when requested by the police chief city clerk or city health inspector 3 inclients office massage and inclients homehotel massage shall not be conducted between the hours of  midnight and  am b licensed massage therapy establishments shall be operated only from commercial business premises or as a home occupation by special use permit as allowed in the development regulations of the city upon review and recommendation of the planning commission and approved by the city commission c a homeoffice massage business shall be allowed to operate in or from residential property without a special use permit with the restriction that no massage therapy shall take place on the premises a massage therapy business license shall be required no inspections are required for home office massage businesses d inclients homehotel massage is only permitted in the guest rooms of hotels and bed and breakfast establishments upon written approval of the hotel and bed and breakfast owners or managers    12112018 exceptions the provisions of this article shall not apply to hospitals nursing homes sanitariums or persons holding an unrevoked certificate to practice the healing arts persons licensed to practice as a registered professional nurse under state law persons licensed to practice as a physical therapist under state law or persons working under the direction and supervision of any licensed healing arts practitioner or in any such establishment nor shall this article apply to barbers or cosmetologists lawfully carrying out their particular profession or business and holding a valid unrevoked license or certificate or registration issued by the state    12112018 secs 1226612293  reserved division 2  licenses license required no person shall operate a massage establishment whether from business premises or as a home occupation without first having obtained a business license therefor issued by the city clerk it is unlawful to conduct such a business unless the license issued is current unrevoked and not suspended a separate license shall be required for each and every separate place of businessmassage establishment conducted by any one licensee such license shall be valid from january 1 to december 31 of each calendar year    12112018 application for massage therapy establishment license  fees a every application for a business license to maintain operate or conduct any establishment covered by this article shall file an application with the city clerk and pay 1 an annual fee as provided in the city fee schedule which shall not be prorated refundable or transferable  and 2 an annual renewal fee as provided in the city fee schedule which shall not be prorated refundable or transferable the application for a license to operate any such establishment shall set forth the exact nature of the services to be provided the proposed place of business and facilities and the name address and telephone number of each applicant b in addition any applicant for a business license shall furnish the following information 1 written proof that the applicants and any establishment representatives are at least 18 years old 2 copy of a valid government issued identification card 3 fingerprints provided for new applications and applications that have lapsed for one year or more not required for annual renewals 4 the business occupation or employment locations and contact information for each applicant and establishment representative for the three years immediately prior to the date of application 5 the massage therapy business license history of the applicant and establishment representatives  whether such person in previously operating in the city or another city or state under an establishment or therapist license has had such license revoked or suspended the reason therefor and the business activity or occupation subsequent to such suspension or revocation 6 any criminal convictions except minor traffic violations fully disclosing the jurisdiction in which convicted and the offense for which convicted and circumstances thereof 7 in the case of establishment applicants who intend to also provide massage therapy themselves the applicants must also apply for and receive a massage therapist license as provided in this article 8 authorization for the city its agents and employees to obtain consumer reports credit checks or such other background checks as may be permitted under applicable law at any time after receipt of such authorization 9 applicants for renewal of an existing license need only provide that information or documentation necessary to ensure uptodate renewal application processing    12112018 massage therapy establishment license application processing upon receipt of a complete application for a massage therapy establishment license the city clerk or police chief shall initiate a background check in addition the city clerk shall transmit a copy of the application to the city health officer as applicable it shall be the duty of the city clerk or police chief to investigate such application to determine whether the information contained in the application is accurate and whether the applicant is qualified to be issued the license it shall be the duty of the city health officer to determine whether the establishment premises meets the requirement of this article the city clerk shall verify that all zoning requirements are met all standards for premises set forth in section 12297 must be met prior to the first day the establishment opens for business the city health officer shall report the results of his investigation to the city clerk not later than ten working days from the date the application is received by the city clerk upon receipt of the reports regarding the background check and approval by the city health officer the city clerk shall issue the applicable license all license applications shall be approved or disapproved within 45 days from the date filed with the city clerks office    12112018 inspection necessary a no business shall be conducted on licensed premises until an inspection by the city health officer reveals that the establishment complies with each of the following minimum requirements 1 the walls shall be clean and painted with washable moldresistant paint in all rooms where water or steam baths are given floors shall be free from any accumulation of dust dirt or refuse all equipment used in the businesss operation shall be maintained in a clean and sanitary condition towels linen and items for personal use of operators and patrons shall be clean and freshly laundered towels cloths and sheets shall not be used for more than one patron heavy white paper may be substituted for sheets provided that such paper is changed for every patron no service or practice shall be carried on within any cubicle room booth or any area within any permitted establishment which is fitted with a door that can be locked 2 toilet facilities shall be provided in convenient locations when five or more massage establishment employees and patrons of different sexes are on the premises at the same time separate toilet facilities shall be provided 3 lavatories or washbasins provided with both hot and cold water shall be installed in either the toilet room or a vestibule lavatories or washbasins shall be provided with soap in a dispenser and with sanitary towels 4 at least one water fountain water cooler or bottled water shall be provided but shall not be located in toilet rooms or bathrooms b the city health inspector shall certify that the proposed business establishment complies with all of the requirements of this section and shall give or send such certification to the city clerk and police chief provided however that nothing contained herein shall be construed to eliminate other requirements of statutes or ordinances that relates to the maintenance of premises not to preclude authorized inspection thereof    12112018 issuance of massage therapy establishment license a after the filing of an application in the proper form the city clerk shall examine the application and after such examination shall approve the issuance of the license for a massage therapy establishment unless the city clerk finds that 1 the establishment operations as proposed by the applicant if permitted would not comply with all applicable laws to include but not limited to the citys building zoning and health regulations  2 each individual owner applicant if applying as an individual or a group of individuals or each stockholdermember who owns or holds ten percent or more of the equitable interests in any applicant that is a corporation limited liability company partnership or other entity that applies in the name of such entity or any establishment representative principally in charge of the operation of the business has been convicted of or received a diversion on a a person felony as defined by state law  b a nonperson felony as defined by state law in the seven years immediately preceding the date of the application  c any felony or misdemeanor offense involving sexual misconduct  d obscenity  e prostitution or promoting prostitution or equivalent charge  f solicitation of a lewd or unlawful act as either a felony or misdemeanor  g pandering or other sexually related offenses  h any violation of the law applicable to massage therapy arising out of the individuals prior massage establishments or individual massage therapist licenses in the seven years preceding the date of the application  3 the applicant made any false misleading or fraudulent statement of fact in the license application or in any document required by the city in conjunction therewith  4 the applicant or establishment representative has had a massage therapy establishment license massage therapy license or other similar permit or license denied revoked suspended or has voluntarily surrendered the permit or license in lieu of revocation or suspension for any of the above causes by the city or any other city state or local agency within seven years prior to the date of the application  5 any establishment applicant or establishment representative has previously been issued a license for an adult entertainment business or escort service or has been employed by any such business  6 each individual owner applicant if applying as an individual or a group of individuals or each stockholdermember who owns or holds ten percent or more of the equitable interests in any applicant that is a corporation limited liability company partnership or other entity that applies in the name of such entity or any establishment representative principally in charge of the operation of the business has not attained the age of 18 years  and 7 the manager establishment representative or other person principally in charge of the operation of the business would be ineligible to receive any license under the provisions of this article b the license shall state that it is not transferable or refundable the license shall be kept posted in an open and conspicuous place on the premises of the licensee if an application is denied the applicant shall be immediately notified by certified mail return receipt requested mailed to the lastknown mailing address of the applicant and the notice shall state the basis for the disapproval  inspection immediate right of entry the police department and city health inspector may from time to time make an inspection of each licensed establishment in the city to include those locations where an establishment conducts its business and areas where a therapist performs massage therapy to determine that the provisions of this article are complied with such inspections shall be made at reasonable times and in a reasonable manner it is unlawful for any licensee manager or representative to fail to allow such inspection officer immediate access to the premises or to hinder such officer in any manner provided further that any failure on the part of any licensee manager or representative to grant immediate access to such inspector shall be grounds for the revocation or suspension of any massage establishment license or massage therapy license    12112018 revocation or suspension of business license a any business license issued for a massage therapy establishment may be suspended or revoked by the city clerk or police chief for a violation of any of the provisions of this article or the licensee or any establishment representative was convicted of any offense which would make them ineligible to receive a license  or in any case in which the licensee or an establishment representative refused to permit or hindered any city representative to conduct any investigation or inspection provided for this article b written notice shall be sent to the person entitled to notice as stated in the business license and at the location specified in the license for notice this notice shall state the specific basis for suspension or revocation and shall notify the licensee of the licensees right to a hearing before the city manager to appeal the suspension or revocation any of the following shall establish a sufficient basis for suspension or revocation of the business license if a licensee or any of its establishment representatives 1 is convicted of any offense which is a felony the record of conviction being conclusive evidence thereof  2 supplies false information to the permit administrator or police on the application for license or licensure renewal  3 allows the use of his establishment by an unlicensed person  4 violates any zoning building or fire prevention regulation  5 uses fraudulent false misleading or deceptive advertising to describe promote or advertise any type of business activity or service which is expressly not massage therapy or has otherwise fraudulently engaged in massage therapy  6 has been convicted to include a massage therapist of any offense found in this section and section 12358 and the licensee has actual or constructive knowledge of the violation or conviction  7 conducts any illegal activities or allows them to be conducted by anyone else  8 has an arrest record for any sexual offense or violation  9 has fraudulently obtained a license pursuant to the provisions of this article  10 has ceased to meet any of the requirements for issuance of a massage therapy license or massage therapy establishment license  11 refused to permit any duly authorized police officer or city health officer to inspect the premises or operations of the licensee  12 fails to comply with all applicable laws and regulatory provisions herein c business closed and posted upon suspension or revocation of the business license the business shall cease to operate and the police chief or city clerk shall post the business as closed    12112018 appeal upon receipt of a written request delivered to the city clerk an appeal of the denial suspension or revocation shall be heard by the city manager within 30 days of the suspension or revocation the licensee may submit evidence at the hearing which is relevant and material to the specific basis for suspension or revocation the city manager shall make a final determination as to denial suspension or revocation    12112018 secs 1230212320  reserved division 3  business standard and specifications operation regulations the operation of any massage therapy establishment to include the provision of service by massage therapists shall be subject to the following regulations 1 hours such business shall be closed and operations shall cease between the hours of  midnight and  am each day  provided the hours of operation for inclients office massage may be extended for inoffice therapy conducted on premises with established evening and night shifts 2 alcoholic beverages no alcoholic beverage or cereal malt beverages nor the consumption thereof shall be allowed permitted or suffered to be done in or upon any premises licensed under the provisions of this article or during inclients office massage therapy this restriction shall not apply to establishments operating as home occupations under the development regulations provided that no alcohol is permitted in that portion of such premises where massage therapy occurs as used in this section the term that portion means physical visual and audible separation by permanently installed walls and doors between the area where massage therapy occurs and the area where alcoholic beverages or cereal malt beverages are stored or consumed 3 conduct of premises all licensees licensed under the provisions of this article shall at all times be responsible for the conduct of business on their licensed premises and for any act or conduct of his employees which constitutes a violation of the provisions of this article any violation of the city state or federal laws committed on the licensed premises by any such licensee or employee affecting the eligibility or suitability of such person to hold a license or may be grounds for suspension or revocation of same 4 every portion of a licensed establishment to include appliances and personnel shall be kept clean and operated in a sanitary condition 5 all licensed employees and massage therapists must be modestly attired diaphanous or transparent clothing is prohibited clothing must at all times cover the chest of the licensee employees or massage therapists 6 the private parts of patrons must be covered by towels cloths or undergarments when in the presence of an employee or massage therapist any contact with a patrons genital area is prohibited 7 all licensed establishments when applicable shall provide clean laundered sheets and towels in sufficient quantity and such items shall be laundered after each use thereof and stored in a sanitary manner 8 wet and dry heat rooms shower compartments and toilet rooms shall be thoroughly cleaned each day the business is in operation bathtubs or individual soak areas shall be thoroughly cleaned after each use 9 table showers are strictly prohibited 10 no individual shall reside inhabit or otherwise sleep overnight at an establishment with the exception of the licensee who operates an establishment in his home or residence as a permitted home occupation but shall not reside inhabit or sleep in the portion of the home or residence devoted to the practice of massage therapy    12112018 supervision a licensee shall have the establishment premises supervised at all times when open for business the establishment licensee or a person employed as a massage therapist shall personally supervise the business and shall not violate or permit others to violate any applicable provision of this article the violation of any such provision by any establishment representative shall constitute a violation by the employee    12112018 employee and patron register a all establishments commercial inhome and homeoffice licensed under the provisions of this article shall keep and maintain on their premises a current register of all their establishment representatives and list of such representatives names addresses and license numbers such register shall be open to inspection at all reasonable times by the city health officer or member of the police department b every person who engages in or conducts a licensed establishment shall keep a daily register of services provided and all patrons with names addresses and hours of arrival and if applicable the rooms or cubicles assigned the daily register shall at all times during business hours be subject to inspection by city officials and by the police department and shall be kept on file for one year    12112018 persons under age 18 prohibited services no licensee shall perform or permit any massage therapy to be provided to a person under the age of 18 years provided a person under the age of 18 years may utilize or receive massage therapy from a licensed massage therapist if accompanied by a parent or legal guardian and a parent or legal guardian authorized such therapy in writing    12112018 advertising no establishment granted a license under provisions of this article shall place publish or distribute or cause to be placed published or distributed any advertising matter that depicts any portion of a human body that would reasonably suggest to prospective patrons that any service is available other than those services as defined in section 12260 or that employees or massage therapists are dressed in a manner other than described in section 12321    12112018 application of existing businesses the operators of any existing massage therapy establishment must comply with all provisions of this article subject to the education and experience requirements set for the in section 12356    12112018 secs 1232712355  reserved division 4  massage therapists massage therapist license required categories educational requirement renewal and restrictions no person shall perform massage therapy inclients home massage or inclients office massage therapy within the city unless he has a valid massage therapist license issued by the city pursuant to the provision of this article it is unlawful to perform such services unless the license issued is current unrevoked and not suspended such license is not transferable or refundable and shall be valid from january 1 to december 31 of each calendar year the massage therapist license and educational requirement shall be as follows 1 successful completion of a course of instruction of not less than 500 hours in theory method or practice of massage from one or more accredited schools all practical or modality instruction must be completed as inclasshandson instruction while theory instruction may be completed online 2 proof of completion of education and training requirements must be by certified transcripts the educational training requirements required by this article may be received from more than one school one hour of instruction is defined as 50 minutes of actual instructional time 3 individuals licensed with the city as a massage therapist and holding a 2018 massage license may renew that license notwithstanding an inability or failure to satisfy the minimum education requirements set forth in subsection 1 of this section and continue to renew such license as long as there are no lapses in active licensure and the individual continues to satisfy all other requirements of this article    12112018 application for massage therapist license fees a any person who desires to perform or provide massage therapy inclients home massage  inclients office massage therapy  or to perform any massage services in a massage therapy establishment as defined therein shall file a written application with the city clerk and pay a fee as prescribed in the city fee schedule which shall not be prorated refundable or transferable and an annual renewal fee as prescribed in the city fee schedule a massage therapy license shall be valid from january 1 to december 31 of each calendar year b only one massage therapy license shall be required for a massage therapist regardless of the number of location types where he intends to practice in an establishment inclients office or inclients home c a massage therapist shall notify the city of any change in employment within 30 calendar days of the change to include a change in therapists employer or the addition or reduction of licensed establishments in which he performs massage therapy d massage therapists who themselves individually own and operate a licensed massage establishment and apply for a personal massage therapist license of any type are exempt from paying the separate massage therapist license fee e the application for a massage therapist license shall contain the following 1 name address and telephone number 2 three portrait photographs at least two inches by two inches 3 copy of a valid governmentissued identification card 4 applicants weight height color of hair and eyes 5 fingerprints provided for new applications and applications that have lapsed for one year or more not required for annual renewals 6 written evidence that the applicant is at least 18 years old 7 business occupation or employment of the applicant for the three years immediately prior to the date of application 8 disclosure of any criminal convictions or diversions except minor traffic violations and fully disclose the jurisdiction in which convicted or diverted and the offense for which convicted or diverted 9 authorization for the city its agents and employees to obtain consumer reports credit checks or such other background checks as may be permitted under applicable law at any time after receipt of such authorization 10 proof of the education and experience requirements set forth in section 12356 11 licensing history of the applicant including without limitation whether the applicant has ever held or currently holds a massage business or massage therapist license in this or any other state under any individual or business name and whether any such prior license has been revoked or suspended including the reason for such revocation or suspension    12112018 application process and issuance of massage therapist license and identification card upon receipt of a complete application for a massage therapist license the city clerk andor police chief shall initiate a background check the city clerk shall issue a massage therapist license and identification card within 21 days following application unless there are findings that 1 the applicant for the massage therapist license has been convicted of or diverted on a a person felony as defined by state law  b a nonperson felony as defined by state law in the seven years immediately preceding the date of the application  c any felony or misdemeanor offense involving sexual misconduct  d obscenity  e prostitution or promoting prostitution or equivalent charge  f solicitation of a lewd or unlawful act as individual massage therapist licenses in the seven years preceding the date of the application 2 the applicant has knowingly made any false misleading or fraudulent statement of fact in the license application or in any document required by the city in conjunction therewith  3 the applicant had a massage establishment or therapist permit or license denied revoked suspended or involuntarily surrendered the permit or license in lieu of revocation or suspension by the city or any other state or local agency within seven years prior to the date of application 4 the applicant was issued a license for an adult entertainment business or escort service or was employed by any such establishment within seven years prior to the date of application 5 the applicant has not attained the age of 18 years 6 the correct license fee has not been tendered to the city and in the case of a check or bank draft not honored with payment upon presentation  7 that the applicant has not successfully completed the education standards required under the provisions of this article the license and identification card shall state that they are not transferable or refundable the license and identification card shall be displayed or made available in section 12263 if an application is denied the applicant shall be immediately notified by certified mail return receipt requested mailed to the lastknown mailing address of the applicant and the notice shall state the basis for the disapproval appeals shall be in accordance with section 12360    12112018 revocation of massage therapist license a any massage therapist license may be suspended or revoked by the city clerk or police chief 1 for a violation of any of the provisions of this article  2 if the licensee or any establishment representative was convicted of any offense which would make him ineligible to receive a license  or 3 if the licensee or an establishment representative refused to permit or hindered any authorized city inspector or representative to conduct any investigation or inspection provided for in this article b written notice shall be sent to the person entitled to notice as stated in the massage therapist license and at the location specified in the license for notice this notice shall state the specific basis for suspension or revocation and shall notify the licensee of the licensees right to a hearing before the city manager to appeal the suspension or revocation any of the following shall establish a sufficient basis for suspension or revocation of the massage therapist license if a licensee 1 is convicted of any offense which is a felony the record of conviction being conclusive evidence thereof  2 supplies false information to the permit administrator or police on the application for licensure or licensure renewal  3 uses fraudulent false misleading or deceptive advertising to describe promote or advertise any type of business activity or service which is expressly not massage therapy or has otherwise fraudulently engaged in massage therapy  4 is convicted of any offense found in this article  5 conducts any illegal activities  6 has an arrest record for any sexual offense or violation  7 has fraudulently obtained a license pursuant to provisions of this article  8 has ceased to meet any of the requirements for issuance of a massage therapy license  9 refuses to permit any duly authorized police officer or city health officer to inspect the records of the operations of the licensee  10 fails to comply with all applicable laws and regulatory provisions herein c upon suspension or revocation of the massage therapist license the massage therapist shall cease to operate in the city    12112018 appeal upon receipt of a written request delivered to the city clerk an appeal of the denial suspension or revocation of a massage therapist license shall be heard by the city manager within 30 days after the denial suspension or revocation the licensee may submit evidence at the hearing which is relevant and material to the specific basis for suspension or revocation the city manager shall make a final determination as to suspension or revocation    12112018 secs 1236112378  reserved article viii  special entertainment events division 1  generally definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning amusement rides 1 the term amusement rides means any mechanical or electrical device that carries or conveys passengers along around or over a fixed or restricted route or course or within a defined area for the purpose of giving its passengers amusement pleasure thrills or excitement including but not be limited to a rides commonly known as ferris wheels carousels parachute towers bungee jumping reverse bungee jumping tunnels of love roller coasters boat rides water slides inflatable devices commercial zip lines trampoline courts and gokarts  b equipment generally associated with winter activities such as ski lifts ski tows jbars tbars chair lifts and aerial tramways  and c equipment not originally designed to be used as an amusement ride such as cranes or other lifting devices when used as part of an amusement ride 2 the term amusement rides does not include a games concessions and associated structures  b any single passenger coinoperated ride that is manually mechanically or electrically operated  is customarily placed in a public location and does not normally require the supervision or services of an operator  c nonmechanized playground equipment including but not limited to swings seesaws stationary springmounted animal features riderpropelled merrygorounds climbers slides and physical fitness devices  d antique amusement rides  e limiteduse amusement rides  f registered agritourism activities  g any ride commonly known as a hayrack ride in which patrons sit in a wagon or cart that is then pulled by horses or a tractor or other motor vehicle  h any ride commonly known as a barrel train which has a series of handmade cars fashioned from barrels that are connected and pulled by a tractor or other motor vehicle  or i any amusement ride owned by an individual and operated solely within a single county for strictly private use antique amusement ride means an amusement ride as defined in this section manufactured prior to  carnival means a traveling enterprise offering amusement activities mechanical or electrical rides booths for the conduct of games of skill or sideshows circus means a show or performance that includes but is not limited to feats of physical skill and daring animal acts or performances by jugglers or clowns street show means the act of performing in public places for gratuities  1141 4232019 exemption from article provisions this article shall not apply to permanent amusement centers    secs 1238112403  reserved division 2  permits and operational standards permit required  fee  provisions cumulative a it is unlawful for any person other than the city to operate an exhibition of any product merchandise or service for profit anywhere within the city or to operate any carnival circus street show or similar public performance or amusement enterprise providing any amusement rides or dispensing of food and beverage within the city without first securing a permit from the city clerk for such operation b fees are in the amount provided in the city fee schedule and are not prorated refundable or transferable c any application made fees paid and permits obtained under the provisions of this article shall be in addition to and not in lieu of any other fees permits or licenses required to be paid or obtained under any other ordinances of the city  11436 4232019 procedure a application form and time for filing application for a permit under this article shall be made to the city clerk on a form provided by the clerk the completed application must be received by the clerk at least 60 days prior to the event each application shall be accompanied by the appropriate permit fee b plot plan required each application shall also be accompanied by a plot plan specifying the location of such exhibition carnival circus amusement enterprise or street show in relation to existing buildings drive areas location on the tract and the amount of space available for offstreet parking of vehicles c review by designated city officials the city clerk will forward the application to the city manager police chief or designee fire chief or designee and the director of public works or designee for review and approval of the application d issuance or denial the city clerk shall issue or deny the permit within 14 days following the application the permit may be issued with such conditions as the city deems necessary or appropriate e compliance with permit conditions required compliance with all terms conditions and regulations of the permit as granted by the city clerk is mandatory failure to comply shall immediately void the permit and shall constitute a violation of this article  11437 4232019 insurance required  notice of claims a a certificate of insurance shall accompany the permit application the certificate shall comply with the following 1 minimum limits of liability for commercial general liability insurance shall be $500000000 for each occurrence if amusement rides or other similar devices are used on the premises or $100000000 for each occurrence if amusement rides or other similar devices are not in use on the premises 2 coverage is from an insurance carrier who is licensed to do business in this state and carries a policyholder rating of a or better 3 in the description of operations the certificate lists the city its officers affiliates and assignees as additional insureds on a primary and noncontributory basis and includes the name of the event and dates of the event b the permittee upon receipt of notice of any claim in connection with the permit shall promptly notify the city with full details thereof including an estimate of the amount of loss or liability  11439 4232019 inspection of area by city staff an inspection of the location where the event is to operate will be performed by city staff upon set up and prior to the start of the event inspections will include but not be limited to inspections by the city building inspector city fire marshal and chief of police or their designees  11440 4232019 duty of permittee to restore location  bond required  inspection a after the event the permittee shall promptly clean and restore the event location to the condition that existed thereon prior to the occurrence of the event a cash bond in the amount of $100000 shall be deposited with the city clerk at the time of making the application for permit to guarantee property cleanup of the area b after the event the event area will be inspected by city staff to ensure compliance with this section and any fees associated with the cleanup of the area required by the city will be deducted from the cash bond on file any unused portion of the cash bond will be returned via check to the permittee within 14 days of the last day of the event  11441 4232019 posting by circuses carnivals and amusement companies  cash bond a it is unlawful for the owner agent or other representative of any circus carnival or amusement company to glue or paste any bill poster or other advertising matter upon any barn shed building structure or window within the limits of the city but the bill poster or other advertising matter may be attached to such structures by tacks or other temporary means if the consent of the owners or agents of such structures is obtained by the owner agent or other representative of the circus carnival or amusement company b in addition to the license required the owner agent or other representative of any circus carnival or amusement company before posting any bill poster or other advertising matter as provided in this section shall give a cash bond in the sum of $100000 to the city conditioned that all such bills posters or other advertising matter will be removed within one week after the performance so advertised if all such bills posters or other advertising matter are not removed within one week after the last performance so advertised the city shall cause such bill poster or other advertising matter to be removed and the bond shall be forfeited to the city    state permit required for certain amusement rides and agritourism activity it is unlawful for an owner or operator of an amusement ride antique amusement ride limiteduse amusement ride or registered agritourism activity as defined in ksa 441601 to knowingly operate or cause to be operated any amusement ride without a valid permit issued by the state  11460 4232019 amusement rides to comply with federal state and local regulations all amusement rides shall be operated and maintained in accordance with federal state and local regulations including but not limited to ksa 441601 et seq  11460 4232019 violations and penalties violation of this article is a class b public offense subject to penalties as provided in section 110  11460 4232019 appeal upon receipt of written request delivered to the city clerk an appeal of the denial suspension or revocation shall be heard by the city manager within 30 days of receipt by the clerk the permittee shall submit at the hearing evidence that is relevant and material to the specific basis for the denial suspension or revocation the city manager shall make final determination  11438 4232019 secs 1241412437  reserved article ix  vehicles for hire division 1  generally definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meaning ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning cruising means the continuous or repeated operation over the streets of a vehicle for hire in search of picking up or solicitation of prospective passengers driver license means the license issued by the city to the driver of a vehicle for hire meter means an instrument or device attached to the vehicle which measures the distance driven and the waiting time upon which the fare is based owners license means a license issued by the city to the owner of a vehicle for hire police chief means the police chief of the city or person designated by the police chief street means street avenue boulevard thoroughfare trafficway alley and any other public way for vehicular travel vehicle for hire means any public passenger motor vehicle taxicab or shuttle which is for hire by a passenger for a fee except that the following are not included in this definition 1 vehicles as defined in and operating under ksa 82701 et seq transportation network companies 2 vehicle operated by the county council on aging 3 motor buses and motor vehicles engaged exclusively in the transportation of students to and from school commonly known as school buses 4 vehicle operated by a person or company and used to transport persons who are the employees patrons guests residents or customers of the person or company and where the provision of such transportation is incidental to the business of such person or company 5 group riding or an arrangement between individuals whereby they pool their private transportation resources either by using the personal automobile of one member of the group with the others contributing to the costs of operation of same or by rotating the use of their personal automobiles with joint contributions to the cost by the other members of the group or when any employer provides transportation for his employees and for none other for a charge      3101998   12201 792019 stop and inspection authorized vehicles for hire and driver licensed under this article shall be subject to reasonable stop and inspection by the police for conformance with the requirements of this article      3101998   12203 792019 manufacturers maximum seating capacity not to be exceeded no vehicle for hire shall carry a greater number of persons including the driver or operator than its manufacturer rated seating capacity      3101998   12204 792019 cruising and solicitation of passengers or business prohibited a when not being operated in driving to or in returning from a specific destination while employed in rendering transportation service vehicles for hire shall be subject to call at the usual place of business maintained by the owner or operator b no vehicle for hire shall be operated over the streets of the city in service without a specific destination c no owner or driver shall solicit employ or engage any other person to solicit patronage on the streets sidewalks or public ways within the city d it is unlawful for the owner driver or operator to park for the purpose of soliciting business or passengers for hire in any street or alley in the city except to load or unload such vehicle for hire and except as hereinafter provided  driver occupied cabs shall be permitted to remain legally parked in the city for return fare  3822   12232   3101998   12205 792019 licenses a required no person whether acting as owner principal agent employee lessee or licensee shall operate or permit to be operated upon the streets of the city any vehicle for hire without first having obtained an owners license or a driver license as provided in this article b annual fee owners and driver of vehicles for hire licensed under this article shall pay to the city clerk a yearly fee for such license at the time of application for each calendar year or part thereof as provided in the city fee schedule application fees are not prorated refundable or transferable except as provided in section 12474 c term licenses issued pursuant to this article shall be valid from january 1 to december 31 of each calendar year d issuance all licenses shall be issued by the city clerk with the vehicle for hire or permit the same to be operated without proof of continuing liability protection for each vehicle to be operated being on file in the office of the city clerk the requirements for liability protection shall be as provided in this section b the licensee or applicant shall maintain commercial automobile liability insurance on each vehicle with liability limits of at least $6000000 combined single limit for injury to or death of one or more persons and for damage to property including baggage or other property of a passenger carried in or on the vehicle resulting from any single accident by reason of the carelessness or negligence of the driver or operator of such vehicle with a property damage deductible if any not to exceed $50000 above which all claims shall be referred to the insurance company for handling c the insurance policy shall be issued by an insurance carrier who offers proof that it 1 is authorized and licensed to do business in this state and has and maintains a local office or agent in this state upon whom service of process may be had  2 carries a bests policy holder rating of a or better  and 3 carries at least a class x financial rating  or 4 is a company mutually agreed upon by the city and the licensee d under the policy the insurance company shall obligate itself to handle claims and indemnify the licensee owner lessee operator and driver as applicable and to pay to the claimant all amounts which the insured becomes legally obligated to pay under the policy in excess of any applicable deductible a certificate of insurance reflecting all endorsements shall be filed with the city clerk e the policy shall contain a provision for continuing liability thereunder to the full amount thereof notwithstanding any recovery thereon f the policy shall contain a separate endorsement requiring the insurance company to notify the city clerk in writing of any change in coverage or cancellation of the policy at least ten days prior thereto g the policy shall list each vehicle to be insured under the policy h nothing contained in the policy or any endorsement thereof shall release the company from liability for payment of any judgment due to any violation on the part of the insured of the provisions of the policy  3835   12252   3101998   12231 792019 appeal of license denial suspension or revocation a upon receipt of faith and that the vehicle for which the license was issued shall no longer be used by the licensee in the vehicle for hire business the city clerk shall have the authority to transfer the owners mechanical systems of the vehicle if the vehicle is found to be in dangerous condition the license of such vehicle shall be subject to suspension of the license by the police chief or city clerk until repairs are made 2 the license of such vehicle shall be automatically suspended by the city clerk at any period of time in which insurance is not maintained as required in this article      3101998   12235 792019 secs 1247612503  reserved division 3  driver license application a form and content application for a driver license shall be made on a form provided by the city clerk such application shall contain the following 1 name address and telephone number 2 applicants weight height sex color of hair and eyes 3 copy of a current valid driver license issued by the state or valid for operating a vehicle in the state and the experience the applicant has had in driving a motor vehicle 4 the name of the person or business by whom the applicant is employed 5 whether or not the applicant has previously been licensed in any state or city as a driver of a vehicle for hire if so when what state or city if such license is now or ever has been revoked or suspended and if so the date and reason for such suspension or revocation 6 the number of times and places the applicant has been arrested or convicted for traffic violations 7 whether or not the applicant has ever been convicted of a felony or misdemeanor giving particulars of each such conviction b motor vehicle record each applicant shall furnish at the time of application a motor vehicle record obtained within 14 days of the date of application c driver photograph in addition a photograph of the applicant will be taken by the city clerk at the time the application is submitted one copy of the photograph will be kept on file with the application and one copy will be displayed on the license      3101998   12251 792019 examination of application by police  approval the chief of police or his designee shall cause each applicant for a vehicle for hire driver license to be examined as to the applicants criminal and driving record law enforcement channels the application shall be approved or disapproved based upon the information on the application the applicants criminal and driving history and any other reliable information at his disposal reasons for disapproval shall include but may not be limited to the following 1 any felony conviction in the five years immediately preceding the application of a sexual or violent nature 2 any felony theft or crime of moral turpitude conviction in the five years immediately preceding the application 3 any misdemeanor conviction in the three years immediately preceding the application of a violent or sexual nature 4 any misdemeanor theft or crime of moral turpitude conviction in the three years immediately preceding the application 5 any dui or open container conviction in the three years immediately preceding the application 6 conviction for three moving violations within the 18 months immediately preceding the application 7 any omission or falsification of information on the applicant form      3101998   12252 792019 issuance  form  display  duplicate a upon approval of the application the city clerk shall issue a license to the applicant in a format prescribed by the city clerk the license shall include the number of the license date of issuance the age height weight sex of the applicant color of the applicants hair and eyes and shall have attached thereto a photograph of the applicant the license shall be signed by the city clerk or designee no license shall be subject to transfer or assignment to any person other than the one to whom it was issued b the license shall be conspicuously displayed in such a manner that the entire license is visible from the rear seat of the vehicle the only driver license displayed shall be the one belonging to the driver who is on duty at that time the driver shall be responsible for keeping the license in a good condition and legible at all times c in case of a lost license the owner of such lost license shall file with the city clerk a sworn statement of the facts concerning such loss if the city clerk is satisfied that the facts justify the issue of a replacement the city clerk shall upon payment of the fee provided in the city fee schedule issue a duplicate license such duplicate license shall be plainly marked duplicate in red across the face and the number of the original and the duplicate shall be furnished to the police chief      3101998   12253 792019 suspension or revocation a a vehicle for hire driver license may be suspended or revoked at any time by the police chief for a violation of any of the provisions of this article or any other ordinance of the city or any law of the state or for any immoral indecent or offensive conduct b any such suspension shall be noted on the license so suspended together with a statement of the reasons therefor and the driver shall thereupon immediately surrender the license to the police chief to be retained during the period of such suspension c a second suspension for the same reason as the first suspension or a third suspension for any cause shall automatically revoke the license d no driver whose license shall have been revoked shall again be licensed as a driver of a vehicle for hire except upon presentation of reasons satisfactory to the city manager no part of any driver license fee shall be refunded upon revocation of any such license and such license shall be purchased and issued upon the conditions set out in this article      3101998   12254 792019 secs 1250812538  reserved article x  other specific businesses new goods public auctions the provisions of the new goods public 581014 et seq  authority to incorporate by reference state statutes ksa 123009 et seq building movers a license required no person shall engage in the business of building moving or move any building over or along any street avenue or alley in the city without first obtaining a license and complying with all other provisions of this article b application the building mover license required by this article may be issued by the city clerk with the consent of the city engineer only on written application of the party concerned which application shall set forth the relevant work experience of the applicant the applicants financial status references available from third parties and any other pertinent information the applicant deems necessary or desirable in support of his application the city engineer may request any further information that he deems necessary or desirable from the applicant before acting upon the application c bond prerequisite to issuance before any license is issued under this article the applicant shall execute and deliver to the city a good and sufficient surety company bond in the sum of $500000 filed with the city clerk to be approved by the city attorney and conditioned that the person will pay any outstanding license fees and all damages which may occur to any pavement street or sidewalk or to any city fire or police alarm telegraph telephone or electric lighting pole wire bridge or viaduct belonging to the city on account of moving any building over or along any street avenue or alley in the city regardless of whether such damages are caused by the person or his agents employees or workmen and conditioned also that the person will save and indemnify and keep harmless the city against all liabilities responsibility integrity judgments damages costs and expenses which may in any way accrue against the city in consequence of the granting of the license and will in all things strictly comply with the conditions of such license and permits and of all ordinances of the city d fee the license fee required under this section shall be as provided in the city fee schedule e revocation any license issued under the provisions of this section is revocable and the city engineer may revoke or cancel such license for the failure of the licensee to comply with the terms of this article or for the conduct of the licensees business in a manner detrimental to the best interests of the residents of the city such revocation or cancellation may be ordered immediately or the city engineer may prescribe additional requirements for the continuation of the license as may be in his opinion necessary or desirable and in the best interests of the city 228  670 garage sales a defined for purposes of this section the term garage sale means any garage basement yard rummage or other similar sale of three or more items that were originally purchased by the garage sale permittee for the permittees ultimate use b limitation on number and duration one garage sale per quarter first quarter january second quarter april third quarter july fourth quarter october  for a total of four per year c permit required  exception no person shall conduct or carry on in the city a garage sale without having first obtained a permit therefor  provided however that schools churches and nonprofit organizations may carry on garage sales for the benefit of the organization when such sale is conducted on school church or commercial property without obtaining a permit d application application for a permit for a garage sale shall be submitted to the city clerk and such application shall contain a statement that all items to be offered for sale were purchased for use by the applicant a fee in the amount provided in the city fee schedule shall be submitted with the application e signs signs advertising a garage sale shall not exceed two signs of two square feet each and shall be displayed only on the permitted property during the day of such sale 21  28 98419843   2251992   11262013 pawnbrokers  state law adopted the provisions of ksa ch 16 art 7 ksa 16701 et seq except those provisions applicable to a county are adopted by reference to provide for the regulation of pawnbrokers in the city    state law reference pawnbrokers and precious metal dealers ksa 16706 et seq refuse collectors a license required  application and issuance any person desiring to collect or transport for hire garbage trash or refuse in the city shall obtain a license therefor application for a license shall be made to the city clerk and shall set forth the name of the applicant together with the address of the applicant title number make and type of vehicle to be operated for the transportation of garbage trash or refuse and the method of disposal of garbage trash or refuse upon receipt of proper and complete application a certificate of inspection as required in this section and a permit fee in the amount provided in the city fee schedule the city clerk shall issue the license b application denial and license revocation the city may deny license issuance or renewal under this section for the failure of the applicant or licensee to maintain a collection vehicle or complete inspections as required by this article in addition the city shall have the right to deny or revoke a license under this article if the applicant or licensee fails to provide adequate sightly and sanitary disposal of garbage refuse and trash collected whether within or without the city limits or if the applicant or licensee permits trash to be scattered or blown or to fall from the truck onto the public streets or alleys of the city c collection vehicles required  securing vehicle loads  sanitary condition to be maintained all persons engaged in collecting refuse in the city shall for such purpose provide themselves with vehicles with bodies sufficiently tight to prevent the contents escaping therefrom and such vehicles shall be loaded and conveyed so that none of the contents shall fall upon the ground run out or spill therefrom all vehicles used to transport garbage shall be maintained in a sanitary condition by frequent washing and disinfecting to the satisfaction of the citys solid waste foreman or duly authorized representative d vehicle inspections required licensees under this section will ensure that vehicles are thoroughly and carefully inspected and examined by an ase certified mechanic and certified by the mechanics signature on the form provided by the city and to be in a thoroughly safe condition regarding the operability and condition of the vehicle all vehicles licensed shall be inspected at the time of original or renewal licensing e vehicle maintenance standards continued maintenance and repair of the mechanical systems of the vehicle shall be the responsibility of the vehicle owner and any vehicle found to be in a dangerous condition shall be subject to suspension of the license until repairs are made a state department of transportation inspection form may be provided in lieu of the ase inspection and a current form must be kept on file during the license period of the vehicle  154 15321534   985 98569859   1282015 state law reference authority to regulate and license garbage and trash collectors ksa 122110 tree trimmers a defined as used in this section the term the amount set out in the city fee schedule for each permit  342 34163418   1062 1063610638   1282015 elections footnotes  1  state law reference elections ksa 25101 et seq  city elections ksa 252101 et seq article i  in general county election officer to conduct the county election officer shall conduct all elections in the city    state law reference similar provisions ksa 252110 time of opening and closing polls the hours of voting in all general elections primary elections city elections and special elections in the city shall be from  am until  pm    state law reference similar provisions ksa 252111 intoxicating beverages at polls prohibited it is unlawful for any person to have any whisky beer or other intoxicating liquors in such persons possession or under such persons control at any voting or polling place at any general or special election held in the city at any time between the opening and closing of the polls it is unlawful for any person to have or keep in such persons possession or under such persons control at any place in the city any intoxicating liquor for the purpose of giving such intoxicating liquor away or treating any qualified voter or any person working at the election    electioneering at polling places electioneering at polling places is knowingly electioneering on election day within any polling place or within a radius of 250 feet from the entrance thereof as used in this section the term electioneering means an attempt to persuade or influence by any means eligible voters to vote for or against a particular candidate party or question submitted electioneering at polling places is a class c misdemeanor    state law reference similar provisions ksa 252430 intimidation of voters for purposes of this section the term intimidation of voters means intimidating threatening coercing or attempting to intimidate threaten or coerce any person for the purpose of interfering with the right of such person to vote or to vote as he may choose or of causing such person to vote for or not to vote for any candidate for any office or question submitted at any election the term intimidation of voters also includes mailing publishing broadcasting telephoning or transmitting by any means false information intended to keep one or more voters from casting a ballot or applying for or returning an advance voting ballot intimidation of voters is a class a misdemeanor 1   state law reference similar provisions ksa 252415 disorderly election conduct disorderly election conduct is prohibited and constitutes a class b misdemeanor as used in this section the term disorderly election conduct means willfully 1 disturbing the peace in or about any voting place on election day 2 leaving or attempting to leave a voting place in possession of any ballot except as is specifically permitted by law 3 approaching or remaining closer than three feet to any voting booth voting machine or table being used by an election board except as admitted for the purpose of voting or by authority of the supervising judge 4 interrupting hindering or obstructing any person approaching any voting place for the purpose of voting 5 engaging within 250 feet from the entrance of a polling place during the hours the polls are open on election day in solicitation of contributions or conduct of advisory elections other than those specifically authorized by law including the exercise of home rule power to be conducted by a county election officer    state law reference similar provisions ksa 252413 police officers to preserve order the mayor is directed to furnish a sufficient number of police officers during the time that any general or special election is being carried on to preserve order at and in the vicinity of all of the polling places in the city to keep all pavements and sidewalks free and clear of all obstructions and to arrest all offenders committing any breach of the provisions of this chapter or the laws of the state or causing any disturbance of the peace at or near the polling places in the city    secs 1481432  reserved article ii  ward boundaries footnotes  2  state law reference wards ksa 13205 13206 footnotes  1  state law reference emergency management ksa 48904 et seq  unlawful requests for emergency service assistance ksa 216207 article i  in general secs 1611618  reserved article ii  local emergency and disaster agency disaster assistance to other jurisdictions a in the event of a disaster when there is a request for assistance if the city can provide assistance without unduly jeopardizing the protection of its own community that this section authorizes the city manager or his designee to provide such assistance as may be required under authority granted in ksa 48904 et seq with all the privileges and immunities provided therein b nothing in this section is intended to conflict with or circumvent any existing interlocal agreement any automatic aid intergovernmental or mutual aid agreement or any authority to enter into those in the future c it is the intent of this section to provide assistance in any form of service including but not limited to police fire ems public works administrative and clerical during times of disaster as defined in ksa 48904 with all the privileges and immunities described therein    4111995 state law reference interjurisdictional agencies ksa 48929 secs 16201641  reserved article iii  alarm systems definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning alarm means any assembly of equipment mechanical or electrical arranged to signal the occurrence of an illegal entry or other activity requiring urgent attention and to which the police or fire department is expected to respond this does not include vehicle alarms alarm company means the business by any individual partnership corporation or other entity of selling leasing maintaining servicing repairing altering replacing moving or installing any alarm system or causing to be sold leased maintained serviced repaired altered replaced moved or installed any alarm system in or on any building structure or facility alarm user means the person firm partnership association corporation company or organization of any kind in control of premises wherein an alarm system is maintained automatic dialing device means a device which is interconnected to a telephone line and is programmed to transmit by a need for emergency response burglary alarm system means an alarm system signaling an entry or attempted entry into the area protected by the system central alarm system means any facility central station modified central station or answering service operated by any person business firm corporation or other commercial entity engaged in the occupation of selling renting leasing installing maintaining operating or repairing an alarm system which facility is manned at all times by operators employed to receive record and validate alarm signals transmitted to such facility and to relay information about such signals to the police department by a direct telephone line direct telephone lines means a telephone line directly to the police department false alarm means an alarm signal eliciting a response by the police or fire department where an emergency situation does not in fact exist but does not include an alarm caused by violent conditions of nature or other extraordinary circumstances not reasonably subject to control by the alarm operator or alarm user fire alarm system means an alarm signaling a fire smoke toxic fumes or intensive heat within an area protected by the system holdup alarm system means an alarm signaling a holdup or attempted holdup is in progress wherein an alarm system is maintained interconnect means to connect an alarm system including an automatic dialing device to a telephone line either directly or mechanical device that utilizes a telephone for the purpose of using the telephone to transmit a message upon the activation of the alarm system local alarm system means any location wherein an alarm system is maintained to activate a local alarm on the premises such as a bell siren or horn permit year means july 1  primary trunk line means a telephone line serving the police or fire department or any central alarm station that is designated to receive emergency calls responsible party means the applicant for an alarm permit and is the person to be held responsible for any fees or charges levied this will generally be the alarm user as defined previously or the property owner in case of vacant property robbery alarm system means an alarm system signaling a robbery or attempted robbery    11281995   6262007 purpose the purpose of this article is to establish conditions and requirements for the installation and use of emergency alarm systems in the city    11281995 interpretation this article which is administered by the city agents and representatives shall be liberally construed to affect the purpose of this article and to achieve uniform interpretation and application of the respective ordinances    11281995 violations and penalties all violations of this article shall be an unclassified offense with a fine not exceeding $50000 the violations include but are not limited to failure to obtain and renew the required alarm user permit by residents failure of an alarm company doing business in the city to obtain a license from the city clerk as required herein includes renewal and liability insurance and violations of false alarms and permit revocation set forth in section 1650    9122017 monitoring  autodial numbers  supervisory controls a alarms from public institutions federally insured financial institution buildings and industrial commercial and private buildings equipped with alarms will be monitored by the police department the monitoring of any alarm system by the police department must be approved by the police chief b no automatic dialing devices may be programmed to dial any primary trunk
