should not be allowed to build up in the pit to higher than onethird of the pit depth or to the point where they begin to impede combustion whichever occurs first e integrity of the pit if wear and tear heat or soil conditions cause significant crumbling or erosion of the pit walls the fire chief or his designee may require the operator to cease burning until a new acceptable pit can be dug and approved f general safety requirements the operator must do everything possible to protect the safety of workers and the public 1 to protect public safety it is required that an effective childproof fence surround the combustion pit when unattended 2 to protect against potentially serious loader accidents the pit should be dug in stable soil where necessary earth anchors backstays or wire mesh should be used for additional support 3 a stop guide or restraining board is recommended at the loading side of the pit to prevent the loader from getting too close to the pit during charging operations g additional requirements fire department representatives may determine that additional operating or safety requirements are needed based on conditions observed during inspections public complaints or other factors such additional requirements or restrictions shall become enforceable conditions of the burning permit    1241995 secs 20552081  reserved article iv  fireworks footnotes  2  state law reference kansas fireworks act ksa 31501 et seq  authority to prohibit fireworks ksa 31134  bottle rockets ksa 31155 et seq definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning consumer fireworks means any small firework device designed to produce visible effects by combustion and which must comply with the construction chemical composition and labeling regulations of the us consumer product safety commission as set forth in 16 cfr parts 1500 and 1507 some small devices designed to produce audible effects are included such as whistling devices ground devices containing 50 mg or less of explosive materials and aerial devices containing 130 mg or less of explosive materials consumer fireworks are classified as fireworks un0336 and un0337 by the us department of transportation at 49 cfr  the term consumer fireworks does not include fused set pieces containing components which together exceed 50 mg of salute powder fireworks means and includes any combustible or deflagrating composition article or device suitable for the use of the public for the purpose of producing a visible or audible effect by combustion deflagration or detonation and previously approved for transportation by the chemical laboratory of the state department of transportation a b   items not covered by article nothing in this article shall be construed as applying to toy smoke devices defined as smoke balls or to tubes containing a pyrotechnic mixture which upon ignition produces a visible cloud of colored smoke white and black smokes are considered colored  or to toy paper caps containing not more than 025 of a grain of explosive composition per cap or to the manufacture storage sale or use of signals necessary for the safe operation of railroads or other classes of public or private transportation or applying to the military or naval forces of the united states or of this state or to peace officers nor as prohibiting the sale or use of blank cartridges for ceremonial or theatrical or athletic events nor as prohibiting the firing of skyrockets or missiles when produced by a science class of any school and when under the supervision of the science instructor and when the place and time of firing the skyrockets or missiles has been approved by the fire chief c   fireworks prohibited  exemption it is unlawful to sell offer to sell possess with intent to sell or to ignite fire set off or otherwise use or possess any fireworks within the city  provided however that public displays and fireworks to be utilized in an approved manner as provided in this article    public displays  permits  approval a no person shall conduct operate or engage in a public display of fireworks within the limits of the city without first obtaining a permit from the city clerk b applications for permits for fireworks displays shall be submitted on a form to be provided by the city clerk which shall contain the following information 1 name and address of applicant 2 location of public display 3 hours of public display 4 description of the fireworks to be used in the public display c before a permit shall be issued under this section the applicant for such license shall file with the city clerk a certificate of operations section shall include the following alarm company and city of leavenworth its assigned officers and affiliates are additional insured on a primary and noncontributory basis the policy shall further include a provision that notice of change or cancellation shall be given to the city d no permit shall issue under this section unless the fire chief and city manager approve the application the permit shall contain such restrictions as may be imposed by the city manager in his approval    violation of conditions of permit violations of the conditions of a permit granted under the terms of this article shall be a violation subject to the general penalty provisions of this section 110    secs 208720115  reserved article v  fire insurance proceeds footnotes  3  state law reference payment of proceeds of fire insurance policies etc ksa 403901 scope and application the city is authorized to utilize the procedures established by ksa 403901 et seq whereby no insurance company shall pay a claim of a named insured for loss or damage to any building or other structure located within the city where the amount recoverable for the loss or damage to the building or other structure under all policies is in excess of 75 percent of the face value of the policy covering such building or other insured structure unless there is compliance with the procedures set out in this section a   6271995   7221997   lien created the city commission of the city creates a lien in favor of the city on the proceeds of any insurance policy based upon a covered claim payment made for damage or loss to a building or other structure located within the city where the amount recoverable for all the loss or damage to the building or other structure under all policies is in excess of 75 percent of the face value of the policies covering such building or other insured structure the lien arises upon any unpaid tax special ad valorem levy or any other charge imposed upon real property by or on behalf of the city which is an encumbrance on real property whether or not evidenced by written instrument or such tax levy assessment expense or other charge that has remained undischarged for at least one year prior to the filing of a proof of loss b   6271995   7221997   encumbrances prior to final settlement on any claim covered by section 20117 the insurer shall contact the county treasurer to determine whether any such encumbrances are presently in existence if the same are found to exist the insurer shall execute and transmit in an amount equal to that owing under the encumbrances a draft payable to the county treasurer c   6271995   7221997   pro rata basis such transfer of proceeds shall be on a pro rata basis by all insurance companies insuring the building or other structure d   6271995   7221997   procedure the following procedure shall apply in the implementation of this section 1 when final settlement on a covered claim has been agreed to or arrived at between the named insured and the company and the final settlement exceeds 75 percent of the face value of the policy covering any building or other insured structure and when all amounts due the holder of a first real estate mortgage against the building or other structure pursuant to the terms of the policy and endorsements thereto shall have been paid the insurance company shall execute a draft payable to the city treasurer in an amount equal to the sum of 15 percent of the covered claim payment unless the chief building inspector of the city has issued a certificate to the insurance company that the insured has removed the damaged building or other structure as well as all associated debris or repaired rebuilt or otherwise made the premises safe and secure 2 such transfer of funds shall be on a pro rata basis by all companies insuring the building or other structure policy proceeds remaining after the transfer to the city shall be disbursed in accordance with the policy terms 3 upon the transfer of the funds as required by section 20116 the insurance company shall provide the city with the name and address of the named insured the total insurance coverage applicable to the building or other structure and the amount of the final settlement agreed to or arrived at between the insurance company or companies and the insured whereupon the chief building inspector shall contact the named insured by certified mail return receipt requested notifying them that the insurance proceeds have been received by the city and apprise them of the procedures to be followed under this section e   6271995   7221997   fund created  deposit of moneys the city treasurer is authorized and shall create a fund to be known as the insurance proceeds fund all moneys received by the city treasurer as provided for by this section shall be placed in the fund and deposited in an interestbearing account f   6271995   7221997   building inspector  investigation removal of structure a upon receipt of moneys as provided for by this section the city treasurer shall immediately notify the chief building inspector of the receipt and transmit all documentation received from the insurance company to the chief building inspector b within 30 days of the receipt of the moneys the chief building inspector shall determine after prior investigation whether the city shall instigate proceedings under the provisions of ksa 121750 et seq as amended c prior to the expiration of the 30 days established by subsection b of this section the chief building inspector shall notify the city treasurer whether he intends to initiate proceedings under ksa 121750 et seq as amended d if the chief building inspector has determined that proceedings under ksa 121750 et seq as amended shall be initiated he will do so immediately but no later than 45 days after receipt of the moneys by the city treasurer e upon notification to the city treasurer by the chief building inspector that no proceedings shall be initiated under ksa 121750 et seq as amended the city treasurer shall return all such moneys received plus accrued interest to the insured as identified in the communication from the insurance company such return shall be accomplished within 45 days of the receipt of the moneys from the insurance company g   6271995   7221997   removal of structure  excess moneys if the chief building inspector has proceeded under the provisions of ksa 121750 et seq as amended all moneys in excess of that which is ultimately necessary to comply with the provisions for the removal of the building or structure less salvage value if any shall be paid to the insured h   6271995   7221997   removal of structure  disposition of funds if the chief building inspector with regard to a building or other structure damaged determines that it is necessary to act under ksa 121756 any proceeds received by the city treasurer under the authority of section 201201 relating to that building or other structure shall be used to reimburse the city for any expenses incurred by the city in proceeding under ksa 121756 upon reimbursement from the insurance proceeds the chief building inspector shall immediately effect the release of the lien resulting therefrom should the expenses incurred by the city exceed the insurance proceeds paid over to the city treasurer under section 201201 the chief building inspector shall publish a new lien as authorized by ksa 121756 in an amount equal to such excess expenses incurred i   6271995   7221997   effect upon insurance policies this section shall not make the city a party to any insurance contract nor is the insurer liable to any party for any amount in excess of the proceeds otherwise payable under its insurance information pursuant to this section k   6271995   7221997   health and sanitation footnotes  1  state law reference public health generally ksa 65101 et seq  general health powers of city ksa 13436 article i  in general infectious contagious communicable diseases for the better protection of the public health and for the control of communicable diseases the city health department shall designate such diseases as are infectious contagious or communicable in their nature and such board of health is authorized to make and prescribe rules regulations and procedures for the isolation and quarantine of such diseases and persons afflicted with or exposed to such diseases as may be necessary to prevent the spread and dissemination of diseases dangerous to the public health    state law reference infectious or contagious diseases generally ksa 65118 et seq smoking in public places a the term smoking means possession of a lighted cigarette cigar pipe or any other lighted smoking equipment b no person shall smoke in a public place except in designated smoking areas c as used in this section the term public place means enclosed indoor areas open to the public or used by the general public including but not limited to restaurants retail store public means of mass transportation passenger elevators health care institutions or any other place where health care services are provided to the public educational facilities libraries courtrooms city buildings restrooms grocery stores school buses museums theaters auditoriums arenas or recreational facilities d the city managers designee shall post or cause to be posted in city buildings in a conspicuous place signs clearly stating that smoking is prohibited and that city buildings are a smokefree environment e this section shall not prohibit smoking in any public place in smoking areas designated by proprietors or other persons in charge of public places except in passenger elevators school buses public means of transportation and any other place in which smoking is prohibited by the fire marshal or by other law ordinance or regulation f the proprietor or other person in charge of the premises of a public place shall post or cause to be posted in a conspicuous place signs clearly stating that smoking is prohibited the person in charge of the premises shall also post or cause to be posted in any designated smoking areas signs stating that smoking is permitted in such room or areas the proprietor or person in charge of the public place shall have the authority to establish the percentage of the area in the public places shall be posted and designated as a smoking area g unlawful smoking in a public place upon conviction shall be punishable by a fine of not more than $5000      7102001 or revoke the permit of the food or drinking establishment each owner or operator of a food or drinking establishment shall pay an annual health permit fee as provided in the city fee schedule the annual permit fee shall be payable to the city clerk before the permit is issued the health permit shall be renewed and the permit fee paid prior to january 1 each year proof of a valid food safety license issued by the state department of agriculture must be provided to the city clerk the city health permit application shall be made upon a form prescribed by the city and submitted and filed is guilty of a public offense and punishable by a fine of not more than $50000 or imprisonment not to exceed six months or by both such fine and imprisonment each person is guilty of a separate offense for each and every day during any portion of which any violation of any provision of such division is committed continued or permitted by any such person and shall be punished accordingly    9262017 denial revocation and appeal a if a license or permit is not issued the city clerk or designee shall indicate in writing the reasons for denial and inform the applicant of the applicants right to an appeal of the denial in accordance with the provision of this article b a license or permit may be revoked if the applicant fails to provide true and correct information on the application the applicant fails to continuously maintain insurance in accordance with requirements of this chapter or upon a violation by the applicant or any involved agents or employees of any provision of this any federal state or local law rule or regulation applicable or related to the license or permit issued under this article notice of such revocation shall be mailed by the city clerk or designee to the applicants address as shown on the registration application form or to the applicants lastknown address indicating in writing the reasons for revocation and informing the applicant of the applicants right to an appeal of the revocation in the same manner as a denied application  however any appeal of a license or permit revocation shall not suspend the revocation during the pendency of the appeal c upon the citys denial of an application for revocation of a license or permit under this article the applicant shall have the right to appeal such action within 14 days of the denial or revocation being mailed to the applicants address as shown on the registration application form or to the applicants lastknown address such an appeal must be in the form of a written request filed with the city clerk setting the grounds for the appeal upon receipt of such a written request the city clerk shall schedule the appeal hearing to take place during the next ten calendar days before the city manager notice of the appeal hearing shall be given to the appellant in the same manner as provided for in the mailing of the notice of license or permit denial or revocation the decision of the city manager on the appeal shall be final and binding on all parties    9262017 secs 22302246  reserved division 2  food and drinking establishments definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in roads in which a person travels from place to place to deliver packaged food that has been previously ordered public property means and includes all city streets alleys rightsofway parking lots and parking spaces city parks or recreational areas push cart means a nonselfpropelled vehicle used from which food or beverage is offered for sale but does not include ice cream trucks see division 5 of this article    9262017 registration required it is unlawful for any person to conduct mobile food vending within the corporate limits of the city without first obtaining required license or permits in accordance with this article 1 mobile food vending license all vendors shall make application with the city clerk all applications shall be accompanied by a nonrefundable registration fee the amount of the fee shall be set out in the city fee schedule 2 health permit all vendors shall make application and pay a fee to the city clerk in the amount as set out in the city fee schedule 3 food handler permit each employee or person engaged in the handling or preparation of food or beverage shall obtain a food handler permit    9262017 registration application a all applications for new or renewal license for mobile food vending shall be made upon a form prescribed by the city and submitted and filed with the city clerk all mobile food vending licenses are for a period of march 1february 28 license fees are not prorated all applications shall be reviewed and approved by the city health officer prior to issuance of the license b license or permit is nontransferable such form shall include the following 1 name and permanent address of the applicant and the business showing proof of identification if the applicant is not an individual the names and permanent address of the officers of the corporation or the members of the partnership firm association or other entity as the case may be  2 the name of the owner and the type make and registration number and description of the vehicle to be used  3 valid state sales tax id number  4 a statement as to whether or not the applicant has ever had a mobile food vending registration or other similar license or permit revoked or suspended by the city or any other city such a revocation or suspension may result in the citys refusal to process the application  5 a statement that the applicant understands and agrees that registration will not be used or represented in any way as an endorsement of the applicant by the city or by any department officer or elected or appointed official of the city  6 proof of a valid driver license for operation of the class of vehicle identified in the application for the applicant and any agent or employees of the applicant who will be involved in driving the identified vehicle  7 proof that the applicant has secured commercial general liability insurance for the mobile vending operation to be maintain for the entire length of the registration written by an insurance carrier licensed to do business in the state with minimum limits of $100000000 combined single limit for bodily and property damage each occurrence and $200000000 in the general aggregate in the description of operations section shall include the following mobile food vending and city of leavenworth its assigned officers and affiliates are additional insured on a primary and noncontributory basis evidence of compliance with these insurance requirements shall be in the form of a certificate of insurance that shall be submitted with the application such insurance certificate shall not be cancelled without prior written notice to the city  and 8 signature of applicant individually or by its members and officers and any agents or employees of the applicant who will be involved in the appliedfor mobile food vending certifying that all of the information provided in the application is true and correct    9262017 operating conditions all mobile food vending registration certificates shall be subject to compliance with the following conditions 1 location a mobile food vendors may not be located on property where the unit or a line of customers would 1 hinder the flow of traffic on any street  2 hinder the flow of bicycles within any bike lane or route  3 hinder the flow of pedestrians along any sidewalks  4 block or reduce to less than five feet in width any accessible route to persons with disabilities  5 block hinder or obstruct the vehicular flow within any parking lot  or 6 block or obstruct access to any driveway or access point to any property a police officer may order the vehicle moved by the operator to comply with these provisions or have the vehicle towed at owners expense to alleviate the problem b no more than three mobile food units may locate on any zoning lot at any given time except as part of a cityapproved event  c mobile food vendors shall not operate within 100 feet of a permanent brick and mortar restaurant during posted hours of operations without written permission from the restaurant owner  d mobile food vendors shall not operate within residential zoning districts unless at an approved block party event with an authorized temporary street closure or other private event and parked on a private driveway  e mobile food vendors shall not operate in a public rightofway along parade routes on the day of the parade  f mobile food vendors shall not locate on any public property or park without first obtaining permission from the city requests shall be filed with the city clerk for consideration and may be granted by the city manager  and g every unit shall be stationary while vending 2 written permission of property owner all mobile food vendors operating on private property shall acquire and maintain the written permission of the property owner for the use of and location of the unit on the property written permission of the property owner shall be kept in the unit and produced upon request by the police chief or designee or other public officer changed by the city manager with enforcement of this article 3 prohibited sales mobile food vendors are prohibited at all times from selling or offering for sale alcoholic beverages cereal malt beverages or tobacco products 4 lights no flashing lights or attention attracting devices are permitted on or in association with the use of the mobile food unit no direct light from a mobile food unit may be shined on adjacent property or cause glare or distraction for vehicles bicycles or pedestrians 5 sound devices amplified music or chimes from a mobile food unit is not allowed 6 signs no sign on a mobile food unit may be illuminated a maximum of one detached aframesandwich board sign may be permitted as per section 810 of appendix a development regulations aframesandwich board sign must be located within 15 feet of the associated unit and may not interfere with vehicle access pedestrian movement or handicapaccessible routes to and around the unit 7 trash and site cleanup all mobile food vendors shall ensure that a trash receptacle shall be provided with each mobile food unit such receptacle must be attached to the unit or located within 15 feet of the unit and cannot interfere with vehicle access pedestrian movement or handicapaccessible routes to and around the unit immediately upon the cessation of vending the mobile food vendor shall remove and properly dispose of all trash and litter accumulated at the vending site 8 license and permits all mobile food vendors shall acquire and maintain all required licenses and permits applicable to the use and operation of mobile food units from all applicable jurisdictions evidence of such license or permits shall be kept in the unit and produced upon request by the police chief or designee city food health officer or other public official charged by the city manager with enforcement of this chapter    9262017 exclusions the provisions of this section mobile food vending shall not apply to the following 1 vendors selling as part of a cityapproved event  2 vendors selling at the leavenworth farmers market  3 ice cream vendors licensed under division 5 of this article  4 vendors selling on public or private school property with the permission of any such school  5 the sale of farm or garden products or fruit grown by the seller or his employer  6 individuals providing catering services to a private event and not open for the sale of food or beverage to the general public  7 mobile packaged food delivery trucks  or 8 neighborhood refreshment stands and other similar products    9262017 secs 2211022131  reserved division 5  ice cream vendors definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this division shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning ice cream vending means the act of traveling by any type of vehicle from house to house or place to place selling or offering for sale any prepackaged ice cream ice cream novelties or frozen treats intended for immediate consumption within the corporate limits of the city ice cream vendor means any person firm partnership or corporation who travels by any type of vehicle from house to house or place to place selling or offering for sale any prepackaged ice cream ice cream novelties or frozen treats intended for immediate consumption within the corporate limits of the city  provided however that no person firm partnership or corporation shall be considered an ice cream vendor when orders are taken for ice cream food products to be delivered to the ultimate consumer on a prearranged day subsequent to the date of sale ice cream vendor unit or vehicle means every device in upon or by which any person or property is or may be transported or drawn upon a street or highway for the purpose of vending ice cream ice cream novelties or frozen treats intended for immediate consumption    9262017 registration required it is unlawful for any person to conduct ice cream vending within the corporate limits of the city without first obtaining required license or permits in accordance with this article 1 ice cream vendor license or permit all vendors shall make application with the city clerk all applications shall be accompanied by a nonrefundable registration fee the amount of the fee shall be as provided in the city fee schedule 2 health permit all vendors shall make application and pay a fee to the city clerk in the amount as set out in the city fee schedule 3 food handler permit each employee or person engaged in the handling or preparation of food or beverage shall obtain a food handler permit    9262017 registration application a all applications for new or renewal license or permits as an ice cream vendor shall be made upon a form prescribed by the city and submitted and filed with the city clerk all ice cream vendor license or permits are for a period of march 1february 28 license or permit fees are not prorated or refundable all application shall be reviewed and approved by the city health officer and police chief prior to issuance of the license b license or permit is nontransferable such form shall include the following 1 name and permanent address of the applicant and the business showing proof of identification if the applicant is not an individual the names and permanent address of the officers of the corporation or the members of the partnership firm association or other entity as the case may be  2 the name of the owner and the type make and registration number and description of the vehicle to be used  3 valid state sales tax id number  4 a statement as to whether or not the applicant has ever had an ice cream vending registration or other similar license or permit revoked or suspended by the city or any other city such a revocation or suspension may result in the citys refusal to process the application  5 a statement that the applicant understands and agrees that registration will not be used or represented in any way as an endorsement of the applicant by the city or by any department officer or elected or appointed official of the city  6 proof of a valid driver license for operation of the class of vehicle identified in the application for the applicant and any agent or employees of the applicant who will be involved in driving the identified vehicle  7 proof that the applicant has secured commercial general liability insurance for the mobile vending operation to be maintain for the entire length of the registration written by an insurance carrier licensed to do business in the state with minimum limits of $100000000 combined single limit for bodily and property damage each occurrence and $200000000 in the general aggregate in the description of operations section shall include the following ice cream vendor and city of leavenworth its assigned officers and affiliates are additional insured on a primary and noncontributory basis evidence of compliance with these insurance requirements shall be in the form of a certificate of insurance that shall be submitted with the application such insurance certificate shall not be cancelled without prior written notice to the city  and 8 signature of applicant individually or by its members and officers and any agents or employees of the applicant who will be involved in the appliedfor ice cream vendor license or permit certifying that all of the information provided in the application is true and correct c no license shall be issued under this division to any person who 1 is required to register pursuant to the kansas offender registration act ksa 224901 et seq or pursuant to an offender registration act of any state  2 has been convicted of a felony  3 has been convicted in the past five years of a misdemeanor or ordinance violation involving force violence deceit or fraud  or 3 has been convicted in the past three year of any law prohibiting leaving the scene of an accident  driving under the influence of alcohol or drugs  reckless driving  fleeing or eluding a police officer  driving while license is suspended or revoked  failure to report an accident  or five or more traffic violations not including parking violations    9262017 operating conditions it is unlawful for any ice cream vendor to 1 vend on a street where the posted speed limit exceeds 25 miles per hour nor exceed a speed of 15 miles an hour when seeking sales or when attempting to make a sale  2 stop anywhere within 25 feet of an intersection when making a sale or attempting to make a sale  3 doublepark or park in any manner contrary to any ordinance relating to parking when attempting a sale or when making a sale  4 make a uturn on any block  5 drive the vehicle backwards to make or attempt any sale  6 sell or attempt to sell to any person who is standing in the street  7 permit any person to hang on the vehicle or permit any person to ride in or on the vehicle except a driver and a bona fide assistant authorized by the owner of the vehicle or the licensee  8 remain standing or stopped at any place for a period of time exceeding ten minutes or otherwise stop or park a vehicle on the public rightofway for the purpose of making a sale so as to obstruct the free flow of traffic  9 sell or attempt to sell along any particular route more than one time during a 24hour period  10 sell or attempt to sell inside any city park or recreational area unless authorized by the city as part of a citysponsored event or as authorized by the parks and recreation director  11 sell or attempt to sell from a vehicle which is not equipped with a prominent sign visible to both the front and rear with the wording cautionchildren and flashing amber yellow caution lights on all four corners of the vehicle visible from front rear and both sides  12 use a sound device of any kind whatsoever except bell amplified music or chimes which are not audible any distance greater than 300 feet which are turned off when the vehicle is stationary for the purpose of seeking a sale or attempting to make a sale  13 sell or attempt to sell or use amplified music or chimes outside the hours of  am to 30 minutes after sunset  14 sell or attempt to sell while the vehicle is moving  or 15 sell or attempt to sell within 500 feet of an active school zone of a public or private school    9262017 exclusions the provisions of this division shall not apply to vendors selling as part of a cityapproved event or to vendors selling on public or private school property with the permission of any such school    9262017 vehicle inspection the police chief or designee or other public officer charged by the city manager with enforcement of this article may at any time cause any ice cream vendor unit to be inspected to determine that the unit is suitable from the standpoint of safety for the conduct of an ice cream business and that all provisions of this division and any other city ordinances relating to safety are being complied with    9262017 secs 2213822157  reserved article iii  privies cesspools and septic tanks inspection authority the public works director or his representative shall have the right to enter upon any premises and inspect the sanitary conditions therein to enforce this article      10222002 prohibition no person shall construct permit or maintain a privy vault or cesspool within the city limits septic tanks may not be constructed on any lot or premises where there is a public sanitary sewer and city water in any street alley or highway adjoining such lots or premises      10222002 abandonment  filling every septic tank located on premises described in section 22159 shall be abandoned within 90 days after a new sewer is laid and all abandoned privies septic tanks and cesspools must be thoroughly cleaned and filled with ashes cinders or other material not subject to decay or liable to cause a nuisance from any cause whatsoever      10222002 adoption of state board of health standards for construction construction of septic tanks shall comply with the standards as prescribed by the state board of health three copies of which are on file with the city clerk      10222002 installations rules and regulations pertaining to the installation of septic tanks in the city shall be as follows 1 permits a septic tank may be constructed upon any premises containing 21000 square feet or more within the city when a connection to a sanitary sewer is not available a permit for such installation shall be issued by the plumbing inspector upon approval by the city public works director upon application describing the location of the premises and the proposed design of such tank and appurtenances thereto and approval of the same and payment of the permit fee as provided in the city fee schedule 2 construction all septic tanks shall be of a factoryconstructed type of not less than 800gallon capacity of a type approved by the plumbing inspector and the city public works director each septic tank must be connected to at least 200 feet of factorymade lateral drain tile at least four inches in diameter the tank must be covered by a selfsealing factorydesigned top all tanks shall be inspected and approved by the public works director before being covered 3 approval of septic system prior to issuance of building permit where a public sewer is not available approval of a septic system must be obtained from the public works director before a building permit is issued 4 prohibited uses the use of wells or cesspools for use as a sewage disposal system is strictly prohibited      10222002 disinfection all septic tanks shall be disinfected when so ordered by the public works director or his authorized representative      10222002 temporary privies for workers all contractors or other persons employing men in constructing buildings street improvement or other similar work shall provide and care for such temporary privies as will meet the approval of the public works director      10222002 duty of owner to keep clean it is the duty of the owner or agents of property to keep all septic tanks on property owned or managed by them clean and to properly clean them when notified by the public works director to do so  and any expense incurred in cleaning or abating any nuisance shall be paid by the person owning the premises where the septic tank has been ordered cleaned by the public works director      10222002 requirement for dwelling houses no building shall be used as a dwelling house unless such building is provided with a sanitary sewer or septic tank      10222002 cleaning permit it is unlawful for any person to clean a septic tank until the equipment for cleaning the septic tank has been examined and approved by the public works director written approval by the public works director is sufficient guarantee of proper equipment to perform the work but the public works director may revoke the privilege of cleaning septic tanks at any time if the apparatus is not maintained in a satisfactory condition      10222002 specifications for containers used for removal of contents all carts receptacles containers and implements used in the removal of the contents of any septic tank shall be strong tight and so constructed that no part of the contents shall leak or fall therefrom and such carts receptacles containers and implements shall be kept covered and protected so that flies shall not have access thereto or to contents thereof      10222002 cleaning of containers used for removal of contents all carts receptacles containers and implements used in removing the contents of any septic tank shall be kept in an inoffensive and sanitary condition such carts receptacles containers and implements shall be thoroughly washed inside and outside after each use and when not in use shall be disinfected stored and kept in some place where they shall not become offensive or create a nuisance      10222002 time for cleaning the time of the day or year when septic tanks shall be cleaned will not be limited except in cases where a nuisance will be created by cleaning them in the daytime and in all cases the public works director shall be the judge in every and all cases where the public works director orders a septic tank cleaned at night the time for cleaning will be limited to the time between  pm and  am      10222002 time place and manner of cleaning the time place and manner of cleaning septic tanks and the disposal of the contents of septic tanks shall be determined by the public works director and written permission will be given designating the time place and manner of removal and disposal of the wastes disposal in every case shall be into a public sewage treatment facility      10222002 secs 2217222195  reserved article iv  temporary sewage lagoons prohibition no person shall construct permit or maintain a sewage lagoon within the city limits except as provided in this article temporary sewage lagoons shall not be constructed on any lot or premises where there is a public sanitary sewer available to serve such premises or where the percolation test by the city public works director indicates that such premises is suitable for septic tank and lateral field sewage systems      10222002 inspections  authority the public works director or representative shall have the right to enter upon any premises and inspect the sanitary conditions therein to enforce this article      10222002 adoption of state board of health standards for construction construction of temporary sewage lagoons shall comply with the standards as prescribed by the state board of health and as such standards may be amended      10222002 installations rules and regulations pertaining to the installation of temporary sewage lagoons in the city shall be as follows 1 permit a permit for such installation may be issued by the plumbing inspector upon approval by the public works director upon application describing the location of the premises the proposed design and approval of same by the state board of health and payment of a permit fee as provided in the city fee schedule 2 construction all temporary sewage lagoons constructed under authority of this article shall be totally retentive all temporary sewage lagoons shall be inspected and approved by the director of the city public works director before being placed in service 3 fencing all temporary sewage lagoons shall be enclosed with a minimum fence 60 inches in height of woven or welded wire with twoinch by fourinch maximum openings 4 compliance with all rules and regulations no person shall be issued a permit or undertake construction of a temporary sewage lagoon without full compliance with all rules and regulations adopted by the state department of health and environment the laws of the state and ordinances of the city      10222002 duty of owner to maintain the owner of the premises shall maintain the area within the fenced enclosure in accordance with the directions from the public works director failure to properly maintain including filling upon abandonment and cleaning within five days from notification from the public works director to do so shall constitute a nuisance and any expense incurred in cleaning or abating any nuisance shall be paid by the person owning the premises where the area has been ordered cleaned by the public works director      10222002 abandonment  filling every temporary sewage lagoon shall be abandoned within 90 days after a new sewer is available for use and all abandoned temporary sewage lagoons must be filled in accordance with directions from the public works director failure to so do shall constitute a nuisance      10222002 service of notice to abate nuisance the notice to abate a nuisance under this article shall be served as any other legal process may be served pursuant to law and shall contain an order to abate the nuisance within the time period set forth in this article describe the location of the nuisance and a description of what constitutes such nuisance a statement of acts necessary to abate the nuisance and a statement that if the nuisance is not abated as directed and no request for hearing is made within the prescribed time the city will abate such nuisance and assess the costs thereof against such person any costs incurred for abatement of such nuisance shall be certified to the city commission and if not paid by the owner of such premises shall be assessed against each lot or piece of ground chargeable therewith as a special assessment and the city clerk shall certify the assessment to the county clerk for collection as other special assessments are collected      10222002 penalty for violation of article any person who shall violate any of the provisions of this article shall be punished as provided in section 110 each days violation after notice to discontinue such practice shall be deemed a separate and distinct offense and punishable as such the penalties provided in this section shall be in addition to any action taken to abate an existing nuisance and it is further provided that the city may maintain an action in a court of competent jurisdiction to abate such nuisance and any person injured by the violation of any provisions of this section shall have the right of action for the abatement of such nuisance as may be by law provided      10222002 library footnotes  1  state law reference libraries generally ksa 121215 et seq article i  in general defined as used in this chapter the term library means the public library of the city    library board a established  membership the city has created a library board for the city which shall consist of seven members to be appointed in the manner and for terms provided by law the mayor shall be ex officio a member of such board with the same powers as appointed members b officers the library board shall annually meet and organize by the election of a chairperson a secretary and a treasurer and such other officers as they may deem necessary c regular and special meetings the library board shall fix the date and place of its regular meetings and special meetings may be called by the chairperson or upon written request of a majority of the members in the manner provided by law d duties the library board shall be responsible for the general operation and maintenance of the city library and shall make and adopt rules and regulations for the administration thereof e employment of librarian the library board shall employ a trained librarian to operate the library 23  42 state law reference library boards generally ksa 121222 et seq  powers and duties of library board ksa 121225 secs 2432422  reserved article ii  use restrictions footnotes  2  state law reference rules and regulations for use of library ksa 121227 injuring building and property any person who shall cut carve mark etch or engrave any character figure picture letter or name on the building occupied by the library or who shall willfully in any way injure or damage the building or who shall cut mar or injure any tree shrub plant fence wall or other public property in on or around the ground upon which the building is situated shall be guilty of a misdemeanor    destruction of books and other personal property any person who shall willfully injure or destroy any article of furniture book map plat chart magazine periodical picture statuary or other personal property belonging to or in care of the library shall be guilty of a misdemeanor    taking without permission it is unlawful for any person to take from the library any book map plat chart magazine periodical picture statuary or other personal property belonging to or in charge of the library except with the permission of the person legally in charge thereof and under the rules adopted by the board of directors of the library or to retain such book map plat chart magazine periodical picture statuary or any other personal property belonging to or in charge of the library for a longer period of time than specified in the rules adopted by the board of directors of the library and any person who shall fail or refuse to return such book map plat chart magazine periodical picture statuary or other personal property belonging to or in the care of the library shall be guilty of a misdemeanor    manufactured homes and parks footnotes  1  state law reference manufactured home and recreational vehicle ksa 751211 et seq  kansas manufactured housing act ksa 584201 et seq article i  in general secs 2612618  reserved article ii  travel trailer parks division 1  generally definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning natural or artificial barrier means any river pond canal railroad levee embankment fence hedge street or alley park means travel trailer park travel trailer means and includes any vehicle or similar portable structure constructed so as to permit its being used as a conveyance on a public street and so as to permit the occupancy thereof for dwelling or sleeping purposes by one or more persons provided that this definition shall refer to and include any portable contrivance used or intended to be used generally for temporary living or sleeping quarters and which is capable of being moved by its own power towed transported by or mounted upon another vehicle not exceeding eight feet in width and 30 feet in length travel trailer park means any plot of ground upon which one or more travel trailers occupied for dwelling or sleeping purposes are located regardless of whether or not a charge is made for such accommodation travel trailer space means a plot of ground within a camper park designed for the accommodation of one travel trailer    parking travel trailers it is unlawful for any person to park or leave any travel trailer in any place except a licensed travel trailer park provided that nothing in this article shall be construed to prohibit the storage of any travel trailer for any length of time when the travel trailer is not being used for living or sleeping purposes    park plan all travel trailer parks shall conform to the following requirements 1 the park shall be located on a welldrained site properly graded to ensure rapid drainage and freedom from stagnant pools of water 2 travel trailer spaces shall be provided consisting of a minimum of 2000 square feet for each space which shall be at least 25 feet wide and clearly defined travel trailers shall be so harbored on each space that there shall be at least a 15foot clearance between travel trailers no travel trailers shall be located closer than five feet from any property line bounding the park 3 all travel trailer spaces shall abut upon a driveway of not less than 12 feet in width which shall have unobstructed access to a public street alley or highway all driveways shall be of allweather construction wellmarked in the daytime and lighted at night with 25watt lamps at intervals of 100 feet located approximately 15 feet from the ground 4 walkways not less than two feet wide shall be provided from the travel trailer spaces to the service buildings the walkways shall be of allweather construction wellmarked in the daytime and lighted at night with 25watt lamps at intervals of 100 feet located approximately 15 feet from the ground 5 each park shall provide service buildings to house toilet facilities bathing facilities laundry facilities and other sanitary facilities as prescribed in this article 6 an electrical outlet supply at least 110 volts shall be provided for each travel trailer space    location travel trailer parks may be located as provided in the zoning ordinance of the city each boundary of the park must be at least 200 feet from any permanent residence building located outside the park unless separated therefrom by a natural or artificial barrier or unless a majority of the property owners residing in the area within 200 feet therefrom consent in writing to the establishment of the park    water supply an adequate supply of pure water for drinking and domestic purposes shall be supplied to meet the requirements of the park the water supply shall be obtained from faucets only no common drinking cups shall be permitted cold water supply faucets shall be located on each travel trailer space an adequate supply of hot water shall be provided at all times in the service building for bathing washing and laundry facilities    fire protection every park shall be equipped at all times with one fire extinguisher in good working order for every ten travel trailer spaces located not farther than 200 feet from each travel trailer space no open fires shall be permitted at any place which would endanger life or property no fires shall be left unattended at any time    sanitary facilities each park shall be provided with toilets baths or showers and other sanitary facilities which shall conform to the following requirements 1 toilet facilities for men and women shall be either in separate buildings at least 20 feet apart or shall be separated if in the same building 2 toilet facilities for women shall consist of not less than one flush toilet for every 15 travel trailer spaces  one shower or bathtub for every 15 travel trailer spaces  and one lavatory for every 20 travel trailer spaces each toilet shower or bathtub shall be in a private compartment 3 toilet facilities for men shall consist of not less than one flush toilet for every 15 travel trailer spaces  one shower or bathtub for every 15 travel trailer spaces  one lavatory for every 15 travel trailer spaces  and one single urinal for every 15 travel trailer spaces each toilet shower and bathtub shall be in a private compartment 4 service buildings housing the toilet facilities shall be permanent structures complying with all applicable ordinances and statutes regulating buildings electrical installations and plumbing and sanitation systems and shall be located not closer than ten feet nor farther than 200 feet from any travel trailer space 5 the service buildings shall be well lighted at all times of the day or night  shall be well ventilated with screened openings  shall be constructed of such moistureproof material including painted woodwork as shall permit repeated cleaning and washing  and shall be maintained at a temperature of at least 68 degrees fahrenheit during the period from october 1 to may 1 the floors of the service buildings shall be of waterimpervious material and shall slope to a floor drain connected with the sewage system 6 all service buildings and the grounds of the park shall be maintained in a clean sightly condition and kept free of any condition that will menace the health of any occupant or the public or constitute a nuisance    laundry facilities the laundry facilities in all parks shall be provided in the ratio of one double laundry tub and ironing board for every 30 travel trailer spaces an electrical outlet supplying current sufficient to operate an iron shall be located conveniently near the ironing board drying spaces shall be provided sufficiently to accommodate the laundry of the travel trailer occupants the service building housing the laundry facilities shall be a permanent structure complying with all applicable ordinances and statutes regulating buildings electrical installations and plumbing and sanitation systems    sewage disposal waste from showers bathtubs toilets and laundries shall be discharged into a public sewer system in compliance with applicable ordinances or into a private sewer and disposal plant or septic tank system of such construction and in such manner as will present no health hazard all kitchen sinks washbasins bath or shower tubs in any travel trailer harbored in any park may empty into a sanitary sink drain located on the travel trailer space    garbage rubbish receptacles tightly covered garbage cans shall be provided in quantities adequate to permit disposal of all garbage and rubbish in parks garbage cans shall be located not farther than 200 feet from any travel trailer space the cans shall be kept in sanitary condition at all times garbage and rubbish shall be collected and disposed of as frequently as may be necessary to ensure that the garbage cans shall not overflow    animals and pets no owner or person in charge of any dog cat or other pet animal shall permit it to commit any nuisance within the limits of any travel trailer park    register of occupants a it shall be the duty of the licensee under this article to keep a register containing a record of all travel trailer owners and occupants located within the park the register shall contain the following information 1 name and address of each occupant 2 the make model and year of all automobiles and travel trailers 3 license number and owner of each travel trailer and automobile by which it is towed 4 the state issuing such license 5 the dates of arrival and departure of each travel trailer b the park shall keep the register required by this section available for inspection at all times by law enforcement officers public health officials and other officials whose duties necessitate acquisition of the information contained in the register the licensee shall be required at the end of each calendar month to deliver a copy of the months register to the city license collector the register records shall not be destroyed for a period of three years following the date of registration    secs 26312648  reserved division 2  license required it is unlawful for any person to maintain or operate within the limits of the city any travel trailer park unless such person shall first obtain a license therefor    application a applications for a travel trailer park license shall be filed with and issued by the city clerk applications shall be in writing signed by the applicant and shall contain the following 1 the name and address of the applicant 2 the location and legal description of the travel trailer park 3 a complete plan of the park showing compliance with section 2621 4 plans and specifications of all buildings and other improvements constructed or to be constructed within the travel trailer park 5 such further information as may be required to enable a determination to be made if the proposed park will comply with legal requirements b the application and all accompanying plans and specifications required by this section shall be filed in triplicate    investigation of applicant  issuance the city engineer and the police chief shall investigate the applicant under this division and inspect the proposed plans and specifications if the applicant is found to be of good moral character and the proposed travel trailer park will be in compliance with all provisions of this article and all applicable ordinances or statutes the city clerk shall issue the license upon completion of the park according to the plans    fee the license fee required under this division shall be as provided in the city fee schedule    posting the license certificate issued under this division shall be conspicuously posted in the office of or on the premises of the travel trailer park at all times    revocation  reissuance the city commission may revoke any license to maintain and operate a park when the licensee has been found guilty by a court of competent jurisdiction of violating any provision of this article after such conviction the license may be reissued if the circumstances leading to conviction have been remedied and the park is being maintained and operated in full compliance with law    secs 26552681  reserved article iii  manufactured home parks division 1  generally definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning driveway means a minor private way used by vehicles and pedestrians on a manufactured home lot or used for common access to a small group of lots or facilities license means a written license issued by the license inspector allowing a person to operate and maintain a manufactured home park under the provisions of this article and regulations issued under this article license inspector means the agent or agents of the city responsible for approving the issuance of a license manufactured home means a structure which is subject to the federal act national manufactured home construction and safety standards act of 197 42 usc 54015426 and which is transportable in one or more sections which in the traveling mode is eight body feet or more in width or 40 body feet or more in length or when erected onsite is 320 or more square feet and which is built on a permanent chassis and designed to be used as a dwelling with or without permanent foundation when connected to the required utilities and includes the plumbing heating air conditioning and electrical systems contained therein and such term shall include any structure which meets all the requirements of this subsection except the size requirements and with respect to which the manufacturer voluntarily files with the federal department of housing and urban development a certification required by the secretary of housing and urban development and complies with the standards established under the federal act except that such term shall not include any selfpropelled recreational vehicle manufactured home lot means a parcel of land for the placement of a single manufactured home and the exclusive use of its occupants manufactured home park means a contiguous parcel of land which has been developed for the placement of manufactured homes and is owned by an individual a firm trust partnership public or private association or corporation manufactured home stand means that part of an individual lot which has been reserved for the placement of one manufactured home unit park management means the person who owns or has charge care or control of the manufactured home park park street means a private way which affords principal means of access to individual manufactured home lots or auxiliary buildings permit means a written license issued by the license inspector permitting the construction alteration and extension of a manufactured home park under the provisions of this article and all other city ordinances service building means a structure housing toilet lavatory and such other facilities as may be required by this article sewer connection means the connection consisting of all pipes fittings and appurtenances from the drain outlet of the manufactured home to the inlet of the corresponding sewer riser pipe of the sewerage system serving the manufactured home park sewer riser pipe means that portion of the sewer lateral which extends vertically to the ground elevation and terminates at each manufactured home lot water connection means the connection consisting of all pipes fittings and appurtenances from the water riser pipe to the water inlet pipe of the distribution system within the manufactured home water riser pipe means that portion of the water supply system serving the manufactured home park which extends vertically to the ground elevation and terminates at a designated point at each manufactured home lot    exemptions from article provisions a where the city commission finds that compliance with provisions of this article would result in undue hardship an exemption may be granted by the city commission without impairing the intent and purpose of this article deviations from design construction and installation provisions shall be brought into compliance with this article within a reasonable period of time based on economic feasibility of improvement nature significance and extent of deviation depreciation of material improvement and layout in use and other similar factors within a minimum period not exceeding five years and a maximum period not exceeding 25 years such period shall begin after the license inspector has given notice of a certain and specific deviation from this article to the person to whom the permit or certification was issued b gradual improvements to a higher degree of conformity shall be permissive provided that there shall be complete conformity at the end of a period prescribed by the city commission    permanent improvements to be installed prior to occupancy all permanent improvements shall be installed in manufactured home parks before occupancy is permitted    compliance with building code required all construction in manufactured home parks shall be in compliance with the building code of the city    secs 268626113  reserved division 2  construction permit required it is unlawful for any person to construct alter or extend any manufactured home park within the limits of the city unless such person holds a valid permit issued by the city commission in the name of such person for the specific construction alteration or extension proposed    applications requiring rezoning  fees  approval a applications under this division requiring rezoning shall have attached to the request a preliminary site plan prepared by a licensed professional engineer of the state the preliminary site plan shall contain the following 1 name address and telephone number of the applicant 2 the acreage and dimensions of the tract of land 3 contour intervals of not more than two feet 4 north point scale and date of drawing 5 the number location and size of all manufactured home lots 6 the location and width of roadways and walkways 7 location and size of designated recreation areas and other open space 8 one typical manufactured home lot showing proposed development to include but not be limited to roadway offstreet parking manufactured home stand patio storage and walkways 9 the location of water and sewer lines both existing and proposed 10 proposed location and size of all buildings to be constructed 11 approximate location of all areas subject to flooding and the location width and direction of flow of all water 12 location and method of enclosing rubbish and garbage disposal areas 13 location of all existing public streets within 200 feet of the proposed park 14 location of all dwellings within 200 feet of the proposed park 15 preliminary drainage plan of park showing proposed method of carrying surface water to an adequate point of disposition 16 proposed development schedule b all applications requesting rezoning shall be accompanied by a deposit fee as set out in the city fee schedule to be filed with the city clerk a public hearing will be held in accordance with the zoning ordinance c the city commission after receiving the recommendation from the city planning commission shall either approve or disapprove the use of the land for a manufactured home park if approved no permit shall be issued until complete final engineering plans and specifications are approved and a performance bond is filed with the city clerk    permit applications  review  approval a all applications for manufactured home park permits shall be submitted to the city commission with preliminary plans as set out in section 26115 and complete final engineering plans and specifications prepared by a licensed professional engineer of the state showing but not limited to the following 1 name address and telephone number of the applicant 2 north point scale and date of drawing 3 the number location and size of all manufactured home lots 4 the acreage and dimensions of the tract of land 5 the locations and dimensions of a roadways walkways driveways  b patios storage areas manufactured home stands 6 the location size and dimensions of offstreet parking 7 the number location and dimensions of designated recreation areas 8 the location and details of lighting and electrical systems 9 the plans and specifications of a water and sewer lines  b refuse disposal  c all buildings constructed or to be constructed  d storm drainage 10 landscaping plan 11 any other site improvements b the preliminary site plan and complete final engineering plans and specifications shall be referred to a review committee made up of representatives of the following departments or agencies including but not limited to city engineering planning building inspection utilities health and fire who shall review and make recommendations to the city planning commission or the city commission c the city commission shall approve the issuance of a permit based on the approval of complete final engineering plans and specifications by the review committee and a performance bond filed with the city clerk permit approval is subject to beginning construction within two years of approval or permit shall be voided    performance bond  return a the performance bond for a manufactured home park permit consisting of a cashiers check or surety bond shall be made payable to the city in the amount equal to the full cost of improvements including but not limited to roadways walkways water and sewer lines patios manufactured home stands curb and gutter community buildings landscaping and recreational facilities as established by the city engineer b a copy of asbuilt plans shall be filed with the city engineer the performance bond shall be returned by the city clerk when construction is completed    fee the fee for the construction of a manufactured home park shall be as provided in the city fee schedule    secs 2611926149  reserved division 3  business license required it shall be unlawful for any person to operate any mobile home park within the limits of the city unless such person holds a valid license issued annually by the city clerk in the name of such person for the specific mobile home park    application  renewal application for an original and renewal license under this division shall be made to and on a form provided by the city clerk and shall be accompanied by the amount provided in the city fee schedule    issuance issuance of an original and renewal license by the city clerk shall determine whether there is compliance with this chapter and the city development regulations licenses are for a period of january 1 to december 31 of each year and are not prorated transferable or refundable    monthly inhabited lot fee in addition to the annual license fee each park shall pay a fee for each manufactured home occupying a lot for a period more than 20 days each month the monthly fee shall be paid in the amount provided in the city fee schedule fees may be paid each calendar quarter    hearing on denials any person whose application for a license under this division has been denied may request and shall be granted a hearing on the matter before the governing body under the procedure provided by division 5 of this article    transfer sale or disposal of interest every person holding a license under this division shall give notice in writing to the city clerk within 24 hours after having sold transferred given away or otherwise disposed of interest in or control of any manufactured home park such notice shall include the name and address of the person succeeding to the ownership or control of such mobile home park    suspension whenever upon inspection of any manufactured home park the city inspector finds that conditions or practices exist which are in violation of any provision of this article the city inspector shall give notice in writing in accordance with section 26205 to the person to whom the license was issued that unless such conditions or practices are corrected within a reasonable period of time specified in the notice by the city inspector the license shall be suspended at the end of such period the city inspector shall reinspect such conditions or practices in the manufactured home park and if they have not been corrected the city clerk shall suspend the license and give notice in writing of such suspension to the person to whom the license is issued upon receipt of notice of such suspension such person shall cease operation of such manufactured home park except as provided in section 26206    secs 2615726178  reserved division 4  inspections authority of license inspector generally the license inspector is authorized and directed to make such inspections as are necessary to determine satisfactory compliance with this article    right of entry subject to constitutional limitations the license inspector shall have the power to enter at reasonable times upon any private or public property for the purpose of inspecting and investigating conditions relating to the enforcement of this article    inspections of register it shall be the license inspectors power to inspect the register containing a record of all residents of the manufactured home park    duty of park management it shall be the duty of every park management to give the license inspector free access to all lots at reasonable times for the purpose of inspection    duty of occupants it shall be the duty of every occupant of a manufactured home park to give the owner thereof or any agent or employee access to any part of such manufactured home park at reasonable times for the purpose of making such repairs or alterations as are necessary to effect compliance with this article    secs 2618426204  reserved division 5  notices of violation hearings and orders notice of violations when the license inspector determines that there are reasonable grounds to believe that there has been a violation of any provision of this article the license inspector shall give notice of such alleged violation to the person to whom the permit or license was issued as provided in this section such notice shall 1 be in writing  2 include a statement of the reasons for its issuance  3 allow a reasonable time for the performance of any act it requires  4 be served upon the owner or his agent as the case may require provided that such notice or order shall be deemed to have been properly served upon such owner or agent when a copy thereof has been sent by registered mail to the owners lastknown address or when the owner has been served with such notice by any method authorized or required by the laws of this state  5 contain an outline of remedial action which if taken will affect compliance with the provisions of this article    hearing any person affected by any notice which has been issued in connection with the enforcement of any provisions of this article may request and shall be granted a hearing on the matter before the city commission provided that such person shall file in the office of the license inspector a written petition requesting such hearing and setting forth a brief statement of the grounds therefor within ten days after the day the notice was served the filing of the request for a hearing shall operate as a stay of the notice and of the suspension except in the case of an order issued under section 26209 upon receipt of such petition the license inspector shall set a time and place for such hearing and shall give the petitioner written notice thereof at such hearing the petitioner shall be given an opportunity to be heard and to show why such notice should be modified or withdrawn the hearing shall be commenced not later than ten days after the day on which the petition was filed provided that upon application of the petitioner the license inspector may postpone the date of the hearing for a reasonable time beyond such tenday period when in the license inspectors judgment the petitioner has submitted good and sufficient reasons for such postponement    orders after the hearing the city commission shall make findings as to compliance with the provisions of this article and shall issue an order in writing sustaining modifying or withdrawing the notice which shall be served as provided in section 262054 upon failure to comply with any order sustaining or modifying a notice the license of the manufactured home park affected by the order shall be revoked    records of proceedings the proceedings at the hearing including the findings and decision of the license inspector and together with a copy of every notice and order related thereto shall be entered as a matter of public record in the office of the city clerk but the transcript of the proceedings need not be transcribed unless judicial review of the decision is sought    emergency orders when the license inspector finds that an emergency exists which requires immediate action to protect the public health the license inspector may without notice or hearing issue an order reciting the existence of such an emergency and requiring that such action be taken as the license inspector may deem necessary to meet the emergency including the suspension of the permit or license notwithstanding any other provisions of this article such order shall be effective immediately any person to whom such an order is directed shall comply therewith immediately but upon petition to the license inspector shall be afforded a hearing as soon as possible the provisions of sections 26207 and 26208 shall be applicable to such hearing and the order issued thereafter    judicial review any person aggrieved by the decision of the city commission under this division may seek relief therefrom in any court of competent jurisdiction as provided by the laws of this state    secs 2621126228  reserved division 6  environmental open space and access requirements requirements generally conditions of soil groundwater level drainage and topography in manufactured home parks shall not create hazards to the property or to the health or safety of the occupants the site shall not be exposed to objectionable smoke noise odors or other adverse influences and no portion subject to unpredictable or sudden flooding subsidence or erosion shall be used for any purpose which would expose persons or property to hazards    minimum park area the minimum manufactured home park area shall be ten gross acres    park area coverage total buildings shall not exceed 30 percent of the manufactured home park area drives walkways and parking shall not exceed 20 percent of the manufactured home park area open area including landscaped areas shall be not less than 42 percent of the manufactured home park area    soil and ground cover exposed ground surfaces in all parts of every manufactured home park shall be paved or covered with stone screenings or other solid material or protected with a vegetative growth that is capable of preventing soil erosion and of eliminating objectionable dust    site drainage the ground surface in all parts of every manufactured home park shall be graded and equipped to drain all surface water in a safe efficient manner    areas for nonresident uses no part of any manufactured home park shall be used for nonresidential purposes except such uses that are required for the direct servicing and wellbeing of park residents and for the management and maintenance of the park nothing contained in this section shall be deemed as prohibiting the sale of a manufactured home located on a manufactured home stand and connected to the pertinent utilities    minimum area of manufactured home lot manufactured home lots shall be provided in each manufactured home park with at least 4275 square feet with minimum dimensions 45 feet by 95 feet for manufactured homes not exceeding 14 feet in width and 6000 square feet with minimum dimensions 60 feet by 100 feet for manufactured homes exceeding 14 feet in width    maximum density there shall be not more than six manufactured home lots per gross acre    required
