least 30 feet to 50 feet apart except where a special permit is obtained from the parks and recreation director 5 no tree shall be planted where the clear space between the curb and sidewalk is less than three feet 6 no tree shall be planted nearer than one foot from the curbline or outer line of the sidewalk 7 no tree shall be planted nearer than 35 feet from the rightofway lines of two intersecting streets    visibility at intersections all trees shrubs and bushes located on the triangle formed by two rightofway lines at the intersection of two streets and the line connecting the points a distance of 35 feet each way from the intersection of the rightofway lines on any corner lot within the city shall not be permitted to grow to a height of more than 24 inches above the road level of any street avenue or alley in order that the view of the driver of a vehicle approaching a street intersection shall not be obstructed no trees may be planted in this area    damage to trees prohibited no person shall without authority break injure mutilate kill or destroy any tree or shrub or set any fire or the heat thereof to injure any portion of any tree no person owning using or having control or charge of gas or any other substance deleterious to tree life shall allow such gas or other deleterious substance to come in contact with the soil surrounding the roots of any tree shrub or plant    duties of property owners and others a restriction on trees owner may plant maintain and remove the owner of land abutting on any street may when acting within the provisions of this article prune spray plant or remove trees in that part of the street abutting such owners land not used for public travel b owner to remove dead trees and limbs it is the duty of the owner occupant or person in charge of any lot or piece of ground in the city to provide for the removal of all dead trees and dead tree limbs from such lot or piece of ground including the parking areas adjacent thereto any such condition shall be deemed to be a nuisance and in case of the failure neglect or refusal of the owner occupant or person in charge of the lot or piece of ground to provide for such removal the city shall cause such removal to be done and charge the entire cost of such removal against the lot or piece of ground in the manner provided in section 285 c permit required for deviation from city regulations a street tree permit is required only when the owner of property intends to deviate from the rules and regulations contained within this article  except that when a property owner requests the city to plant a tree on the rightofway in front of the owners property the owner shall be required to sign a street tree permit agreeing to care for such tree d trimming by owner required every owner of any tree overhanging any street or rightofway within the city shall trim the branches so that such branches shall not obstruct the light from any street lamp or obstruct the view of any street intersection and so that there shall be a clear space of ten feet above the surface of the street or rightofway the owner shall remove all dead diseased or dangerous trees or broken or decayed limbs which constitute a menace to the safety of the public the city shall have the right to trim any tree or shrub on private property when it interferes with the proper spread of light along the street from a street light or interferes with the visibility of any traffic control device or sign such trimming to be confined to the area immediately above the rightofway e trimming by persons maintaining poles and wires required to prevent the destruction of shade and ornamental trees along the streets and highways of the city all persons maintaining wires or poles in the city their agents servants and employees are prohibited from cutting or trimming trees except under the direction of the city manager or some other person duly authorized by the city manager to do so  3740 3745 3748 3749   11863 11868 11871 11872 violations and enforcement a notice of violation if a violation of this article occurs the city shall serve notice on the owner or other occupant of the affected property identifying the violation and stating that the owner or occupant has ten days to correct the violation if the violation is not corrected within ten days after service of the notice the owner or occupant shall be guilty of a misdemeanor b service of notice the notice under this section may be served by delivering the notice or a copy thereof to the owner or occupant or by leaving the notice at the owners or occupants usual place of business or abode  or if the owner is a nonresident of the city by posting the notice in a conspicuous place upon the lot in front of which the trees are located c abatement by city  costs if an owner or occupant fails to correct the violation within the time permitted the violation may be corrected by the city at the expense of the owner or occupant and the costs thereof shall be collected as provided in section 285  3747   11870 secs 4218642209  reserved article vi  street addresses duty of owners and occupants to ensure building numbering it is the duty of all persons owning or occupying buildings fronting on any public street avenue or public grounds of the city to cause such buildings to be numbered in conformity with the provisions of this article     32158 9131988 numbering system generally all the streets of the city shall be so named and numbered as will best suit public safety and achieve an efficient manner of locating addresses for public travel and commerce     32159 9131988 north and south streets numbering a shawnee street shall constitute the base for a grid of all streets running north and south all north and south streets shall be numbered according to a northsouth grid map on file in the city clerks office and made part of this article as though set forth herein all parts of streets running north or northerly from shawnee street shall be designated respectively by the prefix north to the names of such streets and all parts of streets running south or southerly from shawnee street shall be designated respectively by the prefix south to the names of such streets all streets running north and south which do not intersect shawnee street shall be numbered according to the grid map and contain a prefix only when needed b streets that run north and south shall be numbered commencing on the north side of shawnee street with number 100 with alternating even numbers on the right side from the point of starting and with alternating odd numbers on the left side eg the number 101 on the southeast corner of shawnee street and all streets running south and the northwest corner of all streets running north  201 on the southeast or northwest corner of the second street from shawnee street as the case may be going north or south  300 in the third block and 400 in the fourth block and so on  32162   102374  32160 32161 9131988 east and west street numbering all the streets of the city which run east and west shall be numbered according to an eastwest grid map on file in the office of the city clerk and adopted as though set forth in this article the grid starts with the number one at the missouri river and increases to the west with the numbers alternating from side to side so that even numbers shall be on the north side and odd numbers on the south side     32162 9131988 size and placement of numbers all buildings shall display a number which is visible from the street if the number is placed on the building itself the size of the number shall not be less than four inches in length and shall be legible and conspicuously placed on above or by the side of the door of each building fronting on or adjacent to any street avenue or public ground     32163 9131988 application to new buildings all numbering of streets avenues or public grounds in this city shall be in accordance with the provisions of this article and when the lots or parts of lots adjacent to or abutting upon any street avenue or public grounds are vacant or have no building upon them no number will be required  but if at any time a building shall be erected upon such lots or parts of lots the owner or occupant of the building shall within 30 days after its completion be subject to all the provisions of this article with reference to numbering such building     32164 9131988 posting house numbers on curbs sidewalks and other city property prohibited it is unlawful for any person or business entity to stamp paint or otherwise place house numbers on city curbs sidewalks or other public property location of street signs street signs shall be located at all street intersections and placed so as to maximize visibility to traffic from all directions the sign location shall be determined by the operations superintendent   32165 9131988 secs 4221842242  reserved article vii  special events permit required  exceptions no person shall engage in participate in aid form or start any parade run walk or other organized activity on the public streets referred to in this article as a special event unless a special event permit shall have been obtained from the office of the city clerk  provided however that this article shall not apply to funeral processions students going to and from school classes or participating in educational activities under the immediate direction and supervision of the proper school authorities or a governmental agency acting within the scope of its functions     32185 2251992 application for permit application for a special event permit is made in writing to the city clerk on forms provided by the city clerk at least eight weeks in advance of the date of the proposed special event the city manager may in his discretion consider any application for a permit to conduct a special event which is filed less than eight weeks prior to the date such special event is to be conducted the application shall contain the following information so that adequate arrangements may be made for the proper policing 1 the name address and telephone number of the person seeking to conduct such a special event if he is not a resident of the city then there shall be listed the name address and telephone number of a local representative which should be included along with the name address and telephone number of the sponsoring organization and its chief officer 2 if the special event is proposed to be conducted for on behalf of or by an organization the name address and telephone number of the headquarters of the organization and of the authorized and responsible heads of such organization 3 the date and hours when the special event is to be conducted 4 the proposed special event route and location of any reviewing stands 5 the estimated number of people vehicles and animals and the types of animals that will take part in the special event 6 any additional information which the city staff shall find reasonably necessary to make a fair determination as to whether a permit should be issued     32186 2251992 standards for issuance the city clerk with the approval of the city manager shall issue a permit under this article when from a consideration of the application and other available information he finds that 1 the conduct of the special event will not substantially interrupt the safe and orderly movement of other traffic contiguous to its route 2 the conduct of the special event will not require the diversion of so great a number of police officers of the city to properly police the line of movement and the areas contiguous thereto as to prevent normal police protection to the city 3 the concentration of persons animals and vehicles at assembly points of the special event will not unduly interfere with proper fire and police protection of or ambulance service to areas contiguous to such assembly area 4 the conduct of such special event will not adversely affect or interfere with the movement of firefighting equipment in route to a fire 5 the conduct of the special event is not reasonably likely to cause injury to persons or property to provoke disorderly conduct or to create a disturbance 6 the special event is scheduled to move from its point of origin to its point of termination expeditiously and without unreasonable delays in route 7 the special event is not to held for the sole purpose of advertising any product goods or event and is not designed to be held purely for private profit 8 the special event will not substantially interfere with any other special event for which a permit has already been granted 9 the applicant has provided for services of that number and type of special event monitors which the police chief considers reasonably necessary to ensure that the special event will be conducted in conformity with the special event permit 10 the applicant has not materially misrepresented any facts or information set forth in his application for a special event permit     32187 2251992 liability insurance required before a license shall be issued under this article the applicant for such license shall file with the city clerk a certificate of liability insurance issued by a company authorized to do business in the state providing $100000000 per occurrence for bodily injury or property and $200000000 aggregate coverage in the description of operations section shall include the name of the activity and city of leavenworth its assigned officers and affiliates are additional insured on a primary and noncontributory basis the policy shall further include a provision that notice of change or cancellation shall be given to the city in addition the applicant shall hold the city harmless for any and all claims that may arise against the city by any person for damages to persons or property caused by the licensee     32187 2251992 appeal procedure upon denial of application upon a denial by the city manager of an application made pursuant to this article the applicant may appeal from the determination of the city manager by filing a written notice of appeal to the city clerk for hearing by the city commissioners the city commission shall hear the appeal at its next regular meeting upon such appeal the city commission may reverse affirm or modify in any regard the determination of the city manager     32188 2251992 notice of issuance upon the approval of a special event permit the city clerk shall send a copy of the approved application to the applicant the police chief and the fire chief     32189 2251992 revocation the city manager or his designated representative shall have the authority to revoke a special event permit issued under this article upon application of the standards for issuance as set forth in this article     32192 2251992 special event route reviewing stands and assembly points to be determined by police chief the special event will follow the designated special event route as determined by the police chief and state the location of any reviewing stands if any the proposed special event will assemble and disband in the staging area as determined by the police chief     32186 2251992 interference with private property or restricted areas prohibited no assembling or disbanding will encroach upon occupy or traverse any private property or restricted area     32186 2251992 compliance with applicable law required  throwing items from special event vehicles prohibited a permittee under this article shall comply with all permit directions and conditions and with all applicable laws and ordinances and shall prohibit any candy gum or other items from being thrown tossed or otherwise distributed from vehicles in the special event     32190 2251992 public conduct during special event a interference no person shall unreasonably hamper obstruct impede or interfere with any special event assembly or with any person vehicle or animal participating or used in a special event b driving events no driver of a vehicle shall drive between the vehicles or persons comprising a special event when such vehicles or persons are in motion and are conspicuously designated as a special event c parking on special event route the police chief shall have the authority when reasonably necessary to prohibit or restrict the parking of vehicles along a highway or part thereof constituting a part of the route of a special event the police chief shall post signs to such effect and it is unlawful for any person to park or leave unattended any vehicle in violation thereof no person shall be liable for parking on a street unposted in violation of this section     32191 2251992 violations it is deemed unlawful to intentionally give false information in obtaining a permit or for any person to violate or fail to comply with the provisions of this article     32193 2251992 traffic and vehicles footnotes  1  state law reference traffic and vehicles ksa 8113 et seq  powers of local authorities ksa 82002 article i  in general standard traffic ordinance adopted  amendments a adoption there is hereby incorporated by reference for the purpose of regulating traffic within the corporate limits of the city that certain standard traffic ordinance known as the standard traffic kansas cities edition of 201 prepared and published in book form by the league of kansas municipalities topeka kansas save and except such articles sections parts or portions as are hereafter omitted deleted modified or changed b marked copies on file one copy of said standard traffic be marked or stamped official copy as adopted by  with all sections and portions thereof intended to be omitted or changed clearly marked to show any such omission or change and to which shall be attached a copy of filed with the city clerk to be open to inspection and available to the public at all reasonable business hours the police department municipal judge and all administrative departments of the city charged with enforcement of the ordinance shall be supplied at the cost of the city such number of official copies of such standard traffic marked as may be deemed expedient c amendments the standard traffic ordinance adopted in this section is adopted subject to the following local amendments 1 inspection at all reasonable business hours    282011   9132011   9112012   9102013   992014   982015   9132016   9122017   8282018   1 8272019 mandatory license suspensions conviction records and final appeal disposition records a court to forward surrendered licenses to state when any person is convicted of any offense in the municipal court for which ksa 8255 makes mandatory the suspension of the driver license of such person by the state motor vehicle division the municipal court shall require the surrender to it of all licenses then held by the person so convicted and the court shall thereupon forward such licenses or if such court has a clerk shall direct the clerk of such court to so forward such licenses together with a record of such conviction to the state motor vehicle division within ten days from the date the conviction becomes final b clerk to provide record of convictions to state the municipal court shall also forward to the state motor vehicle division a record of the conviction of any person in the court for a violation of any ordinance of the city relating to the operation of motor vehicles other than regulations governing standing and parking such record of conviction shall be made upon any form approved by the state motor vehicle division and shall include the name and address of the party charged his driver license number the registration number of the vehicle involved the nature of the offense the date of hearing the plea the judge whether bail or bond was forfeited and the amount of fine or forfeiture as the case may be c clerk to forward final disposition of appeals to state the clerk of the court shall within ten days of the final disposition of any appeal forward a notification of such final disposition to the motor vehicle division d conviction defined for the purpose of this section the term conviction means a final conviction without regard to whether sentence was suspended or probation granted after such conviction also for the purposes of this section a forfeiture of bail bond or collateral deposited to secure a defendants appearance in court which forfeiture has not been vacated shall be equivalent to a conviction    breath and blood alcohol tests for driver under 21 years of age a it is unlawful for any person less than 21 years of age to operate or attempt to operate a vehicle in this state with a breath or blood alcohol content of 002 or greater b when a law enforcement officer determines that a breath or blood alcohol test is to be required of a person less than 21 years of age pursuant to ksa 81001 or ksa 82142 in addition to any other notices required by law the law enforcement officer shall provide written and oral notice that 1 it is unlawful for any person less than 21 years of age to operate or attempt to operate a vehicle in this state with a breath or blood alcohol content of 002 or greater  and 2 if the person is less than 21 years of age at the time of the test request and submits to and completes the test or tests and the test results show an alcohol concentration of 002 or greater the persons driving privileges will be suspended for at least 30 days upon the first occurrence and for one year upon a second or subsequent occurrence c any suspension and restriction of driving privileges pursuant to this section shall be in addition to any disqualification from driving a commercial motor vehicle pursuant to ksa 82142 d when a breath or blood alcohol test is requested pursuant to ksa 81001 from a person less than 21 years of age and results in a test result of 002 or greater but less than 008 a law enforcement officers certification under this section shall be prepared the certification required by this section shall be signed by one or more officers to certify that 1 certification requirements a there existed reasonable grounds to believe the person was operating a vehicle while under the influence of alcohol or drugs or both or to believe that the person had been driving a commercial motor vehicle as defined in ksa 82128 while having alcohol or other drugs in such persons system  b the person had been placed under arrest was in custody or had been involved in a vehicle accident or collision  c a law enforcement officer had presented the person with the oral and written notice required by this section  d that the person was less than 21 years of age at the time of the test request  and e the result of the test showed that the person had an alcohol concentration of 002 or greater in such persons blood or breath 2 with regard to a breath test in addition to those matters required to be certified under subsection d1 of this section that a the testing equipment used was certified by the state department of health and environment  b the testing procedures used were in accordance with the requirements set out by the state department of health and environment  and c the person who operated the testing equipment was certified by the state department of health and environment to operate such equipment e if a hearing is requested as a result of a law enforcement officers certification under this section the scope of the hearing shall be limited to whether 1 a law enforcement officer had reasonable grounds to believe the person was operating a vehicle while under the influence of alcohol or drugs or both or to believe that the person had been driving a commercial motor vehicle as defined in ksa 82128 while having alcohol or other drugs in such persons system  2 the person was in custody or arrested for an alcohol or drug related offense or was involved in a motor vehicle accident or collision resulting in property damage personal injury or death  3 a law enforcement officer had presented the person with the oral and written notice required by ksa 81001 and the oral and written notice required by this section  4 the testing equipment used was reliable  5 the person who operated the testing equipment was qualified  6 the testing procedures used were reliable  7 the test result determined that the person had an alcohol concentration of 002 or greater in such persons blood or breath  8 the person was operating a vehicle  and 9 the person was less than 21 years of age at the time a test was requested f if a person less than 21 years of age submits to a breath or blood alcohol test requested pursuant to ksa 81001 or ksa 82142 and produces a test result of 002 or greater but less than 008 the persons driving privileges upon the first occurrence shall be suspended for 30 days and then restricted as provided by ksa 81015 for an additional 330 days and upon a second or subsequent occurrence shall be suspended for one year g except where there is a conflict between this section and ksa 81001 and 81002 the provisions of ksa 81001 and 81002 shall be applicable to proceedings under this section h any determination under this section that a person less than 21 years of age had a test result of 002 or greater but less than 008 and any resulting administrative action upon the persons driving privileges upon the first occurrence of such test result and administrative action shall not be considered by any insurance company in determining the rate charged for any automobile liability insurance policy or whether to cancel any such policy under the provisions of ksa 402774a traffic infraction in ksa 82118 all violations of this section that are not traffic infractions are traffic offenses  1106   4 9101996   4 8121997   8111998 state law reference similar provisions ksa authority to decrease speed limits in school zones ksa 81560a4 bus truck traffic a definitions the following words and phrases when used in this section shall have the meanings respectively ascribed to them in this subsection bus means every motor vehicle designed for carrying more than 12 passengers and used for the transportation of persons and every motor vehicle other than a taxicab designed and used for the transportation of persons for compensation truck means every motor vehicle designed and used primarily for the transportation of property and rated with a carrying capacity greater than threefourths ton trucktractor means every motor vehicle designed and used primarily for drawing other vehicles and not so constructed as to carry a load other than a part of the weight of the vehicle and load so drawn a prohibited streets it is unlawful for any person to drive or to cause to be driven any bus or truck over and along the following streets 1 broadway between metropolitan avenue and pennsylvania avenue  2 lecompton road from ohio street to the west city limits  3 muncie road from us 73 to shrine park road  4 south third street from spruce to elm street  5 tenth apply to any person driving or causing to be driven a bus or truck across street intersections  provided further that the provisions of this section shall not apply to any person driving or causing to be driven a bus or truck along a portion of a block on the streets where it becomes necessary to pick up from or deliver to property which is not accessible from any other street or alley or on a portion of the streets where it becomes necessary going to property which is not accessible from any other street or alley b penalty any person convicted of a violation of the provisions of this facie evidence of violation any operator of a vehicle permitting such vehicle to be parked or standing in violation of this article upon conviction shall be fined a sum of not less than $500 nor more than $2500 if any vehicle is found to be in violation of the provisions of this article and the identity of the operator cannot be determined the owner or person in whose name such vehicle is registered shall be held prima facie responsible for such violation    state law reference presumption of owner responsibility ksa 82114 parking restricted to 24hour period it is unlawful for any person to park or to permit the parking storing or standing of any vehicle as defined in the standard traffic ordinance incorporated by section 441 upon any street or alley or in any public park or public offstreet parking facility in the city for a continuous period of more than 24 hours without special permission of the police chief if any police officer of the city shall discover a vehicle parked standing or stored in violation of this section such police officer shall make a reasonable effort to discover the owner or person having charge of such vehicle and notify such owner or person to remove the vehicle if the owner or person in charge of such vehicle shall refuse to remove the vehicle after receiving such notice such owner or person shall be guilty of a misdemeanor if the owner or person in charge of such vehicle cannot be located or if such owner or person is located and refuses to remove such vehicle the vehicle shall be removed by the police department and towed to a suitable storage place in the city before such vehicle may be reclaimed or redeemed the owner thereof shall pay all costs incurred by the city in removing and storing such vehicle    no parking any of a greater capacity than threequarter ton that is used for business purposes may be parked on the streets in any residential area at any time longer than the time necessary to deliver load or unload   5222018 displaying advertising it is unlawful for any person to operate or park any vehicle on any street for the primary purpose of displaying advertising    selling from parked vehicle it is unlawful for any person to park or keep a vehicle longer than ten minutes in one block for the purpose of selling merchandise contained in such vehicle without a valid permit    removal of vehicles after posting notice the police shall have the power to remove or have removed any vehicle on any street in the city after posting or giving notice two hours in advance of such removal that the carriage or vehicle must be removed as ordered for removal of snow painting of traffic signs or cleaning of the streets which authority shall apply to any hour day or night    removal of parked vehicles during emergencies if by reason of fire flood windstorm snowstorm or other catastrophe any emergency arises which in the opinion of the fire chief police chief city engineer or other officer of the city requires the removal of any vehicles parked or standing in the streets alleys public parks public offstreet parking facilities or in any other public place in the city such vehicles may be removed and towed by the city officers or employees to some other safe place in the city the city official ordering such removal shall cause a record to be kept listing the description of any and all vehicles so removed and the places from which and to which such vehicles are removed before removing any such vehicle the official ordering the removal shall make a reasonable effort to locate the owner or person in charge of such vehicle having due regard for the nature of the emergency and to notify such owner or person to remove the vehicle if the owner or person in charge of such vehicle so notified shall refuse to remove the vehicle such owner or person shall be guilty of a misdemeanor    secs 4410044126  reserved division 2  municipal parking lots violation notices  towing of vehicles a when a police officer or other officer designated by the police chief finds a vehicle parked in violation of this division he shall attach a violation notice to the vehicle the notice shall be in the form of an envelope and shall state that within seven days after the date shown on the notice if the owner or operator of the vehicle places $2500 in the notice envelope and deposits the envelope in one of the fee deposit boxes at the police department or delivers the notice and $2500 to the police department the parking violation shall be fully satisfied without the imposition of any other penalty if the fine required in this section is not paid within seven days the violator upon conviction shall be fined an amount not to exceed $5000 b alternatively the police chief or designated officer may order the vehicle removed and towed by a towing service in the city the city official ordering such removal shall cause a record to be kept listing the description of any and all vehicles so removed and the place from which and to which such vehicles are removed before such vehicle may be reclaimed or redeemed the owner thereof shall pay all costs for the towing and storing of such vehicle  3559   110132   3 11141989   2231999 city manager to establish parking restrictions  posting of signs the city manager shall establish restricted parking spaces in the municipal parking lots in locations numbered for use by motor vehicles as defined by the standard traffic ordinance the municipal parking lots or portions thereof as defined in this division shall be posted with signs giving notice to the public of the restrictions and prohibitions as may be established from time to time by the city manager      11141989 parking time limited it is unlawful to park or permit the parking storing or standing of any vehicle for any continuous period on any municipally owned or municipally operated offstreet parking lot for a period of time longer than shown on the official signs erected on the parking facilities designating the maximum period for parking provided that it shall not be unlawful for vehicles to park beyond the maximum time in such facilities on sundays and holidays as set out in the ordinances of the city the term official signs means signs erected by city employees as directed by the city manager    prohibited truck parking it shall be unlawful for any person to park cause to be parked or permit to remain parked or stored any truck in any of the municipal parking lots located in the downtown central business district the term truck as used in this section shall have the meaning provided in the adopted standard traffic ordinance with a rated carrying capacity of more than threequarter ton or of any trucktractor with or without trailer or semitrailer      11141989 parking permits for special events a any organization sponsoring a class convention seminar or other group meeting within the downtown business area may make application to the police chief for a permit authorizing attendees to park a motor vehicle in the offstreet parking lots without being subject to the time restrictions therein the permit shall be displayed in the lower left corner of the windshield inside the vehicle and shall show on its face the date that the permit is effective failure to post the permit granted under this section shall render the user subject to the time restrictions in the parking area b permits for parking in the municipal parking lots shall be issued for onemonth periods effective the first of each month for a monthly fee as provided in the city fee schedule    commercial parking permits required upon application to the police department a permit may issue to contractors tradesmen craftsmen maintenance repair and servicemen having a need to park at or near where they are performing their services in any time limit parking area a permit may be issued to reserve parking or to have access to available parking in the normal conduct of their business but in no case shall such permit be used as a substitute for a loading zone or parking in a restricted permit parking space 80     11141989 secs 4413344162  reserved division 3  loading zone permit application by businesses persons operating business establishments within the designated downtown business district streets shall make application for permission to establish loading zones in the area directly in front of their places of business such applications may only be made by persons who do not have an alley or rear entrance loading zone space at their place of business all applications shall be approved by the chief of police and shall be valid for a period of one year from date of issuance and are subject to renewal annually fees for such permits are as provided in the city fee schedule fees are nonrefundable      11141989 review of denial by city manager all applications denied by the police chief may be appealed to the city manager by submitting a written request for appeal to the office of the city manager within 30 days from the date of denial      11141990 designation of zone  violation upon approval a loading zone sign shall be installed by the city it is unlawful for noncommercial vehicles to park in such loading zones any unauthorized vehicles parked in such loading zones will be ticketed for illegal parking      11141989 secs 4416644185  reserved article v  emergency snow routes declaration of traffic emergency  use of designated snow routes required a when snow has accumulated or there is a possibility that snow will accumulate to such a depth that snow removal operations will be required the city manager or in the absence of the city manager the police chief may declare a traffic emergency and until such traffic emergency is terminated it is unlawful to park a vehicle on any street designated an emergency snow route in this article or to operate a motor vehicle on any emergency snow route in such manner or condition that such motor vehicle stalls and is unable to proceed by reason of the fact that the driving wheels are not equipped with tire chains or snow tires b the police chief during a traffic emergency is empowered to waive or suspend enforcement of parking regulations not specifically designated within this article    notice after declaration of a traffic emergency the city manager shall cause appropriate notice thereof to be given local press radio and other media the traffic emergency shall be terminated by notice given substantially in the same manner as the traffic emergency was declared    removal of vehicles all vehicles parked on emergency snow routes must be removed within two hours after notice of a traffic emergency has been given any vehicle parked on an emergency snow route after such period of time may be removed or caused to be removed by a police officer to the nearest garage or other place of safety and the vehicle may not be recovered until the towing and storage charges are paid    establishment of routes  posting of signs a the following streets are established as emergency snow routes within the city 1 eastwest streets a cherokee street third street to 20th street b county road 5 15th street to michals road c eisenhower road fourth street to 20th street trafficway d kiowa street third street to fourth street e marshall street fifth avenue to broadway hospital f mcdonald road hughes road to shrine park road g metropolitan avenue from centennial bridge to 20th street h muncie road fourth street to 10th avenue i ohio and lecompton road tenth avenue to city limits j ottawa street third street to 20th street k pennsylvania fourth street to tenth avenue l shawnee street third street to 20th street m spruce street third street to 15th street n thornton street fourth street to tenth avenue o thornton street 17th street to 19th street p vilas street tenth avenue to 20th street trafficway q vilas street to be extended from 22nd street to 25th street 2 northsouth streets a second avenue congress street to limit street b third street kiowa street to spruce street c fourth street metropolitan avenue to eisenhower road d fifth avenue olive street to thornton street e fifth street metropolitan avenue to congress street f seventh street metropolitan avenue to spruce street g tenth avenue spruce street to eisenhower road h tenth street metropolitan avenue to spruce street i 13th street metropolitan avenue to cherokee street j 15th street vilas street to limit street k 17th street vilas street to of this section      12271990   11251997   11232004   11132007 secs 4419044216  reserved article vi  abandoned vehicles footnotes  3  state law reference abandoned and disabled vehicles ksa 81101 et seq definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning abandoned vehicle means any motor vehicle left or abandoned on a highway or other property open to use by the public for a period of time in excess of 48 hours highway means the entire width between the boundary lines of every way publicly maintained when any part thereof is open to the use of the public for the purposes of vehicular traffic motor vehicle means every vehicle or tractortrailer combination which is selfpropelled and by which any person or property is or may be transported or drawn upon a highway except vehicles used exclusively upon stationary rails or tracks    state law reference similar provisions ksa 81101 police chief designated as enforcing officer the police chief is designated as the enforcing officer charged with the administration of this article    removal by city when a person leaves a motor vehicle on a public street or other property open to use by the public the city may after 48 hours when the motor vehicle interferes with public highway operations immediately remove the vehicle    utilities footnotes  1  state law reference municipal utilities ksa 12801 et seq article i  in general tampering any person who shall tamper with any sewer or water line constituting a part of the citys sewer or water system or shall make any connection therewith without written permission from the city or who shall reconnect service after it has been disconnected for the nonpayment of a sewage charge without first paying the delinquency and the charges provided for in section 46115 shall be guilty of a misdemeanor    secs 4624620  reserved article ii  water division 1  generally secs 46214643  reserved division 2  water lines permitrequired for installation and construction no water lines or appurtenances shall be placed on any street or public grounds in the city unless a special permit therefor is obtained as provided in this division    permitapplication  issuance when any person having authority in the city to construct install or change the location of water lines such person shall apply to the city engineer for a permit to do so such application shall be accompanied with the schedule and plat showing the lines to be constructed or changes to be made and the facts required by this division the city engineer if such application is in conformity with the ordinances of the city and the ordinance granting such person the right to construct install or change location of lines shall issue a permit for the construction installation or change applied for and thereupon such individual company or corporation shall proceed to construct install or make the proposed changes    plats filed with city engineer every person having water lines upon the streets or public grounds of the city shall file in the office of the city engineer a schedule and plat showing the exact location of all existing water lines    secs 46474665  reserved article iii  sewers division 1  generally secs 46664689  reserved division 2  connections outside benefit district sewer district or development a the city manager may allow a property owner outside a benefit district sewer district or development to connect to the citys sanitary sewer system if the following conditions exist 1 the property has not been in a previous special benefit district  2 there exists a public sanitary sewer so located that the property can be connected to the public system  and 3 it is not practical to create a benefit district to serve the private property b the property owner shall make a payment to the city in the amount provided in the city fee schedule applied against the square footage of the lot or tract of land that the property owner wishes to have connected to the citys sewer system c if the area is not a platted lot then the city manager may designate a portion of not less than 10000 square feet upon which to apply the average square footage cost the area to be developed must be inclusive of an area having minimum frontage as required by city code on an open dedicated public street d multifamily industrial and commercial connections will be based upon the total lot size the city manager may reduce the lot size if there is sufficient indication that the square footage outside the building tract will be developed in the future the lot size assessed will then be determined by a minimum of 10000 square feet but being inclusive of all improvements to include outbuildings and parking facilities e a survey description at the cost of the property owner of the property to be excluded from future benefit district assessments as provided in subsection f of this section f there shall be a written agreement by and between the property owner and the city with the stipulation contained therein that the property shall not be included in any future sanitary sewer district of the city the agreement shall be properly notarized and filed on record in the office of the register of deeds in the county      282000 duty of property owners  connection by city a it is the duty of every person owning any dwelling house or any other building within the city when such dwelling house or building is or shall be located within 300 feet of a sewer or in any block within any sewer district in the city in which a sewer extends to make connections with such sewer for the purpose of disposing of all substances from any such building affecting the public health which may be lawfully and properly disposed of by means of such sewer b if any person or agent shall fail neglect or refuse to connect any such building with the sewer system as provided for in this section for more than ten days after being notified in writing to do so the city commission may advertise for bids for the construction and making of such sewer connections the contract shall be awarded to the lowest responsible bidder and shall cause such building or premises to be connected to the sewer system c all costs and expenses shall be assessed against the property connected such assessment is to be made in the same manner as other special assessments are made    unlawful connections it is unlawful to connect an open gutter cesspool privy vault or any drain of any kind whatsoever of the surface water from the roof or yard to a sanitary sewer or to connect any sanitary sewer or sanitary sewage to any drainage or stormwater sewer    secs 469346112  reserved division 3  sewer service charges levy a definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this division shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning bod denoting biochemical oxygen demand means the quantity of oxygen utilized in the biochemical oxidation of organic matter under standard laboratory procedure in five days at 20 degrees celsius expressed in milligrams per liter mgl capital charge means that portion of the total wastewater service charge which is levied for local capital costs local investment in plant facilities and other local costs excluding operation maintenance and replacement costs ccf means 100 cubic feet nonresidential customer means each customer whose premises are served by the citys wastewater treatment works and who is not either a residential customer or a customer who is provided wastewater service under a written contract with the city normal domestic wastewater means wastewater that has a bod of not more than 350 mgl and a suspended solids concentration of not more than 350 mgl operation and maintenance mean expenditures for materials labor utilities and other items which are necessary for operating managing and maintaining the wastewater treatment works to achieve the capacity and performance for which such works were designed and constructed replacement means expenditures for obtaining and installing equipment accessories or appurtenances which are necessary during the useful life of the treatment works to maintain the capacity and performance for which such works were designed and constructed the term operation and maintenance includes replacement residential customer means any customer served by the citys wastewater treatment works whose lot parcel of real estate or building is used only for domestic dwelling purposes ss suspended solids means solids that either float on the surface of or are in suspension in wastewater and which are removable by a standard specific laboratory filtration device treatment works means any devices and systems for the collection storage treatment recycling and reclamation of wastewater or necessary to recycle or reuse water at the most economical cost over the useful life of the works these include intercepting sewers outfall sewers wastewater collection systems pumping treatment and other facilities which are an integral part of the wastewater collection and treatment processes or are used for ultimate disposal of residues resulting from such treatment useful life means the estimated period during which a treatment works will be operated user charge means that portion of the total wastewater service charge which is levied in a proportional and equitable manner for the cost of operation maintenance and replacement of wastewater treatment works _____ b wastewater service charges the following monthly service charges shall be paid to the city by all residential and nonresidential customers receiving service from the citys wastewater treatment works 1 city service charge a inside city customers monthly wastewater service charges shall be calculated for all customers located within the citys corporate limits the service charges shall be based on each customers water consumption as defined in this subsection the service charges for these customers shall be as follows inside city monthly charges user charge portion $ccf capital charge portion $ccf total city service charge $ccf minimum monthly charge 641 465 1106 volume charge first 2 ccf included in minimum monthly charge next 13 ccf 225 151 376 next 285 ccf 178 088 266 all over 300 ccf 158  214 b outside city customers monthly wastewater service charges shall be calculated for all customers located outside the citys corporate limits the service charges shall be based on each customers water consumption as defined in this subsection the service charges for these customers shall be as follows outside city monthly charges user charge portion $ccf capital charge portion $ccf total city service charge $ccf minimum monthly charge 641 584 1225 volume charge first 2 ccf included in minimum monthly charge next 13 ccf 225 171 396 next 285 ccf 178 099 278 all over 300 ccf 158 064 222 user charge portion capital charge portion total city service charge minimum monthly chargenew accounts 7 units 1766 1222 2988 ccf  100 cubic feet 750 gallons c residential customers at the end of the threemonth period consisting of the consecutive months of january february and march of each year the average monthly consumption of water by each residential customer located within the corporate limits of the city during such threemonth period shall be ascertained and the monthly wastewater service charges paid by such residential customer for each of the following months of the 12month period commencing with july 1 shall be based upon the average monthly consumption of water by such residential customer during this threemonth period the minimum wastewater service charge for those residential customers for premises located within the corporate limits of the city who do not have a record of average monthly gross consumption of water as set forth in this section shall be $2988 per month which consists of a user charge of $1766 and a capital charge of $1222 d nonresidential customers at the end of the 12month period consisting of a fiscal year of july the average monthly consumption of water by each nonresidential customer during such 12month period shall be ascertained and the monthly service charges paid by such nonresidential customer for each of the following 12 months shall be based upon the average monthly consumption of water by such customer during such 12month period the minimum wastewater service charge for those nonresidential customers who do not have a record of average monthly gross consumption of water as set forth in this section shall be calculated monthly and shall be based on the consumption of water by such nonresidential customer for each month until the customer has established a 12month fiscal year as provided in this subsection at which time the charges shall be computed on the average monthly use for such 12month period as provided in this subsection nonresidential customers upon written request submitted to the city clerk by such customer may be billed for wastewater service charges based on actual water usage for each monthly billing period e unusual burden on treatment works the city shall establish fair and equitable charges for any industrial or other customer served by the city who discharges waste into the citys wastewater treatment works of such volume type or character that places an unusual burden on the citys treatment works f users receiving water from other sources for any customer who receives water from a source other than the citys water supply system and who discharges wastes into the citys wastewater treatment works the volume of such wastes discharged shall either be estimated by the city or at the discretion of the city the customer shall at his sole cost and expense install and maintain in good operating condition suitable meters or measuring devices of standard type and design at an appropriate point or points as necessary to properly measure the customers sewage discharge and shall permit the city to perform the reading of such metering device the sewer charges for such customers shall be established in accordance with such estimates or metering records 2 extra strength surcharge any customer discharging a liquid into the citys wastewater treatment works with a bod or suspended solids ss concentration greater than normal domestic wastewater shall pay an additional monthly charge based on the billable volume of water as follows extra strength surcharge for each mgl over 350 mgl $ccf $ccf $ccf inside city bod   s ss    outside city bod    ss    ccf   100 cubic feet 3 contract customers any agreement or contract entered into by the city with any customer relating to the provisions of wastewater service shall be in compliance with the user charge regulations as contained in 40 cfr 35 subpart e      2 1092018 _____ billing  objections  hearing  disconnection a the waterworks board is authorized to render bills monthly to all persons whose premises are connected or are required to be connected or may be connected to the sanitary sewer system of the city such bills shall be mailed or delivered by the waterworks board with the water bill of such persons at a time not later than ten days following the reading of the water meter of such persons and such bills shall be computed on a monthly basis b the waterworks board shall not assume responsibility for speedy and safe delivery or for the failure to receive the monthly bill but a duplicate thereof may be obtained from the office of the city waterworks board either in person or by telephone request c if the bill remains unpaid for a period of 30 days after such bill has been mailed or delivered water service may be discontinued and shut off at the discretion of the waterworks board and sewer service may be discontinued by the city provided that before any such water service or sewer service shall be discontinued for failure to pay the sewage disposal service charge the person so defaulting in the payment of his service charge shall be given ten days notice of the intention to shut off the water service or sewer service d if within a tenday period the person receiving such notice of intention to discontinue his water service or sewer service shall file with the city commission a written notice stating that the person believes that he has a just and reasonable complaint against the assessment of the sewage disposal service charge then the mayor shall within ten days from the receipt of the written notice call a meeting of the city commission and the city clerk shall notify the aggrieved party in writing at least three days before the date on which the meeting is to be held and the aggrieved party may appear at the meeting and present his grievance if at the meeting the city commission feels that the complaint of the aggrieved party is just the city commission may make such adjustment of the sewage disposal service charge as it deems equitable and just in the premises if the city commission at the meeting deems the complaint of the aggrieved party is without merit it may affirm the sewage disposal service charge of which the aggrieved party complains and the finding of the city commission shall be final and binding upon all parties concerned e any person who has not received a notice of the intent to disconnect their sewer service but believes that he has a just and reasonable complaint against the assessment of the sewage disposal service charge may file a written request with the city public works director for a review of the levy of the sewage disposal charge the city public works director or his designee shall make a written response within ten days of the receipt of the request within ten days of the receipt of the response any person who still believes they have a just and reasonable complaint may make a written request for a review by the city commission then the mayor shall within ten days from the receipt of the written notice call a meeting of the city commission and the city clerk shall notify the aggrieved party in writing at least three days before the date on which the meeting is to be held and the aggrieved party may appear at the meeting and present his grievance if at the meeting the city commission feels that the complaint of the aggrieved party is just the city commission may make such adjustment of the sewage disposal service charge as it deems equitable and just in the premises if the city commission at the meeting deems the complaint of the aggrieved party is without merit it may affirm the sewage disposal service charge of which the aggrieved party complains and the finding of the city commission shall be final and binding upon all parties concerned      10222002   1182005   11282006   1232007 disconnection reconnection charges if water service or sewer service shall be discontinued under authority of this division the water service or sewer service shall not be restored until the delinquent account plus a penalty of five percent and a cost charge covering the actual expense on an hourly basis of turning off the service and a cost charge covering the actual expense on an hourly basis of restoring the service has been paid by the person whose water service has been turned off such disconnection and reconnection charges for water service shall be retained by the waterworks board to defray its costs in the premises and the charges for disconnection from and reconnection to sewers shall be retained by the city      10222002   1182005   11282006   1232007 payment required  no discrimination no person shall be allowed the use of the sanitary sewers of the city without the payment of the sewage disposal service charge nor shall there be any discrimination among users of like classes as to rates      10222002   1182005   11282006   1232007 dumping vehicle loads into treatment facility all carts receptacles containers and implements used for removing the contents of any vault septic tank or cesspool shall not be dumped into the public sewage treatment facility of the city without prior written permission from the public works director or his designee      10222002   1182005   11282006   1232007 secs 4611846147  reserved division 4  industrial wastes abbreviations the following abbreviations when used in this division shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning bod means fiveday 20 degrees celsius biochemical oxygen demand mgl means milligrams per liter ss means suspended solids    review acceptance by city engineer review and acceptance by the city engineer with the advice and consent of the city commission shall be obtained prior to the discharge into the city sewers of any wastewater having a fiveday 20 degrees celsius bod greater than 300 mgl based on analysis of a 24hour composite sample or an ss greater than 400 mgl    prohibited wastes the following wastes shall not be discharged into the city sewers 1 any liquid or vapor having a temperature higher than 150 degrees fahrenheit except where the volume of discharge represents a significant portion of the flow particular sewer a lower limit may be prescribed to prevent odor nuisance 2 stormwater and surface drain water 3 wastes having a ph less than 55 or more than 100 or otherwise having chemical properties which are hazardous or are capable of causing damage to the sewage works or personnel 4 garbage or waste that has not been properly shredded 5 insoluble oils fats and greases socalled soluble oils may be permitted to the extent of 100 mgl provided that subsequent dilution in the sewers or treatment plant does not result in separation 6 gasoline naphtha benzene oil and other flammable or explosive liquids solids or gases 7 any waste which contains more than 100 mgl of fat oil and grease exclusive of soap 8 any corrosive noxious or malodorous material or substance which either singly or by reaction with other wastes is capable of causing damage to the sewage works or creating a public nuisance or hazard or preventing entry into the sewers for maintenance and repair 9 any material or substance not specifically mentioned in this section which is in itself corrosive irritating to human beings and animals toxic or noxious or which by interaction with other wastes could produce undesirable effects including deleterious action on the sewage works adversely affect any treatment process constitute a hazard to human beings or animals or have an adverse effect upon the receiving stream    investigations it shall be the duty of the city engineer to cause investigation to be made of all properties reasonably believed to be depositing sewage in violation of the provisions of this division    right of entry information the city engineer shall have the right to enter at any reasonable time any property served by a connection to the city sewer system for the purpose of inspecting the system on demand the owner or occupants of any property so served shall furnish to the city engineer such information as the engineer may require regarding the sewage system on such property the refusal of the owner or occupant of such property to supply such information or to allow the survey or investigation shall be prima facie evidence of the presence of improper usage and which is subject to this division    termination of service for violations the city engineer may upon reasonable belief that any person is depositing sewage in violation of the provisions of this division recommend to the city commission the suspension or revocation of the right of any person to discharge sewage into the sanitary sewers or the sewage disposal plant of the city until proof satisfactory to the city commission shall be supplied establishing that effective means have been taken to prevent the discharge of sewage in violation of this division service shall not be restored until such corrections have been completed in compliance with the requirements of the city engineer    disconnections of service  notice when the danger to the city sewage system appears imminent no notice shall be required prior to the disconnection of service in all other cases service shall be disconnected following five days notice in writing    secs 4615546254  reserved article iv  underground conduits requirement every person having any poles erected on or any wires or cables strung in along over or across any streets and alleys in the city used for telephone telegraph or electric light or power purposes may be ordered and directed to begin within 90 days from the date of the order to place all or any portion of their wires and cables underground in subsurface conduits and to have all such wires poles and cables removed from all such streets and alleys within nine months from the date of the order    designation by resolution the city commission by resolution or the city engineer may designate the portions of the streets alleys or highways in which pipes or conduits shall be laid as provided in this article    approval supervision of city engineer the system and the kind of pipe to be used for underground conduit shall before any work is done be approved by the city engineer the pipe or conduits shall be laid in the streets or in the alleys as the city engineer may deem advisable all work done or performed under this article shall be done under the supervision of the city engineer    placement of manholes and appliances permitted any person placing telegraph telephone electric light and power wires and cables underground in subsurface conduits shall have the right to place such necessary manholes and appliances for affording access to such conduits wires and cables for making connections therefrom to subscribers and stations such conduits manholes and appliances shall be constructed and the wires and cables placed therein in such manner as not to injure or destroy any vault sewer water or gas pipe    conformance to new grades of streets when the city shall grade or regrade any street alley or highway along or across which any person has laid any pipe or conduit the person owning or using such pipe or conduit shall at such persons own expense change such pipe or conduit to conform to the street alley or highway so graded or regraded on an order therefor from the city engineer    owner to hold city harmless every person placing telegraph telephone electric light or power wires or cables electric wires or cables underground in subsurface conduits shall save and hold the city harmless from all damages for personal or other injuries either to private individuals or corporations or to property for which the city may in any way become liable resulting from or growing out of any negligence or want of care on the part of any such persons in the construction of any pipe conduit or other appliance or any defective construction unsound material or want of repair of any conduits wires cables manholes or other appliances used maintained or constructed by such person under this article or any other ordinance or franchise granted to any such person    appendix a  development regulations article 1  general provisions overview a title these regulations shall be known as the development regulations of the city of leavenworth kansas or developmental regulations these regulations are adopted pursuant to ksa 12747 et seq and 12757 et seq b purpose these regulations serve the following purposes 1 to promote the health safety comfort and economic development of the city  2 to preserve and protect property values throughout the city  3 to regulate the height number of stories and size of buildings  the percentage of lot coverage  the size of yards courts and other open spaces  and density of population  4 to divide the jurisdictional area into zones and districts  5 to regulate the location and use of buildings and land within each district or zone c jurisdiction these regulations apply to all land and structures within the incorporated area of the city fort leavenworth the us penitentiary and the veterans administration reservations are excluded from the jurisdiction of these regulations d exemptions the following structures and uses shall be exempt from the provisions of these regulations 1 utilities poles wires cables conduits vaults laterals pipes street lighting mains valves or other similar equipment or improvements for the distribution to consumers of telephone or other communications electricity gas or water or the collection of sewage or surface water operated or maintained by a public utility  and 2 railroads railroad track signals bridges and similar facilities and equipment located on a railroad rightofway and maintenance and repair work on such facilities and equipment e annexation 1 all territory annexed into the city voluntarily or involuntarily shall be zoned after annexation in accordance with the zoning district most closely matching the comprehensive land use plan for that area determined by table 101 below 2 the landowner may propose a different zoning classification application for rezoning as provided elsewhere in this rezoning must be completed at or before the time the annexation petition is presented to the city commission for consideration table 101 zoning district & direct future land use map associations zoning district future land use map designation r125 low density singlefamily residential district low density residential r19 medium density singlefamily residential district low or medium density residential r175 medium singlefamily residential district high density residential r16 high density singlefamily residential district high density residential r416 medium density multiplefamily residential district high density residential rmf multiplefamily residential district multifamily rmx residential mixed use urban residential mp mobilemanufactured home park district multi family nbd neighborhood business district commercial obd office business district commercial cbd central business district commercial gbd general business district commercial i1 light industrial district industrial i2 heavy industrial district industrial pud planned unit development district not applicable fp flood plain district not applicable f severability it is intended that each and every provision of these regulations to the extent they may reasonably be interpreted and applied independently from any other provision shall stand alone as an independent and separate regulation of the city if any section subsection clause phrase or portion of these regulations is held to be invalid or unconstitutional by a court of competent jurisdiction then that decision shall not affect the validity of the remaining or any other portions of these regulations  6142016 administration a authorities the following authorities are responsible for the administration of specified aspects of these regulations 1 planning commission it is the duty of the planning commission pc to publicly hear testimony concerning proposed changes in zoning districts amendments to this appendix proposed annexations proposed special use permits and review disputed site plans and then to make appropriate recommendations to the city commission the planning commission shall operate according to a set of bylaws approved by the city commission 2 board of zoning appeals it is the duty of the board of zoning appeals bza to conduct public hearings and to take final action on appeals from interpretation and enforcement actions of administrative officials  to conduct public hearings and act on requests for variances from this appendix  to conduct public hearings and act on requests for exceptions to the provisions of this appendix in those instances where the board is specifically authorized to grant such exceptions and only under the terms of this article appeal of decisions by the board is made to district court the board of zoning appeals shall operate according to a set of bylaws approved by the city commission 3 development review committee it is the duty of the development review committee drc to plan coordinate review and facilitate all new development and substantial redevelopment within the city  including all development applications and requests for variances and exceptions a development issues will entail the adequate provision of power potable water sewage service communications road access and capacity solid waste disposal life safety aspects comprehensive plan compatibility requests for minor modifications zoning appropriateness storm drainage visual aesthetics and all other issues which may be necessary to provide for the health safety and welfare of the citizens of leavenworth b the development review committee drc shall be comprised of the following persons or their designated representatives or other similar city representatives designated by the city manager 1 chief building inspector  2 city clerk  3 city manager  4 assistant city manager  5 city planner  6 economic development director  7 fire chief  8 parks and recreation director  9 planning and community development director  10 police chief  11 public works director c meetings the development review committee drc shall meet weekly in the city commission chambers as needed the city planner or designee shall prepare the weekly agenda and shall provide the necessary staff to record meeting minutes and maintain a record of documents submitted for each agenda item d chair the city planner shall be the administrative coordinator of the development review committee drc and shall preside as the chair 4 city commission upon receipt of recommendations from the planning commission the city commission shall act as the final local authority on all requests for district boundary changes amendments to the text of this article annexation requests approval of disputed site plans and special use permits the city commission may grant extensions of time for submission or completion of projects as it deems expedient appeals from decisions of the city commission are made to district court the city commission shall hear all appeals from staff decisions referred to it under these development regulations 5 administrative staff the director is responsible for the enforcement of this article implementation and administration of the provisions of the development regulations shall be the responsibility of the administrative officials listed throughout these development regulations administrative staff duties will include but are not limited to the following a scheduling and conducting inspections of buildings structures and uses of land to determine compliance with the provisions of the development regulations b maintaining permanent and current records of the development regulations including but not limited to all zoning district maps amendments special uses variances exceptions appeals and applications therefor and records of hearings thereon c preparing and having available in book pamphlet or map form on or before march 31 of each year 1 the compiled text of the zoning regulations and amendments thereto including all amendments adopted preceding december 31 and 2 a zoning district map or maps showing the zoning districts divisions and classifications in effect on the preceding december 31 d maintaining for distribution to the public paper and electronic copies of the zoning district map the text of the development regulations and the bylaws agendas and meeting minutes of the planning commission and the board of zoning appeals e providing such clerical technical and consultative assistance as may be required by the city commission planning commission board of zoning appeals preservation commission and other boards or commissions in the exercise of their duties relating to these development regulations f preparing and distributing hearing notices as required g providing information clerical technical and consultative assistance to developers and property owners with regard to the application process and requirements of this appendix generally 6 leavenworth preservation commission the leavenworth preservation commission authority and procedures are established in article 9 b schedule of fees the schedule of fees and charges for any applicable fees shall be on file with the city clerk according to all city ordinances  6142016 interpretation a rules of construction in interpreting these regulations the following rules shall apply 1 words used in the present tense shall include the future 2 words in the singular number include the plural number and words in the plural number include the single number 3 the phrase used for shall include the phrases arranged for designed for intended for maintained for and occupied for 4 the word shall is mandatory 5 the word may is permissive 6 the word person includes individuals firms corporations associations governmental bodies and agencies and all other legal entities 7 any word or phrase which is defined in in these regulations shall have the meaning as so defined unless such definition is expressly limited in its meaning or application b computations of time unless specifically stated in individual sections wherever these regulations state a time period it shall be interpreted as follows 1 the day of the act event or other means which commences the time period shall not be counted 2 the last day of the time period shall be included in the time period unless it is a saturday sunday or legal city holiday in which case the next working day shall end the time period 3 whenever the time period is expressed to require a formal submittal to the city the time period shall end at  pm on the last day of the time period 4 any time period expressed in years shall include a full calendar year from the act event or other means which commences the time period c minimum requirements the provisions of these regulations shall be held to be the minimum requirements for the promotion of the public health and welfare d conflicts where the conditions imposed by any provision of these regulations are either more restrictive or less restrictive than any other law ordinance resolution rule or regulations of any kind the more restrictive shall control in making a determination of which regulation is more restrictive the director shall determine which regulation establishes a higher standard for the promotion of the public health safety and general welfare shall control and more closely follows the policies of the comprehensive plan e private agreements these regulations are not intended to abrogate annul or otherwise interfere with any easement covenant or any other private agreement of legal relationship  provided however that where the provisions of these regulations are more restrictive or impose higher standards or requirements than such easements covenants or other private agreements or legal relationships the provisions of these regulations shall govern f existing uses any existing structure use or occupation of land previously approved as of the effective date of the ordinance from which this appendix derives shall be permitted to continue as a lawful use or occupation the approved site plan and all terms covenants and conditions applicable as of the effective date of the ordinance from which this appendix derives shall continue to apply and control the use or occupation of such land however any proposed change or modification in the use or occupation of such land or in the approved site plan for such land shall be made in accordance with the standards and procedures of this article g interpretation of district boundaries where uncertainty exists with respect to the boundaries of any district on the zoning district map the following rules shall apply 1 boundaries indicated as approximately following platted lot lines shall be construed as following such lot
