11282017   1 3122019 appendix b  charter ordinances no 1  salaries of mayor and commissioners charter a charter ordinance exempting the city of leavenworth kansas from ksa 131803 and providing substitute and additional provisions on the same subject relating to the salaries of the mayor and commissioners editors note charter was superseded by charter no 2  salaries of mayor and commissioners charter a charter ordinance exempting the city of leavenworth kansas from ksa 131803 and providing substitute and additional provisions on the same subject relating to the salaries of the mayor and commissioners of said city now therefore be it ordained by the governing body of the city of leavenworth kansas that the city of leavenworth kansas under the authority of of the constitution of the state of kansas hereby elects to exempt itself from and to make inapplicable to it ksa 131803 which applies to said city but the provisions of which do not apply uniformly to all cities and to provide substitute and additional provisions on the same subject that the mayor and commissioners of the city of leavenworth kansas shall receive a salary which shall be fixed by ordinance that the mayor and commissioners of the city of leavenworth kansas may by ordinance increase decrease and fix their respective salaries but that such action shall under no condition affect their qualifications for appointment or election as a commissioner or mayor of said city of leavenworth that this is a charter ordinance and shall take effect 61 days after its final publication unless a sufficient petition for a referendum is filed as provided in subdivision c3 of the constitution of the state of kansas in which case the ordinance shall become effective if approved by a majority of the electors voting thereon passed by the governing body no less than twothirds of the memberselect voting in favor thereof this 29th day of march 1966 sthomas d beal mayor attest smarguerite b strange city clerk passed and approved  seal editors note ksa 131803 has since been repealed no 3  limitation on tax levies charter a charter ordinance exempting the city of leavenworth kansas from ksa 791951 and providing substitute and additional provisions on the same subject providing for a limitation of tax levy in any one year on each dollar of assessed tangible valuation and aggregate of all citywide tax levies with some exceptions and providing for the levy of a consolidated tax and apportionment to a consolidated fund to be known as the general operating fund for the support of several functions and purposes of the city as set out in said ordinance editors note charter was superseded by charter no 4  civil service commission charter a charter ordinance exempting the city of leavenworth kansas from ksa 132285 sa 1322104 both inclusive providing substitute and additional provisions on the same subject providing for the creating of a civil service commission providing for the appointment of a chairman and four commissioners and providing for their term of office whereas by the governing body of the city of leavenworth kansas submitted to the electors of the city the proposition of establishing a civil service commission as defined and provided for in ksa 132285 sa 1322104 both inclusive which law provides for the establishment and operation of a civil service commission for the police department and whereas the said election was held on tuesday  and the qualified electors voted in favor of said proposition by a substantial majority and whereas the proposition read as follows shall the following be adopted shall the city of leavenworth kansas establish a civil service commission as defined and provided for in ksa 132285 sa 1322104 both inclusive and whereas it was the intent of the voters to establish a civil service commission for the city of leavenworth kansas be it ordained by the governing body of the city of leavenworth kansas that the city of leavenworth kansas under the authority of of the constitution of the state of kansas hereby elects to exempt itself from and to make inapplicable to it ksa 132285 sa 1322104 which applies to said city but the provisions of which do not apply uniformly to all cities and to provide substitute and additional provisions on the same subject it is deemed necessary and for the best interest of the city that a civil service commission for the city of leavenworth kansas be and the same is hereby established that the said commission shall consist of a chairman and four commissioners and shall be appointed by the mayor and approved by the governing body of the said city and whose duties and responsibilities shall be those hereinafter enacted by ordinance that the chairman shall serve until   that one of the commissioners so designated shall serve until   that one of the commissioners so designated shall serve until   that one of the commissioners so designated shall serve until   and one of the commissioners so designated shall serve until   and thereafter that at the expiration of the said setout term that they shall be appointed each to serve for a term of five years this charter ordinance shall be published once each week for two consecutive weeks in the leavenworth times the official newspaper for the city of leavenworth kansas that this is a charter ordinance and is to take effect 61 days after its final publication unless a sufficient petition for a referendum is filed as provided in subdivision c3 of the constitution of the state of kansas in which case the ordinance shall become effective if approved by a majority of the electors voting thereon passed by the governing body no less than twothirds of the membershipelect voting in favor thereof this 19th day of september 1967 sfrank w wilson mayor attest smarguerite b strange city clerk passed and approved  seal editors note ksa 1322851322104 have since been repealed no 5  limitation on tax levies charter a charter ordinance amending charter providing substitute and additional provisions on the same subject providing for a limitation of tax levy in any one year on each dollar of assessed tangible valuation and aggregate of all citywide tax levies with some exceptions and providing for the levy of a consolidated tax and apportionment to a consolidated fund to be known as the general operating fund for the support of several functions and purposes of the city as set out in said ordinance editors note charter was repealed by charter no 6  commissioners holding other government offices charter a charter ordinance relating to the holding of government offices by city commissioners in leavenworth kansas and exempting the city from the provisions of ksa 131802 and providing substitute and additional provisions on the same subject be it ordained by the governing body of the city of leavenworth kansas that pursuant to the provisions of c of of the constitution of the state of kansas the city of leavenworth kansas hereby elects that ksa 131802 shall not apply to said city and provides the following substitute and additional provisions on the same subject  no member of the city commission shall hold governmental office of profit under the laws of any state or united states while he is a member of the commission or until after the expiration of at least one year after he has ceased to be a member of said commission that this ordinance shall be published once each week for two consecutive weeks in the official city newspaper this is a charter ordinance and shall take effect 61 days after final publication unless a sufficient petition for a referendum is filed and a referendum held on the ordinance as provided in subdivision c3 of the constitution of kansas in which case the ordinance shall become effective if approved by the majority of the electors voting thereon passed by the governing body of not less than twothirds of the memberselect voting in favor thereof this 21st day of october 1969 sray h miller mayor attest smarguerite b strange city clerk passed and approved  seal editors note charter was repealed by charter no 7  commission meetings charter a charter ordinance exempting the city of leavenworth kansas from ksa 121009 and providing a substitute provision on the same subject providing for regular commissioners meeting to be held at least twice each month instead of once each week and repealing section 1801 of the the city of leavenworth kansas1965 be it ordained by the governing body of the city of leavenworth kansas the city of leavenworth kansas a city of the first class by the power invested in it by of the constitution of the state of kansas hereby elects to and exempts itself from and makes inapplicable to it ksa 121009 and to provide substitute provisions as hereinafter provided that the board of commissioners of the city of leavenworth kansas shall meet regularly at least twice each month in the commissioners room in the city hall of leavenworth kansas special meetings of the board of commissioners of the city of leavenworth kansas may be called as provided by law that section 1801 of the the city of leavenworth kansas 1965 and all other ordinances or parts of ordinances in conflict herewith are hereby repealed this ordinance shall be published once each week for two consecutive weeks in the official city paper this is a charter ordinance and shall take effect 61 days after final publication unless a sufficient petition for a referendum is filed and a referendum held on the ordinance as provided in subdivision c3 of the constitution of kansas in which case the ordinance shall become effective if approved by a majority of the electors voting thereon passed by the governing body not less than twothirds of the commissioners voting in favor thereof the 21st day of october 1969 sray h miller mayor attest smarguerite b strange city clerk passed and approved  seal no 8  licensing and regulation of clubs charter a charter ordinance relating to licensing and regulation of clubs hours of operation for clubs exempting the city of leavenworth kansas from ksa 412614 and providing a substitute provision on the same subject editors note charter has been repealed by charter no 9  waterworks department charter a charter ordinance relating to the waterworks department meetings  rules  records  quorums  and qualifications and treasurer of board duty and bond exempting the city of leavenworth kansas from ksa 132417 and 132424 and providing substitute provisions on the same subject be it ordained by the governing body of the city of leavenworth kansas pursuant to the provisions of c of of the constitution of the state of kansas the city of leavenworth kansas hereby elects to and hereby exempts itself from and makes inapplicable to it ksa 132417 and 132424 and provides the following substituted provisions on the same subject a meetings  rules  records  quorums  and qualifications the board shall hold meetings regularly at least twice each month and shall designate the time and place thereof it shall adopt its own rules of procedure and keep a record of its proceedings all meetings records and accounts of the board shall be public and a copy of monthly financial statements shall be furnished to the city clerk of the city of leavenworth three members shall constitute a quorum for transaction of business members of the waterworks board shall be residents of the city of leavenworth  shall not be less than 30 years of age  citizens of the united states and one year immediately preceding their election residents of the city of leavenworth b treasurer of board  duty the treasurer of the city in which said waterworks plant is located shall be ex officio treasurer of the waterworks board all funds and property in his hands belonging to the waterworks department shall be subject to the control of the waterworks board and it shall be the duty of the waterworks board employees to submit a copy of the daily deposit slip used to deposit the daily receipts in the bank designated by the waterworks board it shall also be the duty of the treasurer to pay out the same when ordered by the waterworks board upon warrants signed by the chair man or vicechairman of the board and countersigned by the manager of collections and accounts certifying that such warrant is issued by authority of the waterworks board that this ordinance shall be published once each week for two consecutive weeks in the official city newspaper this is a charter ordinance and shall take effect 61 days after final publication unless a sufficient petition for a referendum is filed and a referendum held on the ordinance as provided in subdivision c3 of the constitution of kansas in which case the ordinance shall become effective if approved by the majority of the electors voting thereon passed by the governing body of not less than twothirds of the memberselect voting in favor thereof this 14th day of july 1970 sr m atchison mayor attest smarguerite b strange city clerk passed and approved  seal no 10  limitation charter no 25  fire and police department retirement systems charter a charter ordinance relating to employees retirement system  fire and police department exempting the city of leavenworth kansas from provisions of ksa 1314a05 1314a06 and 1314a08  amending charter providing substitute provisions on the same subject editors note charter was repealed by charter no 26  additional sales tax charter an ordinance pledging the general purposes for the future use of the revenues to be received from the additional onehalf of one percent sales tax if same is approved by the voters whereas the governing body of the city of leavenworth kansas has adopted an ordinance providing for an additional onehalf of one percent citywide retailers tax and directing submission of question to electors of the city at a special election to be held on the 4th day of december 1984  and whereas the governing body has also adopted an ordinance providing for the submission to the electors of the city of leavenworth kansas the question of issuing general obligation bonds not to exceed $250000000 to acquire a site construct remodel andor equip a library facility  and whereas the governing body has also adopted an ordinance providing for the submission of the question to the electors of issuing general obligation bonds not to exceed $350000000 to alter repair remodel and make additions to the railroad depot structure and adjoining property located on the east side of north esplanade between cherokee and seneca streets to provide for a community center  and whereas it is the desire of the governing body to use all or a portion of the revenue to be received from such tax if the same is approved by the voters for the payment of the general obligation bonds for the community center payment for the general obligation bonds for the library payment of the costs of operating the community center and the balance as available to be used for citywide capital improvements  now therefore be it ordained by the governing body of the city of leavenworth kansas that the general purposes for the future use of all or a portion of the revenues to be received from the onehalf of one percent additional sales tax if approved by the voters shall be for the retirement of the general obligation bonds for the community center payment for the costs of operating same retirement of the general obligation bonds for the library and the balance as available to be used for citywide capital improvements that this ordinance shall be passed in accordance with the requirements of ksa 12137 requiring twothirds vote of the members elect of the governing body and shall be published once each week for two consecutive weeks in the official city newspaper that this ordinance shall take effect 60 days after its final publication and if within 60 days of its final publication a petition signed by a number of electors of the city equal to not less than ten percent of the number of electors who voted at the last preceding regular city election shall be filed with the county election officer demanding that such ordinance be submitted to a vote of the electors it shall not take effect until submitted to a referendum and approved by a majority of the electors voting thereon that this ordinance shall be effective on passage and publication as provided by law slee farnsworth mayor the governing body of the city of leavenworth kansas by charter ordinance exempted said city from ksa 791951 and provided substitute and additional provisions on the same subject providing for a limitation of tax levy in any one year on each dollar of assessed tangible valuation and aggregate of all citywide tax levies with some exceptions and providing for the levy of a consolidated tax and apportionment to a consolidated fund to be known as the general operating fund for support of several functions and purposes of the city as set out in said ordinance and setting limitations of levy at 26 mills  and whereas the governing body of the city of leavenworth kansas desires to increase the library levy and repeal the provisions previously adopted now therefore be it ordained by the governing body of the city of leavenworth kansas the city of leavenworth kansas operating under a managercommissioner plan of government and being a city of the first class with a population of less than 50000 by the power vested in it by of the constitution of the state of kansas hereby elects to and exempts itself from and makes inapplicable to it ksa 791951  that the said statute is not of statewide concern applicable uniformly to all cities applying only to any city of the first class having a population of less than 50000 and to provide substitute and additional provisions as hereinafter provided the governing body of the city of leavenworth kansas is hereby authorized and empowered to levy taxes in each year for the general fund and other city purposes but said governing body shall not fix a rate of levy in any one year on each dollar of assessed tangible valuation of any such city for any of the followingnamed purposes in excess of the followingnamed rates judgments supp 68582  100 mill memorial buildings as provided by ksa 73407  050 mill noxious weeds as provided by ksa 21318  100 mill deficiency levy for chemicals and materials  050 mill that charter any other ordinance in conflict herewith shall be and the same is hereby repealed this is a charter ordinance and shall take effect 61 days after final publication unless a sufficient petition for a referendum and approved  published june 12 and  no 30  transient guest tax charter a charter ordinance relating to transient guest tax levy exempting the city of leavenworth kansas from the provisions of ksa 121697 and providing substitute provisions on the same subject be it ordained by the governing body of the city of leavenworth kansas that pursuant to the provisions of c of of the constitution of the state of kansas the city of leavenworth kansas hereby elects to and hereby exempts itself from and makes inapplicable to it ksa 121697 and provides the following substitute provisions on the same subject 1 a in order to provide revenues to promote tourism and conventions the governing body of the city is hereby authorized to levy a transient guest tax at not to exceed the rate of four percent upon the gross receipts derived from or paid by transient gas guests for sleeping accommodations exclusive of charges for incidentals or facilities and at any hotel motel or tourist court the percentage of such tax shall be determined by the governing body of the city and shall be specified in the resolution authorizing the same b any transient guest tax levied pursuant to this section shall be based on the gross rental receipts collected by any business c the taxes levied pursuant to this section shall be paid by the consumer or user to the business and it shall be the duty of each and every business to collect from the consumer or user the full amount of any such tax or an amount equal as nearly as possible or practicable to the average equivalent thereto each business collecting any of the taxes levied hereunder shall be responsible for paying over the same to the state department of revenue in the manner described as in ksa 121698 and the state department of revenue shall administer and enforce the collection of such tax d the transient guest tax authorized by this section shall not be levied until the governing body of the city has passed a resolution authorizing the same that this charter ordinance shall be published once each week for two consecutive weeks in the leavenworth times the official newspaper of the city of leavenworth kansas that this is a charter ordinance and shall take effect 61 days after its final publication unless a sufficient petition for a referendum is filed as provided in subdivision c3 of the constitution of the state of kansas in which case the ordinance shall become effective if approved by a majority of the electors voting thereon passed by the governing body not less than twothirds of the memberselect voting in favor thereof this 9th day of june 1987 sthomas f bragg mayor attest scarol sadler city clerk passed and approved  published  and  editors note charter was superseded by charter no 31  limitation on tax levies pursuant to ksa 795003 charter a charter ordinance exempting the city of leavenworth kansas from the provisions of ksa 795003 and providing substitute and additional provisions on the same subject providing for a limitation of tax levy for the general fund in any one year of 33 mills now therefore be it ordained by the governing body of the city of leavenworth kansas the city of leavenworth kansas being a city of the first class by the power invested in it by of the constitution of the state of kansas hereby elects to and exempts itself from and makes inapplicable to it the provisions of ksa 795003 and to provide substitute and additional provisions as hereinafter provided the governing body of the city of leavenworth kansas is hereby authorized and empowered to certify to the county clerk of leavenworth county tax levies upon tangible property excluding taxes levied as special assessments and excluding levies specified in ksa 795011 and amendments thereto which in the aggregate shall not exceed 33 mills all tax levies now or hereafter authorized by law to be made under ksa art 50 except levies specifically excluded under provisions of ksa 795011 shall be subject to the aggregate limitations prescribed hereunder unless the provisions of the law authorizing the levy specifically states that such levy is exempt from the limitation imposed under the provisions of ksa 795001795016 inclusive this ordinance shall be published once each week for two consecutive weeks in the official city newspaper this is a charter ordinance and shall take effect 61 days after final publication unless a sufficient petition for a referendum is filed and a referendum held on the ordinance as provided in c3 of the constitution of kansas in which case the ordinance 1987 sthomas f bragg mayor attest scarol sadler city clerk passed and approved  published  and  no 32  fire and police department retirement systems charter a charter ordinance relating to employees retirement system  fire and police department exempting the city of leavenworth kansas from provisions of ksa 1314a05 1314a06 and 1314a08  amending charter providing substitute provisions on the same subject editors note charter was repealed by charter no 33  fire and police department retirement systems charter a charter ordinance relating to employees retirement system  fire and police department  exempting the city of leavenworth kansas from provisions of ksa 1314a05 1314a06 and 1314a08  amending charter   and providing substitute provisions on the same subject be it ordained by the governing body of the city of leavenworth kansas that pursuant to the provisions of c of of the constitution of the state of kansas the city of leavenworth kansas hereby elects to and hereby exempts itself from and makes inapplicable to it ksa 1314a05 1314a06 and 1314a08 and provides the following substitute provisions on the same subject 1 definitions a effective date of retirement or discharge for the purposes of pay computation under the terms of this ordinance the effective date of retirement or discharge shall be the last day of the month in which same occurs b monthly salary the term monthly salary as used in this ordinance shall mean the greater of the following two methods of computation 1 the monthly salary at the date of retirement including base pay longevity pay holiday pay and educational incentive 2 the average of the last 12 months of employment which will include base pay longevity pay holiday pay educational pay and overtime pay 2 payments upon retirement or discharge from police or fire department any officer or member of any such police department or fire department having served 22 years or more in such department and having reached the age of 50 years may make application to be retired and if such application is made and respective board of trustees shall retire such officer or member and shall pay him monthly payments in an amount equal to 50 percent of his monthly salary or if he be discharged from such department by reason of disability or if he be discharged for any reason except conviction of a felony after having served 22 years or more in such department the respective board of trustees shall order and direct that said person upon attaining the age of 50 years be paid monthly payments in an amount equal to 50 percent of the monthly salary provided that any officer or member of such police department or fire department having served eight years or more on such department and having reached the age of 60 years may make application to be retired and if such application is made the respective board of trustees shall retire such officer or member he shall be entitled to receive a retirement benefit equal to two percent of his final annual salary multiplied by the number of years of credited service provided that in addition to the above the following amount shall be paid monthly if retired prior to  the sum of $27400 per month  if retired between  and  the sum of $22400 per month  if retired between  and  the sum of $14900 per month  if retired between  and  the sum of $10900 per month  and if retired between  and  the sum of $5900 per month provided further that future cost of living adjustments to the fire and police department retirees covered by provisions of ksa 1314a02 et seq may be granted by adoption of the annual budget without further amendment of this charter ordinance provided that in no event shall retirement benefits paid hereunder be less than $52400 per month provided further that if any officer or member who shall have been allowed any benefits under this section shall thereafter be employed for compensation the monthly payments out of the pension funds shall be reduced until he reaches the age of 60 years to such an amount if when added to the other compensation he receives shall not exceed the compensation he was receiving at the time he was retired or discharged provided further that no person who retires after the effective date of this act shall be paid any benefits under the provisions of this section while he is employed in or the holder of any public office for which he receives compensation from public funds provided further that in determining the number of years of credited service a fractional year of six months or more shall be considered as one year and a fractional year of less than six months shall be disregarded 3 designation of funds investment the amount of money derived from taxes herein levied and all money received from assessments dues or donations for the benefit of such funds to be known and designated respectively as the policemens pension fund and the firemens pension fund which funds shall be devoted exclusively to and for the purposes hereinafter enumerated all monies derived from the taxes so levied and money received from the other sources as above enumerated shall be paid into the policemens pension fund or firemens pension fund all monies accumulated under the provisions of this act shall be deposited by the treasurer in the same manner as other city funds  provided however the board of trustees may at their option invest any of said reserve funds in direct obligation bonds of the united states of america maturing or redeemable at part and accrued interest within three years from the date of purchase or in bonds of any municipality in the state of kansas the total bonded indebtedness of which is less than 15 percent of the total assessed tangible valuation of such municipality which bonds shall mature within five years from the date of purchase 4 membership fee and contributions by officers and members of department  refunds  limitations every new officer and member of said police and fire departments shall be required to pay to the treasurer of said board a membership fee of $500 and there shall be deducted from the salary of every officer and member of each department seven percent of his monthly salary which shall be paid into the respective pension funds any officer or member whose services for any reason whatsoever shall be terminated with the department shall be entitled upon demand to be paid within 30 days after such demand the total amount of the deduction from his salary paid into said funds  provided that in the event such officer or member shall renew his services with said department he shall as a condition of employment return to said fund the amount withdrawn that any provisions of any ordinances in conflict herewith and charter be and the same are hereby repealed that this ordinance shall be published once each week for two consecutive weeks in the official city newspaper that this is a charter ordinance and shall take effect 61 days after final publication unless a petition for referendum is filed and a referendum held on this ordinance as provided by c under the constitution of the state of kansas in which case the ordinance shall become effective if it be approved by a majority of the electors voting thereon that the provisions of this ordinance shall take effect the 1st day of january 1989 passed by the governing body not less than twothirds of the memberselect voting in favor thereof this 14th day of february 1989 smerrill f steele mayor attest scarol sadler city clerk passed and approved  published  and  no 34  waterworks department charter a charter ordinance relating to the waterworks department amending charter providing additional and substitute provisions on the same subject whereas the city of leavenworth kansas has heretofore adopted charter pursuant to the provisions of c of of the constitution of the state of kansas exempting itself and making inapplicable to it provisions of ksa 132418 and providing substitute provisions on the same subject  and whereas c4 provides that a charter be amended by charter ordinance now therefore be it ordained by the governing body of the city of leavenworth kansas that pursuant to the provisions of c4 of of the constitution of the state of kansas the city of leavenworth does hereby amend charter providing the following substitute provisions on the same subject that the waterworks board shall have the exclusive control of the water plant and shall be charged with the duty of producing and supplying the city and its inhabitants with water for domestic and industrial purposes and for public use in the city  and may sell and dispose of any water outside of the city for such purposes said board may control lines and give service outside the boundaries of the city said board shall have authority to enter into agreements to sell water to any township which has a water distributing system and may deposit moneys received under any such agreement to the credit of the joint account of the township and the water board it shall have power to hire and discharge all employees agents and officers of the water department and fix their compensation and purchase all machinery tools and other appliances and all materials and supplies necessary for the purposes of said department and may in the name of the city take and hold by purchase gift devise bequest or otherwise such franchises and real or personal property either within or without the city as may be needful or convenient for the carrying out of the intended purposes for which it is established provided that the waterworks board shall not lease lease purchase purchase or otherwise acquire interest in real property the total consideration of which shall equal or exceed $10000000 without the approval of the governing body of the city of leavenworth kansas it shall be the duty of the governing body of the city when requested by the waterworks board to enact such ordinances as may be deemed necessary for the protection of the water plant and to institute condemnation proceedings whenever in the judgment of the waterworks board private property should be taken in the name of the city for water plant purposes the waterworks board may establish all reasonable rules and regulations to protect the rights and property vested in the city and under control of the board  may issue vouchers or warrants in payment of all claims and accounts incurred by said board which vouchers or warrants when approved by the board shall be authority to the city treasurer to pay and charge the same against the proper funds and shall also have such other powers as may be necessary for the proper discharge of its duties that this ordinance shall be published once each week for two consecutive weeks in the official city newspaper any sections in conflict herewith be and the same are hereby repealed this is a charter ordinance and shall take effect 61 days after final publication unless a petition for referendum is filed and the referendum held on the ordinance as provided by c under the constitution of the state of kansas or unless the governing body submits said ordinance to a referendum without petition in which case the ordinance shall become effective if it be approved by a majority of the electors voting thereon passed by the governing body not less than twothirds of the memberselect voting in favor thereof this 14th day of august 1990 scarolyn a tillotson mayor attest scarol sadler city clerk passed and approved  published  and  no 35  park and community activities advisory board charter a charter ordinance relating to park and community activities advisory board exempting the city of leavenworth kansas from provisions of ksa 121915 amending charter providing substitute provisions on the same subject and repealing be it ordained by the governing body of the city of leavenworth kansas that pursuant to the provisions of c of of the constitution of the state of kansas the city of leavenworth kansas hereby elects to and hereby exempts itself from and makes inapplicable to it ksa 121915 and provides the following substitute provisions on the same subject 1 the park and community activities advisory board shall consist of nine members to be appointed by the governing body of the members first appointed three members shall be appointed for a term of one year three members shall be appointed for a term of two years and three members shall be appointed for a term of three years thereafter all appointments except to fill vacancies shall be for three years vacancies shall be filled by appointment for the unexpired term the appointments shall include one representative from the education community such as a teacher or administrator one representative from the chamber convention and visitors bureau and the remaining seven members shall be selected from the city at large this ordinance shall be published once each week for two consecutive weeks in the official city newspaper any sections in conflict herewith and in particular charter be and the same are hereby repealed this is a charter ordinance and shall take effect 61 days after final publication unless a petition for referendum is filed and the referendum held on the ordinance as provided by c under the constitution of the state of kansas in which case the ordinance shall become effective if it be approved by a majority of the electors voting thereon passed by the governing body not less than twothirds of the memberselect voting in favor thereof water work sewage disposal plant electric light plant crematory desiccating or reduction work or other public utility plant owned by the city and for the purpose of rebuilding adding to or extending to the same from time to time as the necessities of the city may require the city may borrow money and issue its bonds for the same  provided that no bonds shall be issued for such purposes unless the same were authorized by a majority of the votes cast at an election held for that purpose  provided further that the city of leavenworth may issue the bonds of such city for the purpose of paying for any of the improvements mentioned in this section and the land necessary therefor without such bonds having been authorized by a vote of the people but the total amount of bonds issued for such purpose shall not exceed in any one year an amount equal to 1686% of the amount of revenue produced for the tax year two years preceding the year of bond issuance example revenue for the tax year 1992 received by the city of leavenworth from the one percent countywide sales tax if the same is approved by the voters whereas the board of county commissioners of leavenworth county kansas has adopted a resolution providing for a one percent county wide retailers sales tax and directing submission of the question to the electors of the county at the election to be held on the 5th day of november 1996  and whereas the board of county commissioners has also adopted a resolution providing that the county share of the county wide retailers sales tax shall be used to pay for bonds issued to acquire a site construct andor equip a jail and judicial center  and whereas the governing body of the city of leavenworth kansas desires to pledge pursuant to the provisions of ksa 12137 all of the citys share of the sales tax funds to be received by the city from such tax if the same is approved by the voters for specific projects  now therefore be it ordained by the governing body of the city of leavenworth kansas that the general purposes for the future use of the citys share of the countywide sales tax is pledged as follows a the city shall annually remit to the leavenworth county treasurer an amount prorated in conjunction with the incorporated cities of leavenworth county an amount sufficient to pay the principal and interest or general obligation bonds issued by the county to finance the judicial center said bonds to be amortized over ten years and not to exceed $2170000000 in principal amount b the city shall use a part of the share of the sales tax revenue to pay principal and interest costs associated with that portion of the judicial center for the use of the leavenworth police department and municipal court this estimated share of the project cost is 20 percent or $47 million c the city shall use a part of the share of sales tax revenue to pay the principal and interest costs for the expansion and renovation of fire station no 2 on lawrence avenue and the construction of a new fire station in southwest leavenworth to include site acquisition and related expenses the estimated cost of the fire station improvements is $43 million d the city shall use the balance of its share of the sales tax revenues for street construction street reconstruction sidewalks curbgutter replacement and storm drainage improvements the estimated amount of the sales tax revenue to be available for these projects is estimated at $36 million that this ordinance shall be passed in accordance with the requirements of ksa 12137 requiring twothirds  23  vote of the members elect of the governing body and shall be published once each week for two consecutive weeks in the official city newspaper that this ordinance shall take effect sixty days after its final publication and if within sixty days of its final publication a petition signed by a number of electors of the city equal to not less than ten percent of the number of electors who voted at the last preceding regular city election shall be filed with the county election officer demanding that such ordinance be submitted to a vote of the electors it shall not take effect until submitted to a referendum and approved by a majority of the electors voting thereon that this ordinance shall be effective on passage and publication as provided by law sphil urban mayor attest scarol sadler city clerk passed and approved  published august 30 and  no 39  fire and police department retirement system charter a charter ordinance relating to employees retirement system  fire and police department  exempting the city of leavenworth kansas from provisions of ksa 1314a05 1314a06 and 1314a08  amending charter   and providing substitute provisions on the same subject be it ordained by the governing body of the city of leavenworth kansas that pursuant to the provisions of c of of the constitution of the state of kansas the city of leavenworth kansas hereby elects to and hereby exempts itself from and makes inapplicable to it ksa 1314a05 1314a06 and 1314a08 and provides the following substitute on the same subject 1 definitions a effective date of retirement or discharge for the purposes of pay computation under the terms of this ordinance the effective date of retirement or discharge shall be the last day of the month in which same occurs b monthly salary the term monthly salary as used in this ordinance shall mean the greater of the following two methods of computation 1 the monthly salary at the date of retirement including base pay incentive pay holiday pay educational incentive and 112 of the cash value of 40 percent of accrued sick leave 2 the average of the last 12 months of employment which will include base pay longevity pay holiday pay educational pay and overtime pay plus 112 of the cash value of 40 percent of accrued sick leave 2 payments upon retirement or discharge from police or fire department any officer or member of any such police department or fire department having served 22 years or more in such department and having reached the age of 50 years may make application to be retired and if such application is made and respective board of trustees shall retire such officer or member and shall pay him monthly payments in an amount equal to 50 percent of his monthly salary or if he be discharged from such department by reason of disability or if he be discharged for any reason except conviction of a felony after having served 22 years or more in such department the respective board of trustees shall order and direct that said person upon attaining the age of 50 years be paid monthly payments in an amount equal to 50 percent of the monthly salary provided that any officer or member of such police department or fire department having served eight years or more on such department and having reached the age of 60 years may make application to be retired and if such application is made the respective board of trustees shall retire such officer or member he shall be entitled to receive a retirement benefit equal to two percent of his final annual salary multiplied by the number of years of credited service provided that in addition to the above the following amount shall be paid monthly if retired prior to  the sum of $27400 per month  if retired between  and  the sum of $22400 per month  if retired between  and  the sum of $14900 per month  if retired between  and  the sum of $10900 per month  and if retired between  and  the sum of $5900 per month provided further that future cost of living adjustments to the fire and police department retirees covered by provisions of ksa 1314a02 et seq may be granted by adoption of the annual budget without further amendment of this charter ordinance provided that in no event shall retirement benefits paid hereunder be less than $52400 per month provided further that in determining the number of years of credited service a fractional year of six months or more shall be considered as one year and a fractional year of less than six months shall be disregarded 3 designation of funds investment the amount of money derived from taxes herein levied from assessments dues or donations for the benefit of such funds to be known and designated respectively as the policemens pension fund and the firemens pension fund which funds shall be devoted exclusively to and for the purposes hereinafter enumerated all monies derived from the taxes so levied and money received from the other sources as above enumerated shall be paid into the policemens pension fund or firemens pension fund all monies accumulated under the provisions of this act shall be deposited by the treasurer in the same manner as other city funds  provided however the board of trustees may at their option invest any of said reserve funds in direct obligation bonds of the united states of america maturing or redeemable at part and accrued interest within three years from the date of purchase or in bonds of any municipality in the state of kansas the total bonded indebtedness of which is less than 15 percent of the total assessed tangible valuation of such municipality which bonds shall mature within five years from the date of purchase 4 membership fee and contributions by officers and members of department refunds  limitations every new officer and member of said police and fire departments shall be required to pay to the treasurer of said board a membership fee of five dollars and there shall be deducted from the salary of every officer and member of each department seven percent of his monthly salary which shall be paid into the respective pension funds any officer or member whose services for any reason whatsoever shall be terminated with the department shall be entitled upon demand to be paid within 30 days after such demand the total amount of the deduction from his salary paid into said funds  provided that in the event such officer or member shall renew his services with said department he shall as a condition of employment return to said fund the amount withdrawn that any provisions of any ordinances in conflict herewith and charter be and the same are hereby repealed and approved  published september 15 and 22 1996 no 40  purchasing practices for certain city improvements charter a charter ordinance relating to purchasing practices for certain city improvements  exempting the city of leavenworth kansas from ksa 131017 and providing substitute provisions on the same subject the city of leavenworth kansas a commissionmanager city of the first class by the power invested in it by of the constitution of the state of kansas hereby elects to and exempts itself from and makes inapplicable to it k sa 131017 said section applying only to cities of the first class and provides substitute and additional provisions as hereinafter indicated estimate of cost of improvements  contracts  bids  bond issue  when before undertaking the construction or reconstruction of any sidewalk curb gutter bridge pavement sewer or any other public improvement of any street highway public grounds or public building or facility or any other kind of public improvement in the city of leavenworth is commenced or ordered by the governing body or under its authority a detailed estimate of the cost of the improvements shall be made under oath by the city engineer or some other competent person appointed for such purposes by the governing body such estimate shall be submitted to the governing body for its action thereon in all cases where the estimated cost of the contemplated building facility or other improvement amounts to more than $10000 sealed proposals for the improvement shall be invited by advertisement published by the city clerk once in the official city paper the governing body shall let all such work by contract to the lowest responsible bidder who submits a responsive bid if there is any whose bid does not exceed the estimate if no responsible person proposes to enter into the contract at a price not exceeding the estimated costs all bids shall be rejected and the same proceedings as before repeated unless waived by the governing body if no responsible bid is received within the estimate the governing body shall have power to make the improvement within the estimated costs thereof and shall further have the power to purchase the necessary tools machinery apparatus and materials  employ the necessary labor  and construct the necessary plant or plants for the purpose of carrying into effect the provisions of this charter ordinance before any type of public improvements is commenced the money to pay for the same must be available in the city treasury as provided by law  or provision may be made for the issuance of internal improvement bonds to pay for any such improvement as provided by law this section shall not be construed to include any repair or maintenance work not amounting to substantial alteration addition or change in any structure street or facility public improvement as used herein shall not include the making of repairs or the maintenance of any building street sidewalk or other public facility in the city by employees of the city or the making of any expenditures from the city budget for such purposes that any future modification to the $10000 cost provision stated in section 2 of this charter ordinance can be made by simple ordinance this charter ordinance shall be published once each week for two consecutive weeks in the official newspaper for the city of leavenworth kansas this is a charter ordinance and shall take effect 61 days after final publication unless a sufficient petition for a referendum is filed and a referendum held on the ordinance as provided in subdivision c3 of the constitution of kansas in which case the become effective if approved by the majority of the electors voting thereon passed by the governing body of not less than twothirds of the memberselect voting in favor thereof this 27 day of may 1997 seric j thompson mayor attest scarol sadler city clerk passed  published june 2 and 9 1997 no 41  general purposes for use of city tax charter editors note charter enacted  pertaining to the use of a one percent city tax increase was never approved by the voters but has been included per citys instructions no 42  water works department charter a charter ordinance relating to the water works department amending charter providing additional and substitute provisions and providing for optimal fluoridation of the water to protect childrens oral health whereas the city of leavenworth kansas has heretofore adopted charter pursuant to the provisions of c of of the constitution of the state of kansas exempting itself and making inapplicable to it provisions of ksa 132418 and providing substitute provisions on the same subject  and whereas c4 provides that a charter be amended by charter ordinance  and whereas it is deemed advisable to provide for optimal fluoridation of the water to protect childrens oral health now therefore be it ordained by the governing body of the city of leavenworth kansas pursuant to the provisions of c4 of of the constitution of the state of kansas the city of leavenworth does hereby amend charter providing the following substitute provisions on the same subject that the waterworks board shall have the exclusive control of the water plant and shall be charged with the duty of producing and supplying the city and its inhabitants with water for domestic and industrial purposes and for public use in the city  containing optimal fluoridation to protect childrens oral health and may sell and dispose of any water outside of the city for which purposes said board may control lines and give service outside the boundaries of the city said board shall have authority to enter into agreements to sell water to any township which has a water distributing system and may deposit moneys received under any such agreement to the credit of the joint account of the township and the water board it shall have power to hire and discharge all employees agents and offices of the water department and fix their compensation and purchase all machinery tools and other appliances and all materials and supplies necessary for the purposes of said department and may in the name of the city take and hold by purchase gift devise bequest or otherwise such franchises and real or personal property either within or without the city as may be needful or convenient for the carrying out of the intended purposes for which it was established provided that the waterworks board shall not lease lease purchase purchase or otherwise acquire interest in real property the total consideration of which shall equal or exceed $10000000 without the approval of the governing body of the city of leavenworth kansas it shall be the duty of the governing body of the city when requested by the waterworks board to enact such ordinances as may be deemed necessary for the protection of the water plant and to institute condemnation proceedings whenever in the judgment of the waterworks board private property should be taken in the name of the city for water plant purposes the waterworks board may establish all reasonable rules and regulations to protect the fights and property vested in the city and under control of the board  may issue vouchers or warrants in payment of all claims and accounts incurred by said board which vouchers or warrants when approved by the board shall be authority to the city treasurer to pay and charge the same against the proper funds and shall also have such other powers as may be necessary for the proper discharge of its duties that this ordinance shall be published once a week for two consecutive weeks in the official city newspaper any sections in conflict herewith be and the same are hereby repealed this is a charter ordinance and shall take effect 61 days after final publication unless a petition for referendum is filed and the referendum held on the ordinance as provided by c under the constitution of the state of kansas or unless the governing body submits said ordinance to a referendum without petition in which case the ordinance shall become effective if it be approved by a majority of the electors voting thereon passed by the governing body not less than twothirds of the memberselect voting in favor thereof this 22nd day of august 2000 sken bower mayor attest scarol sadler city clerk published august 24 and 31 2000 no 43  municipal housing authority charter a charter ordinance exempting the city of leavenworth kansas from the provisions of the municipal housing law ksa 172337 sa 172365 and providing substitute and additional provisions relating to the establishment operation and maintenance of a housing authority be it ordained by the governing body of the city of leavenworth kansas that the city of leavenworth kansas under the authority of of the constitution of the state of kansas hereby elects to exempt itself from and make inapplicable to it ksa 172337 sa 172365 which applies to said city but the provisions of which do not apply uniformly to all cities and to provide substitute and additional provisions on the same subject it is deemed necessary and in the best interest of the city that a municipal housing authority of the city of leavenworth kansas be and the same is hereby established that the municipal housing authority board of directors shall consist of the five elected city commissioners and one public housing resident appointed by the mayor and approved by the governing body of the city and whose duties responsibilities and terms of office shall be those hereinafter enacted by resolution this charter ordinance shall be published once each week for two consecutive weeks in the leavenworth times the official newspaper for the city of leavenworth kansas that this is a charter ordinance and shall take effect 61 days after final publication unless a sufficient petition for a referendum is filed as provided in subdivision c3 of the constitution of the state of kansas in which case the become effective if approved by a majority of the electors voting thereon passed by the governing body no less than twothirds of the membershipelect voting in favor thereof this 18th day of december 2001 sphil urban mayor attest scarol sadler city clerk editors note charter was repealed by charter no 44  alcoholic liquor sales charter a charter ordinance exempting the city of leavenworth kansas from the provisions of the ksa 41712 prohibiting alcoholic liquor sale on certain days and hours and providing substitute and additional provisions on the same subject allowing alcoholic liquor sales on sunday and certain holidays whereas the city of leavenworth kansas is authorized to exercise the powers functions and duties of a city of the first class including homerule powers in the manner and subject to the limitations provided by of the constitution of the state of kansas  and whereas ksa 41712 was adopted in 1949 as part of an enactment of the session laws that contained statutes that were nonuniform now therefore be it ordained by the governing body of the city of leavenworth kansas the city of leavenworth kansas by the power vested in it by of the constitution of the state of kansas hereby elects to and does exempt itself and make inapplicable to it ksa 41712 which applies to this city but is part of the enactment commonly known as the kansas liquor control act as enacted in of the session laws of 194 which enactment applies to this city but which does not apply uniformly to all cities and to provide substitute and additional provisions on the same subject the following is hereby substituted for the provisions of ksa 41712 as amended sale at retail  forbidden on certain days  hours of sale exception no person shall sell at retail any liquor 1 on thanksgiving day or christmas  or 2 before  am or after  pm monday   or 3 before  am or after  pm on sunday this charter ordinance shall be published once each week for two consecutive weeks in the official city paper this charter ordinance shall take effect 61 days after the final publication unless a sufficient petition for a referendum is filed requiring a referendum to be held on the ordinance as provided in of the constitution of the state of kansas in which case this charter ordinance shall become effective upon approval by a majority of the electors voting thereon passed by the governing body not less than twothirds of the members in favor thereof the 3rd day of june 2003 no 45  cereal malt beverages sales repealed charter no 46  cereal malt beverages levy amending charter providing additional and substitute provisions on the same subject whereas the city of leavenworth kansas has heretofore adopted charter pursuant to the provisions of c of of the constitution of the state of kansas exempting itself and making inapplicable to it provisions of ksa 121697 and providing substitute provisions on the same subject  and whereas c4 provides that a charter ordinance may be amended by charter ordinance now therefore be it ordained by the governing body of the city of leavenworth kansas that pursuant to the provisions of c of of the constitution of the state of kansas the city of leavenworth kansas does hereby amend charter providing the following substitute provisions a in order to provide revenues to promote tourism and conventions the governing body of the city is hereby authorized to levy a transient guest tax not to exceed the rate of seven percent upon the gross receipts derived from or paid by transient gas for sleeping accommodations exclusive of charges for incidental or facilities and any hotel motel or tourist court the percentage of such tax shall be determined by the governing body of the city and shall be specified in the resolution authorizing the same b any transient guest tax levied pursuant to this section shall be based on the gross rental receipts collected by any business c the taxes levied pursuant to this section shall be paid by the consumer or user to the business and it shall be the duty of each and every business to collect from the consumer or user the full amount of any such tax or an amount equal as nearly as possible or practicable to the average equivalent thereto each business collecting any of the taxes levied hereunder shall be responsible for paying over the same to the state department of revenue in the manner described as ksa 121698 and the state department of revenue shall administer and enforce the collection of such tax d the transient guest tax authorized by this section shall not be levied until the governing body of the city has passed a resolution authorizing the same that the governing body of the city of leavenworth kansas is hereby authorized to make future amendments of the transient guest tax by regular ordinance that this charter ordinance shall be published once each week for two consecutive weeks in the leavenworth times the official newspaper of the city of leavenworth kansas that this is a charter ordinance and shall take effect 61 days after its final publication unless a sufficient petition for a referendum is filed as provided in subdivision c3 of the constitution of the state of kansas in which case the ordinance shall become effective if approved by a majority of the electors voting thereon passed by the governing body not less than twothirds of the members elect voting in favor thereof this 13th day of april 2004 no 49  municipal housing authority charter a charter ordinance repealing charter which the future use of the revenue to be received by the city of leavenworth from the one percent of countywide sales tax if the same is approved by the voters whereas the board of county commissioners of leavenworth county kansas has adopted a resolution providing for a one percent countywide retailers sales tax and directing submission of the question to the electors of the county at the election to be held on the 5th day of april 2005  and whereas the governing body of the city of leavenworth kansas desires to pledge pursuant to the provisions of ksa 12137 all of the citys share of the sales tax funds to be received by the city from such tax if the same is approved by the voters for specific projects  and whereas the governing body of the city of leavenworth kansas further supports a sunset limitation of ten years for the countywide sales tax now therefore be it ordained by the governing body of the city of leavenworth kansas that the general purposes for the future use of the citys share of the countywide sales tax is pledged as follows a debt retirement each year 15 percent of the citys share of the annual countywide sales tax revenue will be used to retire outstanding city bonded debts b infrastructure the city shall use a part of the sales tax revenues for infrastructure to include street construction street reconstruction sidewalk construction curbgutter replacement and storm drainage improvements c capital projects the city shall use a part of the sales tax revenue for other capital projects such as maintenance and improving public facilities and grounds d economic development the city shall use the balance of the sales tax revenue to assist in developing recruitment and retention of industrial commercial and retail development projects and to facilitate growth and development in industrial downtown and commercial corridors that this ordinance shall be passed in accordance with the requirements of ksa 12137 requiring twothirds vote of the members elect of the governing body and shall be published once each week for two consecutive weeks in the official city newspaper that this ordinance shall take effect 60 days after its final publication and if within 60 days of its final publication a petition signed by a number of electors of the city equal to not less than ten percent of the number of electors who voted at the last preceding regular city election shall be filed with the county election officer demanding that such ordinance be submitted to a vote of the electors it shall not take effect until submitted to a referendum and approved by a majority of the electors voting thereon that this ordinance shall be effective on passage and publication as provided by law passed and approved 01252005 no 51  park and providing substitute provisions on the same subject  and whereas c4 provides that a charter be amended by charter ordinance now therefore be it ordained by the governing body of the city of leavenworth kansas that pursuant to the provisions of c of 12 of the constitution of the state of kansas the city of leavenworth kansas does hereby amend charter providing the following substitute provisions a in order to provide revenues to promote tourism and conventions the governing body of the city is hereby authorized to levy a transient guest tax not to exceed the rate of ten percent 10% upon the gross receipts derived from or paid by transient gas for sleeping accommodations exclusive of charges for incidental or facilities and any hotel motel or tourist court the percentage of such tax shall be determined by the governing body of the city and shall be specified in the resolution authorizing the same b any transient guest tax levied pursuant to this section shall be based on the gross rental receipts collected by any business c the taxes levied pursuant to this section shall be paid by the consumer or user to the business and it shall be the duty of each and every business to collect from the consumer or user the full amount of any such tax or an amount equal as nearly as possible or practicable to the average equivalent thereto each business collecting any of the taxes levied hereunder shall be responsible for paying over the same to the state department of revenue in the manner described as ksa 121698 and the state department of revenue shall administer and enforce the collection of such tax d the transient guest tax authorized by this section shall not be levied until the governing body of the city has passed a resolution authorizing the same that the governing in the official city newspaper this charter take effect sixtyone 61 days after its final publication unless a sufficient petition for a referendum is filed and a referendum held on this charter
